4LyIBZqTvSKmrn87TsY6qw.text: My friend claimed Roland's had zeeee best lobster roll, so we stopped in Roland's on a rainy day.  We were seated right away (given we had to sit outside in the cold) and split a $16 lobster roll. When it came out, I was kind of like.... "that's it?" Nonetheless, we split it.  There just wasn't that much lobster in it. And the lobster in it..was just ok. And then it was on some greasy garlic bread. I don't know...I just wasn't a fan. Plus, our waitress took forever to show up again...  I don't know, I wasn't too impressed with Roland's, but maybe I haven't tried what other things it may have to offer?

kYpvLvOmTL527CorMJoaqw.text: Delicious lobster roll!! It came with fries and coleslaw and a pickle. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because there was more bread than I would've liked and too much butter. But the lumps of meat made it a stand out. I'd go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll goodness

0nFd_a6fAHSv-kGaoG1JZA.text: Been going here for years, but def slipped down hill. The place was filthy and the manager was literally bothered when we told him and asked what am I supposed to do? Then told us if we don't like it to leave. Everyone was like did that really just happen. The only good thing that came out of it was the bartenders didn't charge us for half the stuff we had... and not on purpose.. they were just that out of it they had no clue what was going on. Definitely won't be going back there. Way too many other great places in Pittsburgh. Don't waste your time.

39uKvlSkZPDLoD8Ia7De-Q.text: We were in the strip district shopping and happened upon this lovely place. We were greeted with a warm welcome and were seated on the upstairs patio. Our waiter was great, very personable and friendly, attentive but not over bearing with checking in on us. We ordered crab cakes which were outstanding and a few other appetizers. Their drinks were exceptional. All around great great great! This establishment understands customer service and we can't say enough nice thinks about our server. Thank you all.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UOpFwaPBiBjciEdGlPGspg.text: Pasta di mare was fantastic. The servers are strange and they seem like they aren't sure who has what table, but whatever the food made up for it.

V8PeQwO_2oLmFtT53ns3rA.text: Second time there and I have ordered food both times. Clam Chowder had lumps of flour and tasted like flour. Lobster roll was dry and salty. If anyone had asked, I would have shared these comments.  The Bloody was okay. I'll drink there again, but won't eat.

-BElZmUowR4NTe4jymkHrA.text: Couldn't tell you about the food because we never got a table. Five of us went there Friday evening 08/15 and our name was put on the list fir a table so we went to the bar to have a drink and wait. While there were 2 empty tables in the same area we were waiting we never got seated. The hostess came and ask us if we still wanted a table and we told he yes but after about 30 minutes one girl went to ask and saw her name was marked out but the hostess told her we would be next but she had to seat the family of 5 who she said were there before us.  We knew they weren't but we said ok. After another 2 tables in the area we were waiting emptied another girl went to the hostess and asked if we were going to be seated and she was told you're next. But I have to seat these people first because they were here first. That was a lie because we wAtched them walk in the door   So finally a manager came over and told us we could sit in the bar area were there were now 6 empty tables or on the dining room side where we could see there were empty tables and booths. By that time we were too mad to stay and starred to leave.  As we were walking out the door the hostess said (in a hateful voice) I was going to get you a table!  Worst customer service ever and by the way all 5 of us are postal workers and we know what good customer service is   Maybe the hostess should be working in the back where she doesn't have to interact with customers

mfsqhEWwRSOMwwhHawwm9A.text: Let's see.... Rolands can be fun to go to for happy hour after work on Friday.  Heck they used to have these two bartenders that if you were a good looking girl at least one would give you a beer or two but making up the difference by overcharging or flat out giving incorrect change back to some male patrons.  Anyhow, they have a somewhat unique upstairs and in the summer they have the balcony that you can sit out on.  One summer night it began to storm and one of their umbrellas flew off the base and cracked me in the head.  I though I was going to pass out, but the bartender just came out gathered the pieces and put them back together folding the umbrella down.  Yea no reason to apologize I just could have been decapitated.  \ Now onto the food.....uh  well....my best suggestion is, if you are on a timed lunch or have limited time for dinner, PICK SOMEWHERE ELSE!  you will only get frustrated with the SLOW AS HELL service.  Suggestions, hmm not entirely sure since nothing I ate here impressed me much.  The lobster roll, I am certain wasn't "real" lobster and was very rubbery, and dry.  Way too much bun to lobster type meat, and overpriced for a sandwich, $15.00 I think.  Next we got the oysters.  6  were supposed to be in an order but they only delivered 5.  But good luck finding the waitress, she showed up 3x's in the hour and half that we were there for dinner.  Not because it took us an hour and half to eat but 15 minutes to get waited on.  15 more minutes for drinks, and to order.  45 minutes for food to come, and I think you get the picture... I wouldn't eat here again, there are many other places to choose from.  Lastly I ordered a draft beer it was warm, told the waiter who got me a bottle but still charged me for both... NICE...

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bucco fever!
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Troegs IPA...

fPRW6-A3dDzScBb9wB5f0g.text: Truly excellent service--our glasses were constantly refilled before we asked and our server was attentive.  The appetizer we ordered, chicken nachos was enough for about 6 people!  Our salads were delicious!  The French onion soup was tasty, but had a little too much bread.  The beer battered shrimp was a bit greasy, but good.  We would return here the next time we are in town.

1C4ugQbEvSahSixEi2MXsg.text: I had not been to Roland's in a few years.  Had an out of town Marine Vet with me.  We were pleasantly greeted and promptly seated upon arrival.  Our server, Brad, came in a reasonable amount of time, took our drink orders and returned promptly with our drinks.  He asked if we needed a "few" minutes to look over the menu.  Twenty three minutes later and he still had not returned to take our orders.  I called a restaurant a couple of blocks away.  We left and had a very nice meal up the street. Don't know if Brad ever returned, but I won't be bringing out of town guests to Roland's again.

LKWUsDrmF1tOvRK-krQ3YA.text: This was our second trip to Roland's and it did not disappoint. My kids LOVED their lobster bisque and since it comes in a huge bowl they were able to split it.  My husband really enjoyed the clam chowder and I had the lobster roll.  Everything was great and our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The bowl of lobster bisque my children split.
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The lobster roll comes with fries and coleslaw and its served on Mancini bread.
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kids grilled cheese and fries

vCa03JnDU9q6Ks-cgno6Jg.text: It's OK to come here for beer and snacks, but avoid anything more complicated than a serving of mussels or the Lobster Roll.   The mussels are fresh and they really do give you a whole lot, but there's not too much broth (The best part of ordering mussels is usually sopping up the broth with bread). The lobster roll has plenty of lobster, it's fresh and tasty, but the roll itself is a bit greasy. It didn't bother me that much, but some people seem to be put off by it.    My wife ordered the "stuffed shrimp platter," which I put in quotes because the "platter" consists of 5 medium/small overcooked rubbery shrimp and some unseasoned overcooked veggies. They charge like $23 for this, which is a complete ripoff.   The service is spotty, and sometimes people feel the need to smoke standing right next to you if you are seated outside, which is really enjoyable (bleh).

CNz4hdaaBF0UcDSwsXrfeA.text: All 3 of us ordered the lobster roll and French fries. Good cold slaw. We loved the French fries. The bread is wonderful. Lots of butter -- very rich.  Also a messy sandwich so order extra napkins! Large area upstairs. Wait staff was excellent. Nice place for lunch on the strip. Casual.

kfqI53FWhb4KrmgX_wAL-w.text: Stopped in here for a Sunday brunch and had a great time.  Ordered the calamari which came with roasted peppers and onions.  Very good choice. For my entree, I had the meat trio pizza.  It was good, not great but had an overall pleasant time at Rolands.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YsB2VkuOoWDDU9k1grN_3g.text: Overall, my experience was okay. We sat at the bar and our bartender was very friendly and helpful. We got the scallop appetizer and it was TO DIE FOR! I will 100% go back for that! That being said, it was downhill from there. We got the lobster roll and lobster ravioli...and both were "ehhh." The lobster roll had a ton of lobster on it (yeah!) but there wasn't any other seasoning or any type of dressing to tie it all together. The lobster  ravioli was the biggest disappointment because it had absolutely NO flavor....I had to grab the salt shaker and even then it barely had a taste. I can't even comment on the lobster inside of the ravioli because the whole thing just tasted like nothing.  I'll go back for the scallops, but wouldn't recommend anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Ravioli.... This was BEYOND disappointing. It had NO flavor what so ever...what a waste!
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The amazing Lobster Roll!!

AJyZPBkOaZeF7e-aFsYerg.text: I've lived in Pittsburgh for what feels like forever and in all of that time, I guess I've never been to the Strip District on a Monday. We didn't realize most of the restaurants are closed on Mondays. Tried Thin Man, closed. Luke Wholey's, closed. We read some less than appealing outdoor menus of a few spots and settled on Roland's Seafood Grill for lunch because they were open and had a sign out front raving about their signature warm Lobster Rolls for $14.99. Ok, we were game.  We've driven hours off the beaten path in Maine for amazing Lobster Rolls at Red's Eats, which sets the standard for what all lobster rolls should be. Massive amounts of fresh lobster piled on top of the bun and drawn butter to dip the excess mound of lobster in is a mouth watering delight!   That couldn't be farther from what you get served at Roland's. The bun was Mancini's, so good start. The lobster was an odd orange color that's not what fresh lobster looks like at all. Nothing was heaped over the bun at all, but honestly after tasting it that part was ok. Combination of a few fresher tasting pieces, some rubbery pieces, and some dry pieces that literally could have been any fish. I skipped the fries, which didn't look all that great on hubby's plate and there was the tiniest container of coleslaw ever as a side that was actually pretty good. Considering I skipped the fries, shouldn't the server have asked if I wanted extra coleslaw knowing it was going to be minuscule?   The upstairs patio was really nice overlooking Penn Ave. and I hear they have a decent happy hour with terrific specials on fresh oysters and beer at the bar. I may give this place another shot based on that but, never again on their lobster roll.

2xGOKmXmJz3_mRs59Tw1wQ.text: How is his place still in business? The food ranges from mediocre to awful.  The calamari in particular might be the worst I've ever had.

x71S9buyLtzBmtYJWi4-IQ.text: I stopped here with my girlfriend after a Steelers game. The bartender was very rude and wouldn't serve us. I was there to see the game with my best friend whom I served in army with. Said we had already had enough. So went to Leftys and had a great time. Manager at Roland's said the bartender is a miserable human being. His parents own the place.

ISID_yOb8t1yc4B6iyAlrw.text: Bring some Mrs. Dash.  Friday night. The front of house staff was relaxed. The service was a touch blase, which normally I find endearing, but it was more Judy Funnie than April Ludgate. The food was bland at best.  We got seated within the estimated wait time, which is always nice. Alas, the bisque tasted like wheat paste. The water was pretty good though.  I may have mentioned this already, but the food didn't actually taste like anything. I had high hopes for my lobster pizza, and then it tasted like nothing. On wet cardboard. Maybe I just ate the box?  If you hate zest, pep, pizazz, and bees knees, then this place is your jam. Else, you will find better value and experience elsewhere.

J5uVfUmp9BwWn406WNXIlg.text: Came here and got the lobster nachos as an appetizer and we're waiting for our pizza, drinking until we got it... Oh yeah we never did.  After an hour and half...  Lobster nachos were unreal - service was absolutely horrible because if you tell a waiter something and the say "sure thing" there's no guarantee you sill get.

ORADD5hkBsEPRT6ve1C3VA.text: Went to Rolands for lunch of a Sunday.  Around 30 beers on draft, but mostly the usual beers; only a few micros.  The actual menus themselves need updating; they're something you'd see in a crappy diner....photocopies stuffed into clear plastic film.    We both got salads; one tuna & one salmon.  Huge pieces of fish that were of decent quality.  The upstairs has a cool balcony to hang out on in the summer.  It's a cool place in strip; I'd recommend stopping by and checking it out.

I5tWgO9ijIFWjg18g5vk3g.text: The atmosphere is nice and the decor is also. I had the lobster roll salad with no roll. It didn't have much flavor but the lobster was fresh and they give you a good portion. Everything else my friends had was just so so. For the price its not where I would go again for sea food.

_YvqCkBfRtAUBzehaDaP2g.text: We spent a few hours here on the day of the St. Patrick's Day parade, and had a great time.  The space is pretty large, with indoor and outdoor seating.  They have something like 500 beers; a major plus! We sat upstairs, and because the kegs are kept in the basement, they can't get beer all the way up there.  That means you have to order bottled beer from the waitress but can go downstairs and order draft beers.  That's sort of weird.  Anywho-- I had a caesar salad and french onion soup.  Both were tasty, and the other people in my party liked their food too-- pizza and burgers.  The waitress was super friendly.  I'd like to go back and enjoy their upstairs patio & a lobster roll!

YPPcDi9JLepVNRyWmYEZNQ.text: My boyfriend and I visited on a Saturday afternoon. We tried mussels, clam chowder, jumbo shrimp cocktail and a burger.  The mussels were an appetizer portion and were enough for three people. They were perfectly cooked and very sweet.  The shrimp are sold a la carte. I ordered 6 of them, and was a bit let down that 2 of them were a bit dry. The cocktail sauce served with the shrimp had wonderfully spicy horseradish and was perfect.  The New England clam chowder was not overly thick and had lots of clams in it. Lastly, the burger, topped with gorgonzola cheese came with fries and cole slaw and was excellent.  The only reason I give this review 3 stars is because our waiter got overwhelmed by a few large parties and disappeared on us.  We had to flag down the hostess to get our waiter to bring us our check. Other than some dry shrimp, and the service issue, we had an enjoyable dinner.

plcE20gluyoC_IsgFsqkEw.text: The people aren't lying. This lobster roll is drenched in butter and guaranteed to be a key contributor in your untimely death. You better love it or leave it alone.

Slh693uio9NX4-4WRlpypg.text: Great mozzarella, tomatoe, basil pizza! Their French onion soup was in point!

vH2drYmHl_zo0luwV-H6Zw.text: As others have said, nice location and sitting on the patio is nice in the warm sunny months, but the food is not anything special.  Fried seafood, decent lobster roll, other non-impressive dishes.  good for a few drinks and a quick bite if in the area.

mzS__DBuJApxbH-fdMF2OA.text: only gets 1 star, because I can't given them 0.  ordered a chicken salad to go and to be nice, it sucked.  awful.  lack of chicken and brown, mushy lettuce.  better off getting a salad from some fast food joint.  I see why this place is hurting for business.

LydyPDZNjtSwHH0GBw4Q7A.text: Fish sandwich was mushy, soggy and generally terrible. 10 minutes later had stomachache. Avoid the fish! Lobster Roll was great.

esJt1aXLfnJrRcWvTcjGxw.text: This was my second time eating at Roland's  seafood Grill the first time I had a great experience the food was excellent the service was great even though they were busy we got really good service and everything was really fresh and good this time the food was needless to say very poorly prepared the service what service we got seemed more interested and everybody but the six people setting at our table. It took a couple of tries to get refills on drinks I asked for a cup of water I didn't even get the cup of water the pasta was more like wedding soup my medium stake was almost completely pink all the way through very undercooked my nieces pasta had more onions in it then it had sauce I will never visit this place again!!! It wasn't that busy tonight but we stood there for almost 15 minutes waiting for them to get us a table. I spoke with the manager and explained my concerns to him I just can't see me spending that kind of money for the experience that I had tonight again.

gNmqN_GPGeBair8K2go_Sw.text: Rolands was the place to go after work each Friday and it was for good reason. The food is good and the prices are fair. I like the fish sandwich because it is freaking massive! The lobster roll is expensive, but well worth it....whereas many lobster rolls are loaded with mayo this one is just large , well seasoned chunks of claw and tail meat on a great roll. Upstairs is great because ... well... the bartenders treat everyone like friends. I have left many times with several craft beers for under $10. The bartenders are also really cool because every now and then they will give you a free beer :)

WrQ-7qepmwddXT0_FN9Bew.text: Overall, the experience here was pretty good.  I had the lobster roll previously and wanted to go back for it a second time on a Friday during lent.  I expected it to be quite crowded during dinner time, however arriving at 6:30 there was no wait for 3.  The lobster roll was pretty good, although I do remember it being better. I wished that there was something extra on the sandwich, such as melted butter. And they raised the price a dollar.  Roland's has a huge draft beer selection. Each of us tried a different beer and they were reasonably priced, around $4.50 each.  I would definitely go back, but not any time soon.

gvYfpNGM2LDtO92tiAKmBg.text: Went on a Wednesday night, not crowded at all. Had to get up and go find someone to wait on our table....overheard who was supposed to be our server telling the hostess she didn't wait on us because she didn't want another table. The food was good, lobster roll and fish sandwiches were great. Service was just awful.

FJVlCwITp_oRBEMYoYp2lg.text: First, I can see why there are many bad reviews here... service leaves a LOT to be desired most of the time.  However, the lobster roll and seafood in general are very good... possibly slightly overpriced but I tend to think that usually because I'm a little on the cheap side at times :-)  If you're looking for a night out with some friends, the bar atmosphere is a lot of fun and in general it is a very cool place.  My family and I have been here countless times so I've had many experiences to justify the four star rating.

cfWg0J5dlON1ZPjfLLr0ww.text: We went on a seafood frenzy here! Ordered all from appetizers. Beer steamed shrimp, raw oysters & clams, regular steamed shrimp, Maryland seafood soup...we ate until we could not eat anymore. Portions were well sized and the price was reasonable.

5wHOtdxshF_59tH_TIEvNg.text: well all I can say not so good. To start our server very friendly but winey I don't care who didn't show up to prep or that the manager had to take tables.  we ordered two ice teas the lobster roll and the filet sandwich each came with fries and slaw.  Well I went to get sugar out of the sugar caddy to find a blood stained band aid stuffed in it, that should have signaled me to leave, but I didn't. we each got our sandwich the fresh cut fries were so cold and hard they had been sitting for awhile. the filet sandwich was good but my lobster roll was so fishey and the bread was saturated with butter it was dripping. Then halfway through lunching one of the umbrellas from the upper roof top deck blew off into the street. it was almost impossible to pay we had to go inside and hunt down the server, the sink in the ladies room was missing the hot water handle. Overall pretty crappy considering I had this lobster roll about three years ago and it was fantastic

kD2Ryw_5MeUL7xOY963Vng.text: This a great spot for a Lobster Roll. Yeah the service is going to be a little slow since it seems like it's always busy here. The food and atmosphere is worth the wait.

IW6R99ZFtEt2tBDPck7VHw.text: Food was not that great...and quite expensive for lunch. Pizzas take forever....and not much variety menu wise. Will not go back.

cV-tS94laYrqTcv5Hfh1BA.text: Food is always on point. Good bar food style. My favorite calimari! John is by far one of the most stellar bartenders around. He will definitely entertain you.

gMeC4A9HyViZeeAiH4pekA.text: We went for dinner on a Sunday night.  It was quite loud, and on the evening of a Steeler's game, but we hadnt anticipated a loud crowd at 5pm.  Then again, we were in Pittsburgh, so it's a given.  The waitress was slow getting around to us.  We felt like an inconvenience rather than a patron. The kids each ordered a pizza and they said it was awesome. I ordered the lobster roll and maybe my expectations were too high given the reviews, but I was disappointed.  My husband ordered the swordfish and he was unimpressed.  I won't be back.

-pxq7B63P2e5wOtHJ6NKTQ.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch while walking the Strip. Lobster roll was excellent. Had a good selection of craft beers. Our waitress was very attentive and personable. We liked that they allow split entrees (we only wanted a light lunch).

c7wFUdxA93L6bhZY6lpnLw.text: This restaurant is excellent! You will not be disappointed! They have excellent fish sandwiches! I got an arugula pizza which was the best I ever had. They give extremely large delicious portions. The calamari was large & perfectly prepared & equally yummy! My daughter had an excellent lobster roll  with huge pieces of lobster. It's a great atmosphere with great service. This restaurant is located in the heart of the strip district and offers outside seating. We go to this place every time we're in town. Unfortunately, I keep ordering the same things because I like them so much so I can't offer much more advice on other dishes.

LdOKU6dragJLKaS0tP6vzQ.text: This is the second year we've had our company Christmas Party here.  The food was outstanding and the service was excellent.  I highly recommend.  Also great place for a drink and excellent seafood.

4BRORb7vP6UaMsYyUHOBqw.text: Not really happy with them . I ordered pasta with shrimp and scallops, but I received only shrimp and when I asked server where is a scallops, he said we are out . So weird . Pasta wasn't salty enough, but price is 22$ , must be perfect for this price . I asked to bring garlic bread , and they brought just plain Italian bread with butter on side :   VERY DISAPPOINTED. I don't think I'm gonna come back again .

WroKKd8rP0rR_e1DRbWtRQ.text: My meet up group wanted to eat dinner here and I was really not sure I wanted to go but changed my mind.  Our group was seated in the main dining area across from a giant screen TV. Our leader asked if we could be seated elsewhere so that we could chat with one another. It was after 5 and the hostess said we could go to another room but we had to be out of there by 6:30. Everyone agreed.  The waitress came and took drink orders first.  When she went to serve us she spilled a beverage right over the table narrowly missing me but hit someone sitting diagonal to me  I thought this was a normal mishap and the area was cleaned up properly.  I was very hesitant about what I wanted to order and decided upon a vegetable salad. Our leader normally treats us to an appetizer and in this case it was chicken nachos. I tried one but could  not taste the chicken but otherwise it tasted okay.  Later when our waitress began serving our main courses I noticed she was spilling sauces on the floor before being placed in front of the guest. I was grateful I ordered a salad. It was nothing out of the ordinary but you could get this same salad anywhere. The person next to me ordered the beer battered giant fish sandwich. He offered me a piece to try and when I bit into it all I could taste was the beer batter. No fish. Enough said.  I was done with my meal and noticed it was 6:20 so I told the group it was time to get up and go so they could have this table.  This is certainly not a place I will go to on my own. There are much better establishments in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish sandwich
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh seafood

Obd1lpgU5kHnS53i2NzkbA.text: I've only eaten here a handful of times and that's because my ex-husband is a musician and his band played here several times (upstairs) over the years.  I really dislike giving bad reviews but the food is bad. It's disappointing because even with a span of not going for several years nothing has changed. The food tastes bland, chewy and microwaved whether it's seafood or a pizza or fries. Cafeteria food that's been sat out all day tastes better. I just don't get it. They have a primo location in the heart of the Strip. I also don't understand how they're still in business and often crowded. My only guess is tourists who like the drink specials/happy hour and get too drunk to realize they're eating terrible food. Ha, that is until the next day when they're sick from the meals ingested while drinking.

cE5vmoeYVq1J5bz3PLf86w.text: It's fine.  This place is fine.    They're slow, yes.  Sometimes you can walk in and stand at the "Please wait to be seated" podium for...five or ten minutes before someone approaches you.  That's probably not fine.    And Thrillist might list the lobster rolls as one of the 50 things you must try when you're in Pittsburgh...but...maybe just visit some coastal venue.  It's fine.  But that's about it.    And they serve oysters.  But they don't know what mignonette sauce is.  Which is fine.  You don't HAVE to know what to serve WITH oysters in order to serve oysters.  It's fine.  It's all fine.    It's pretty clean.  Has outdoor seating.  The food is okay.  I've had better.  I've had worse.    I wouldn't recommend it.  But I also wouldn't warn anyone off it.    Three stars if they paid more attention to getting customers seated and staff didn't walk by the "wait to be seated" sign pretending they didn't notice a line of 10 people slowly building.  (I've had more than two experiences with this.  Okay three.  I've seen this happen three times.  Two were ridiculously long waits.  One was fine.)

y54MhGI-K1w521Q8FjUitw.text: Several weeks ago, my friend's birthday drinking day started at Roland's. I have had dinner and had drinks at many, many different restaurants, but the service here was some of the worst that I've experienced in my entire life. A good sized group (probably 15 or so by the time we left) was gathered upstairs near the bar. So here's what happened:  -Stood at the bar waiting for 5-10 minutes to be served as bartenders walked by, ignoring us -Received grumbling responses from bartenders when we asked for assistance  -Asked for menus and was told that "food would take at least 30-40 minutes" to be served -Food arrived and was left at the bar to get cold, later told that the bartender "didn't see where we were" - we were standing literally 6 feet away from where we had ordered -A friend's food was thrown away - uneaten - immediately after delivery because "it looked like she was done"  What a horrible experience. Thankfully, our later stops were much better. I never plan to return to Roland's and am disappointed that such a well-known Pittsburgh establishment would have such sub-par service.

C-1YaHWT5_CHgXFXHnbXmQ.text: Went here on a work function dinner with a good size team, which I feel often creates a challenge. Even with our team spread over three tables the service was really exceptional. This however was the high point of the evening. The food was not my favorite. I wasn't really crazy about trying a seafood place in Pittsburgh, should have gone with my gut, I'm sure it would be thanking me now. I had the shrimp and grits. The cheese grits were dry, over cooked and fairly tasteless. The shrimp were by far the worst part in that they were so undercooked I could not eat past the first bite. Looks like a great place to have a drink with friends, but keep the crowd small as they could not seat us all together. Would not return here for food again as I saw several plates in our party with more food left than consumed.

ZP78HLXmt0JCErcPd0cnVw.text: A fantastic place in the Strip District of Pittsburgh to enjoy food, beverages, family and friends...and not necessarily in that order. I ordered the seafood stew prepared by Chef Joe...Outstanding!!! My sister ordered New England Clam Chowda, also delicious (I've ordered it before). My other sister ordered beer battered shrimp and side salad, no regrets.  Needless to say,our bartender, Rhett was wonderful! Y'all or Y'enz just gotta go to Rolands.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood Chowda at Roland&#39;s in the Strip

51De1DC8zY1oXzlTrgWC0Q.text: I popped into Roland's while on a Bike Bus Tour in Pittsburgh the other weekend. We had 11 shots and the bartender gave me two pint glasses to thank us for spending three digits on one second's worth of alcohol consumption :) The bathroom was clean, the bartender was cool, and we were in and out of there with our big group in under ten minutes. Got mean mugged by a few families that might have been jealous of all our fun-having, but hey- it seemed like a cool place and I wouldn't mind cozying up to the bar for a cheap beer if I was a local!

XePwLIltuy0WVaWhDOcV5w.text: Stopped by for lunch. Great mussels! And plentiful too! At least a couple dozen in the serving.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Evil Genius Beer Co - Ma! The Meatloaf!
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll (served warm) and classic mussels (back)
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll- served warm on Mancini bread with slaw and fries.

_9tZKesR1JnwyCYOWAxXqA.text: On a visit to Pittsburgh we came on a Saturday afternoon and sat upstairs. Arrived about 12pm and sat outside on the patio, which was pretty empty. The bartender was great, very attentive & helpful on offering suggestions for places to go. We had pizza and lobster Mac & cheese that were OK, my friend said the latter was a bit bland and needed salt & pepper but we were coming from NY so hard to compete with that. The margarita pizza was decent but could've used more cheese especially since there were about 2 pieces with a section missing cheese. Also have 2 upstairs pool tables to rent for only 3$/half hour. Definitely seems like a cool hang out spot.

uW4xPBwuf_Fz9V2MF4bkjw.text: Wanting to try somewhere we had never been, we found ourselves here. I do not like fish & seafood, but my husband loves it. Thankfully they serve a few chicken dishes and the pizzas looked good.  I opted for the Grilled Chicken Nachos,  while my hubby got a bowl of Clam Chowder & Lobster Roll Sliders.   We decided to sit at the upstairs bar, which only had a couple of other people at it.  The bartender seemed a little odd,  but nice nonetheless. We didn't get a ton of attention,  despite the place being pretty empty,  but that's OK because I didn't really feel like being bothered. I ordered a Stoli with orange juice and hubs got a Bloody Mary.  I was pretty surprised that he wasn't asked if he wanted it spicy or not and it looked spicy, which he doesn't care much for. As a server & bartender I realize how important asking if someone wants a spicy BM is. Neither of us finished our drinks as mine was way too strong and his was too spicy.   We took most of our food home since there was so much. Lunch and 2 drinks ran us about $47 before tip.  Can't decide if I will be back or not,  but it is possible.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled Chicken Nachos &amp; Hot Lobster Roll Sliders
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Now THAT&#39;S a bowl of clam chowder!
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cute glassware!

wVQcfkc3FvOQlHHhJ2Gb0w.text: The Calamari Fritti is by far the best Calamari I've ever had. Nice stop for lunch in the strip district.

p1r8OZqgND4QtUI-S8Feqw.text: You don't get much for what you pay for. That being said it's pretty comfortable to Red Lobster quality wise.

O-j8ju52-vBt7vN_faxJ2A.text: We like to come here for brunch on the weekends. As far as the Strip goes, Roland's doesn't usually have a terribly long wait if any.  The food is good, especially if you're a seasoned visitor - you know to order the lobster roll! The best part is the balcony deck on a sunny day with a bloody mary. There are tons of options here for those who don't like seafood- sandwiches, pizza, nachos.

rABIbhXCK6uXygdhtFgphQ.text: I have only been to Rolands for Happy Hour.  I can't say anything about dinner service or food other than Happy Hour items.  It is a great happy hour with $.60 peel and eat shrimp, oysters, wings and clams.  I like the fact that I could go and eat just one oyster, if I felt like it.  Some place you have to get certain increments, but there it can be any odd number.  Sometimes you want 7 of anything, and you get 7 of anything.  (I am not into structure)    The bartenders have always been attentive and polite, yet I have only been there between 3-6 pm and there has never been a crowd.  If anything, go to the happy hour, but go early.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best happy hour ever. 3-6 pm. .60 oysters, shrimp, clams

trNdakCFqV2O8OjfSPVvyw.text: Roland's lobster roll.  You could drive all the way to Maine, but why do that?   Roland's knows not to mess up a good thing.  Butter, lobster, and grilled Mancini bread.  Nothing better South of Massachusetts!

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oIZsbjsGvTnnJfty7YUWVA.text: This is one of the worst experiences I have had at a restaurant. I went with 9 others. They squeezed 10 people into 2 small tables given the restaurant was fairly empty. It was mid March (and not hot outside) and they kept the patio doors open. I repeatedly asked them to close them completely since myself and friends were cold and they would not.   The only way to describe the food is disgusting. -I split the giant beer battered fish sandwich. Given that apparently this place is a seafood place one would think their seafood should be decent... wrong. The fries were cold, and the sandwich and fries were very greasy.  - Our friends got the classic white pizza. Between two of them they finished one piece and couldn't tolerate anymore. I tried a bite of it. It tasted like you were eating a clove of garlic with a bit of dough.  - No one else enjoyed their meals either.  The waiter was terrible. He would take a couple peoples drink or food order and then walk away and repeated this throughout the night. He was not friendly and when we needed something he was no where to be found. Some of the people we were with left early. We had to ask him to clear their cups so  we could move into their space. When he was clearing the table at the end he noticed there was the majority of the pizza left. He asked our friends if they wanted it packed up. They said they didn't like it so they don't want to take it home. He said ok. Thats it- didn't ask why, didn't offer to take it off their bill, didn't apologize, nothing!  Overall the food, service, and atmosphere deserve 1 star. I would not recommend them. In fact, I would go out of my way to make sure no one I know would have to suffer through gain to Rolands.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is what was left of class white pizza at the end of meal. Didn&#39;t seem to alarm the server that no one wanted to eat this or take it.
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Classic white pizza. Do you want pizza with your garlic?

Pf_KY_57uG4rVwS6eMMqiQ.text: I have been to Rolands a few times and have not experienced any of the problems others are saying they have, however, I'm only giving 2 stars because you're in the strip-you can do better than Rolands! I was most recently at Rolands during the steeler season last year. I ordered the crab chowder which I have had every time I have been there and each time it has been excellent. On this most recent visit I ordered the raspberry maple scallop appetizer as my meal. It was a large portion;I could not finish it and my fellow diners were too stuffed to help me. One member of my group ordered the seafood pizza and crushed it-said it was so tasty. My other fellow diner order the stuffed banana pepper app and also said it was good. They have a wide draft selection and if you get there early enough you can grab a seat near the tvs. The bar is usually too crowded to grab a seat at but our service at our table was attentive and quick. On a previous visit, I split a margarita pizza and it was good too so there is a variety of entrees/apps etc to choose from to please any palate.

fTyqCR5ULaMAZxtWpFbAnw.text: I was at Roland's a little over a week ago. Let me be clear: My dad has been in the food service industry for over 35 years, so I understand certain things can't be helped but I also know good service.  Let's start with the beer: I ordered a Coors Light which was very warm. I didnt think much of it, and ordered one of their IPA's off of their extensive beer menu. ( I was impressed)  The IPA was warm.    My girlfriend and I went here and I had the sea and land (lobster stuffed with crab meat and a sirloin steak) with mashed potatoes. She had scallops and shrimp.   I got my steak, which I ordered medium rare, and it was rare, still bleeding. The Lobster was the only good thing about the experience. The mashed potatoes were dry and had no taste.   My girlfriend got halfway through her dinner and had to excuse herself because she got sick.   I don't mind paying $100 for dinner, but I expected a lot more.   I won't be going back.

wn-db0NgMtf_URVYe3vbMA.text: I'm surprised Roland's has such bad reviews. I've never had anything bad here. Their lobster rolls are very good and you get a large portion of lobster in it. The clam chowder is good, their seafood pizza is awesome. I honestly have never had a complaint about their food. The only reason I'm giving them 4 stars is the service is usually pretty slow. Even when we go when not a lot of customers are there, the service still seems to be slow. I would definitely go back.

nyg9Bsn8lqVJEcn7zatQjQ.text: While visiting family from Florida,  they decided to take me here for dinner and I have to say, was quite impressed with the quality of my seafood. Not only were the shrimp and mussels cooked perfectly,  the price was amazing.  Maybe I'm used to paying West Palm Beach prices but $20 for a dozen large  shrimp and a dozen mussels is unheard of.   The atmosphere was bar like  (noisy), large TV, etc but that's what this establishment is and was expected.   Will certainly visit again the next time I'm in Pittsburgh.

7VkIQb9wQXCej__0EepnOg.text: Aah, Roland's. I have only been here exactly 4 times, but have never tried the food. My boyfriend and I always just hit the bar for drinks and we've never stayed very long. A trip to Roland's was always because we were in the Strip for another reason and thought, "Why not?"  There is one bartender in particular there who has served us every time and is super awesome. Very friendly, chatty, cool guy. He knows how to pour a good beer and is up to date on what Roland's has or doesn't have and what he can substitute out for you.   The rooftop and outdoor seating seems really neat, but every time we've gone they've been packed, not surprisingly. Hanging out on their front patio would be a neat people watching spot.

RH66cesq_BorMVv0bbP89Q.text: Been here a few times. I always get the lobster roll which is excellent. Also the stuffed mushrooms which doesn't look that great but are also delicious. Cajun shrimp also was very good (spicy ) and cooked perfect. If it were a little cleaner in there ( restrooms are filthy ) I'd give it 5 stars for the lobster roll alone. I can kind of understand though because of the amount of people in and out. The place is packed on a nice weather weekend day so plan on about a 45 minute wait unless you sit at the bar.

j5u39s-mFXUGFKNToO3tNA.text: I've tried and tried to give this place a chance.  It's upsets me that an establishment like this can exist among so many great places in the Strip.  I end up at Roland's because my boyfriend's co-workers always want to go there for happy hour.  They have a special on oysters and shrimp cocktail, so I ordered those.  The oysters were absolutely disgusting.  They were not fresh, or cleaned very well.  My fingers ended up getting all dirty and they had a gross, gritty taste to them.  They threw the POORLY deveined shrimp on ice, and it ended up soggy.  I had to pick the veins out myself, and after about two I lost my appetite.  As always, the service was terrible.  Next time I'm dragged to a happy hour there, I'll order water.  Never again will I spend money in this place.  YUCK!

QC1X-oqLN9Z9XpHURuLxrw.text: I think one star is being HIGHLY generous for this restaurant. My family and I visited Roland's on a Sunday afternoon for some lunch. It was by far the worst experience at a restaurant I have had. My husband and I both ordered the Lobster Rolls and I order my daughter pasta from the kids menu. It took the staff SO LONG to bring our lunch and when it finally came, my husband and I both got our sandwiches, but my daughter got nothing. Of course she was not happy about that at all, and trying to calm her down, we were giving her our food so that she had something, but she really wanted her pasta. My husband went to talk to the manager, and our server came over but STILL NO PASTA. 15-20 minutes later the pasta finally came out. And of course it was scalding hot. Not only was the pasta so hot that it was inedible (especially for a kid) there was a POOL of greasy butter and oil in the bottom of the bowl. I think my kid ate more of the grease than the actual pasta. It was DISGUSTING. This was such an absolutely horribly disappointment of a restaurant. Not to mention that the lobster roll was not even that great and definitely not worth $16. (Maybe it would have been better if it didn't sit on my plate for twenty minutes while I waited for my daughter's food).   Don't waste your time here, especially if you have kids. The staff (minus our waitress who was really nice and it wasn't her fault) are a bunch of bozos.

DAGAOg17H63vquSrh9ltcg.text: Great. We had the lobster roll, Cajun shrimp, beer battered shrimp, and chicken club. Everything was delicious and came out promptly. The sandwiches are served on thick Texas toast type bread. The seafood was very good and fresh. I'm from MD so I'm very picky about seafood lol. The drinks were yummy and the staff was cool. Went on a Sunday afternoon. It was pretty busy but didn't have to wait very long for an outdoor table. I do recommend :)

Qy_tloGkRjuxPx5EyaDOng.text: Super disappointed in this place. Came here for a paint nite they were hosting and arrived over an hour beforehand to eat. All I ordered was soup and salad in order to be quick and my friends who ordered a lobster roll and shrimp got their food within 20 minutes. 40 minutes later, and ten minutes prior to painting I still had not received mine. On top of that, there was only one bartender working the whole top floor. When we told him I'd have to cancel my order to begin the event he began cursing about the staff at the restaurant- it was incredibly awkward. When the food arrived it was mediocre at best. Will not be coming back to this place unless I'm dragged.

WHyuHEIvPdpH1GZWMmmqdQ.text: It was raining and we were in the Strip district craving some seafood.  We decided to stop by Roland's Seafood Grill.  We were seated right away close to the bar in front of the big screen projector where the US open was playing.  Our orders were taken right away then we waited for 30 minutes before our meals came out.  We were glad for the US Open entertainment.  My dad order the clam chowder soup, which was chunky and bare of any clams.  My mom and I shared a couple of appetizers, the calamari was great but the crab cake was just ok and a bit salty.  Service gets 2 stars and Food gets 3 stars.  Overall, this place gets a 2.5 stars.  If you are caught in the rain and do not have any other choices in the strip area, stop by.  I would recommend scoping out the other restaurants in the area.

xwOigBbH7DHA5zvvqrivUg.text: We wanted to eat there today. Waited for about 10 minutes at the entrance. No hostess coming up. Then she shows up saying that she will be back in another second. After additional 5 minutes we ask her what's going on. She did not apologize and says that it will take another 30 minutes. Really??!! Not the nice way to treat a party of 4 wanting to spend some money.

Gf7luzPzgdJfbLrho6X_jQ.text: We had our company party at Roland's last week and once again they knocked it out of the house. We take the entire second floor and had about 175 guests. The food and service was incredible.  The next days brought many more thanks and compliments. The Carrozzi family treats you like one of their own.  Thanks again guys..Tony D

3AC9bithZ5AZJWA3y6nMyQ.text: It doesn't get much better than this for seafood and cocktails.  While here, we raided the raw bar menu having oysters on the 1/2 shell, raw clams, and their jumbo shrimp. All were fresh and delicious.  Also, they serve a little bit of horseradish on top of their cocktail sauce to add a little extra spice for those who crave it.  The bartender here was helpful, quick, and friendly. He was knowledgable and able to provide beer recommendations based on my taste. In addition, he made excellent mixed drinks.

qZBeli3UG1KKdAtuSr1jmg.text: Extremely disapointed, we signed our receipt for a total of $55 later to find out we were charged $88,  I guess our waitress needed the extra $30.  Never going back, letting our bank handle this one.  Would love to see the receipt copy we left again!

6BVUlx-vmSPwIhLFqcllrA.text: Amazing portions, flavors and service. A must visit for a fish sandwich or oven fired pizza during any trip to the Strip.

HwkmldioQO6R7ENNFhxXGw.text: This place is fun and casual with pretty good food.  The hot lobster roll was slightly tough but had a great flavor.  The real fun is in the raw bar where you get to watch them prepare all of your seafood fresh.  Wood fired pizzas too!  My boyfriend had a fish sandwich that was HUGE and perfectly cooked.  Crispy and tender! Overall it's a little pricey but I'd say worth it.

ohdSFPpIOPUUMUS_gooSnA.text: Wish I could give 0 stars, this is my first time even writing a review, just so I could warn people about this place. The waitress gave me the complete wrong order, and she was air-headed and all over the place the entire time. Forgot our orders twice and had to come back and check with us, she wrote all of our orders on the back of an old receipt and mixed them up over and over again. The place was completely empty and the food took 45 minutes and came out cold. The "shrimp and scallop combo" made me violently ill an hour after I ate only about 1/4 of it. Don't come here, don't waste your money, the food is gross and the service is bad.

SnIppzJqHVxQtBE7Oc4NJw.text: I was only here for drinks, on a Saturday night.  It was decent - the drinks were fairly mixed and priced.  The atmosphere was a bit lacking.  There isn't much personality here, and for a Saturday, I would have expected a bit more of a crowd.  Overall, not bad if you're in the area for a drink; but not a destination.

puf9_c3OhD6nZiBoKCZI9w.text: We had a frustrating and disappointing experience at Roland's, a dining out experience on a recent 4-day visit to Pittsburgh.  First, all of the food was extremely overpriced. The quality was what you would find if you were ordering from a bar...but it was twice as expensive. The $16 I paid for fried cod got me two soggy cod filets, steamed bland vegetables and boring roasted potatoes. I couldn't have tried to make food this poor. It was a Sysco food operation gone wrong: runoff from Houlihan's mixed with Joe's Crab Shack.   The service was so slow that we were cancelling orders due to the delay in bringing them to the table. My dish arrived without any sort of sauce, and we even had to get up and order beer from the bar because our waitress was so behind. It was her "second day on the job," but this is unacceptable. They could have at least comp'd our beers, or offered some other way to make it up (besides coming over to informing us that they had charged the beers to our bill).  Roland's had space available on a Monday night, unlike the other restaurants in the neighborhood. This was really convenient initially, but I now have an idea of why this was the case.

ka9PUkj2xaCRyjWJ5TRmNg.text: Had a business lunch here today, food was good service was good then a cockroach ran across our table.  Needless to say we won't be back!  Yuck!

RQp-8XYY3n4WWO7XnlhU_A.text: I regretted coming here almost immediately. It took 10 minutes just to get our waters. All of our entrees came at different times. My friend ordered the seafood stew and the oysters were extremely chewy and nearly inedible. I had to spit the oyster out in a napkin. This is the first and last time I'm coming here.

EGUnFSy7XQ0SWO-D13vVLQ.text: Not sure why others didn't like this place? I had a great experience.   I had the beer steamed shrimp which was a dozen or so large shrimp steamed in beer. The shrimp were cooked thoroughly but not overcooked or rubbery and they were de-veined which is the mark of a place that knows what are doing.  I'm from FL originally so I'm picky about that.  Try the shrimp with the horseradish and cocktail sauce mixed they give you and it will definitely clear out your sinuses!  My wife had the beer battered fish sandwich, it was great and it had so much cod she gave me half of it just so she could actually fit it on the bun.  This place also has a 4 for $12 Corona special. This place is worth checking out on the strip.

yfhK4QaQ76bMLKp9k53WoQ.text: I am not a picky eater; however, this was perhaps the absolute worst food I have ever been served at a restaurant. My brother and I came in here on Sunday because we were hungry after a day of walking around the strip. Worst decision we have ever made; we actually laughed at how nasty it was. I think that the calamari we were served was actually pieces of chopped up and dyed car tire. Then, my brother got the prosciutto and arugula pizza. there were like 2 pieces of prosciutto on it, and then they thought it would be a good idea to literally just throw pieces of ice cold arugula on top with unmelted parm cheese and some sort of lemon sauce. it was nasty. My chicken sandwhich was also made with rubber chicken. truly a horrifying experience. Oh, and they seated us in a huge room, alone, it was so awkward and the waitress was rude and short. THIS FOOD TASES LIKE PLASTIC. OH YEAH AND THE FRENCH FRIES WERE LITERALLY SOGGY PIECES OF MOIST PLASTIC  HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. do not go here unless you want to throw up

KM5dF54kzhewVj5rMjjLwA.text: Fresh shucked oysters and parm & arugula pizza great!  Quality Pizza crust, hellava lot better than IL Fornio and better price!  And this is a seafood restaurant!  Service was attentive and professional.  Bloody Mary tasted watered - down otherwise you would of gotten 5 stars.

SWMyFcfqQU-RuYTgHIpGiA.text: Tried it out on a workday afternoon, and wasn't disappointed. Came in again another day, and holy crap, these people move at the speed of snails on LSD. Unless your are here for a beer, forget about it.

Cs4PUxxYWU0pqSZ6MK3zJA.text: On a slow night it takes:  20 minutes for water 30 minutes for beer  60+ minutes for soup and raw entrees  Come hungry, leave hungrier and bitter because you wasted time and money.

0UeUeb366k6rA2p_ef4P2w.text: I think a solid 3 stars is a good way to explain and the reason is because there were really great things and really horrible things.   First, we were starving when we pulled in here. Like so fricken hungry we ordered a ton of food lol. So we got the calamari and it was the worst calamari, maybe even the worst seafood, I have ever had. Now, being a seafood place you would think this wouldn't happen. It was sooooo over cooked that it tasted like a rubber band. Then I got a side salad and my husband got a bowl of clam chowder. Salad was great, fresh and the peppercorn dressing was extremely tasty. My husbands chowder....the best soup I have ever had! It was creamy and had a ton of clams in it. I mean it, the best clam chowder by far I have ever had! So at this point we were confused. So I got an Italian style pizza with spicy sausage which, I have to say wasn't bad. The sausage had a kick and it was a crispy crust. The sauce lacked a little, prob just tomatoes. My husband got their famous hot lobster roll and, just like everything else, was enormous and it was pretty good. Roll was buttery and the lobster was cooked well.   The service wasn't bad, just extremely slow. So I really was confused by this place so the only thing I knew what to was to give it 3 stars bc I have no idea if I would come back or not? Maybe the calamari was a mistake? I just don't know. I would come back for the soup for sure...but for a seafood place to mess up fried calamari as an appetizer...come on!

CpnyxcqPR1HDvhrLL6HvRg.text: Really enjoyed our meal. Had the lobster nachos. They were very good. And ordered the lobster roll. It was also good. Only draw back was they brought our salads and then our appetizers almost at the same time. And then our meals came and we were still trying to eat apps and salad. Otherwise very enjoyable.

6jBAwGk3w_OKyKFclqvVYw.text: Service was great, however, the food was mediocre.  Hostess needs to be more educated about the menu, she was unable to give details on menu items. Lets start the with fries that seem to be mandatory with each entree.  They had to be cooked prior to us ordering, or even getting there.  They were cold, limp (pause) and over salted.  The burger was just eh.  Grilled onions seemed to be just warmed on the grill, and the beef patty could have used a bit more flavor.  Fat has the flavor people!  Oh, the floor at our first table was filthy.  Then the table at the second table was filthy.  What's up with that?  Overall, this joint was not that great.

jBf0jUfDe6ejFnwzK0JTsg.text: The wait staff looked like they were bussed in from a homeless shelter. The strange hostesses seated my party of 4, & it took 25 minutes to get our first beers. Ordered an app & left 25 minutes later, the lobster nachos never came, which sucked because I was quote excited about those. The place is gross! There was food & trash all over the floor & I watched several women exit the restroom with very disgusted looks on there face because the restroom was so nasty. This was confirmed by my wife. Skip this place & go anywhere else in the Strip District

FiNPdnIIaoA3tYYzprZ1Ag.text: Fun sports bar. Food was ok at best. Great shrimp cocktail but I wish I had my fish sandwich across the street. Go stillers.

AYbuJJ9eWIN3Ot3osFOc9w.text: I love this place! I've been here twice and it is excellent! So many things to chose from it's hard to have just one thing. I love seafood and always want everything on the menu. The portions are HUGE! If your there with one other person there's no point in getting an appetizer because they are all huge.  The crab spinach and artichoke dip is to die for!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! this place is the perfect spot. They have a huge deck upstairs and huge bar downstairs. The dining area is clean and everyone that works there seems very nice. Def will be returning!

FMyv9w0QvM_y_Cho9PgjWg.text: Not bad.  Not great.  But not bad.   Excellent bang for your buck, especially if you're hungry - got a bowl of soup that I could have bathed in for about five bucks.

orkBhfLrk68JqRHAD4WnRg.text: Came here for lunch and unfortunately spent about 2 hours here because the kitchen was backed up.  Luckily for us we had the time to spare.  Came down to the strip to pick up some stuff for Christmas Eve party and ended here  for some lunch.  I got the lobster roll and it was delicious.  The roll was practically soaked in butter, so that could be an improvement but the lobster meal was great and warm.  They also have a great lobster bisque as well that I'm sure is made from pure cream.  My wife had the crab cake sandwich, and was only mediocre.  It wasn't crispy and bland.  I would come back here again but would so for the lobster roll.  The waiter was great and attentive but the food did take FOREVER to come out.  He did warn us of this and I don't blame him one bit.

1WYOer9JnUt_26xexbCpiw.text: I am only judging this place as a bar, never had the food.  I'd rather give it 2.5 stars.  I came here with a colleague after a long, long travel experience to get to Pittsburgh.    They had a nice collection of beers including some local ones.  The only negative side is that the bartender had almost no knowlege of what the beers were like so we had to just try our luck.  The bartender had never tried any of the beers nor did he care about them.  I would have liked to have more info in order to make smarter choices about which beers to get.  At least one of them I would have avoided if I'd know more about it.  Perhaps he was just not used to encountering a beer geek.  I did pass by the place the next day around lunch and it was full of customers.  For what ever that means.

4VBGMFupB2h3iOq_aXGY1Q.text: Usually I really like this place.  Stopped in after not eating all day, and ordered the "famous" lobster roll.  It took 40  minutes to receive a medium piece of lobster claw on thick Mancino toast.  THATS IT!  Oh and less than stellar fries, with a cup of cole slaw.  I waited with an empty pint glass several times as well...I guess you can't get it right every time.

FrATLcQmOYkz51flSZxRIA.text: I travel quite a bit and always enjoy great food.  I was in town on a business trip and someone recommended Roland's Seafood Grill.  I was seated promptly and given a drink and food menu.  I noticed the beer sampler and thought I would give it a try. I asked the server if I could choose the beers and she said yes.  She went on to explain nearly most of the draft beers I selected were not available as they were having trouble with their taps.   I ordered a flight of beers that arrived after 10 minutes and began tasting them.  They were cold but did not taste fresh.  Next I ordered the famous "Lobster Roll" which comes with fries and slaw.  It took nearly 20 minutes for my food to arrive but looked good at first glance.  The fries were plentiful and hot but greasy.  The lobster roll was served in a large piece of bread that resembled two uncut pieces of Texas toast.  It was buttered and grilled to give it a nice appearance.  The lobster inside was a small amount, cold and tough. The slaw was reasonably good and cold.   The server came back and I ordered a pint of draft beer.  After nearly another 20 minutes she returned, apologized and explained they were having more problems with their tap system and offered me a bottle of Guinness instead of the draft I ordered.  At this point I politely explained I did not want the bottled version and asked for the check.    I would be hard pressed to ever return.  With other great restaurant choices in the area I don't understand why anyone would choose to eat at Roland's Seafood Grill.

GIQHkNUk8peODrLgSc2New.text: We were shopping on a cold day in the Strip District and decided to try this place for lunch because of the sign advertising the hot lobster roll. It was pretty empty; a few early drinkers at the bar and a few couples seated at tables. I ordered a bloody mary which honestly tasted weird, so I'm not sure what was going on there. For food, we ordered clam chowder, a hot lobster roll, and a fish sandwich. The clam chowder was really tasty with good consistency and was a huge serving, much larger than we expected. The hot lobster roll was rich, buttery, and warm, and the lobster was good and fresh. The fish sandwich was gigantic... two huge fillets breaded and fried with tons of french fries. It was a little greasy but pretty tasty. Overall, I was happy with lunch and with the service and I would probably go again for the lobster roll or the clam chowder.

bb8lKshT6zB7GuuGhRuwHA.text: We figured we'd give it a try even though the reviews weren't great.  Brother in law enjoyed his wings and the beer wasn't bad.  Bartender was helpful.

qMfA7fBEe8l4RRvq5XnIBg.text: It was a pretty busy day at Roland's but we were still able to be seated right away. Our server was really nice and recommended great choices from the draft beer list but the service was still pretty slow, probably due to the lunch rush. We just wanted a quick bite to eat so we just ordered some hot wings and a few appetizers. We tried the Crab Spinach and Artichoke Dip which was really tasty but was severely lacking on the crab. It was thick, had great flavor, and was served with the perfect toasted French bread but the crab was just not there which was pretty disappointing. We also tried the Calamari which was lightly breaded and each piece was the size of a jumbo shrimp! The wings were good too but nothing to write home about. The food was tasty and filling but nothing spectacular.

DluZD_Fb3Q15SYNbJhyw1A.text: I've been coming to Roland's for years and usually I have a good experience.  Today, however, I was served by a bartender who apparently is the owners son.  For the first time in my life I added no tip to the bill and made a remark on it about his personality.   Hopefully this guy finds a. Ew line of work.

8bHcVYK_NHTXsYezLp4NxQ.text: Stopped in here last Saturday night on our first trip to Pittsburgh for the Steelers game. Arrived at 7pm and got a table on arrival.   After being seated order drinks and appetizers. Appetizer #1 showed up, no drinks or silverware. Appetizer #2 showed up from the raw bar still no drinks or silverware. Finally got silverware to eat after the first appetizer had been on the table for 10 minutes.   Food came later on wife had the lobster roll or should I say little bit of lobster on a whole lot of Texas toast style bun, the bread and garlic overwhelmed the taste of the lobster. The waitress told my wife she thrower her side of fries away because they looked bad, her replacement side never showed up until I was finished eating my dinner and she was almost done.   I ordered the surf and turf filet and crab cake. Steak was cooked correctly but nothing special about it and the advertised Lump Crab Cake is no where near a real lump style cake.  Not the best service and food.

3fxKZy1N-vQ1VvSCfe324Q.text: Not the type of seafood I was looking for.  Calamari is very bready and poy boy had 5 little shrimp, and the crab cakes are bready. A little disappointed oh and... the mixed veggies were not cooked

CZk_9_KjwTG6I-qY8l_XBA.text: We heard that the crab cakes were great here. Then, we heard that the lobster roll was the way to go! My girlfriend and I settled for the lobster roll coupled with the shrimp po boy sandwich on our first trip to Roland's. We were not disappointed with these choices and will return for a possible reorder!

yGdSfXTmVXrrLAXZBU8Bxw.text: I traveled from Charlotte north Carolina to Pittsburgh on an empty stomach because I could not wait to try the salmon salad that I had read in a review was so delicious.  I was very disappointed when I paid 17 dollars for some  iceberg lettuce , 2  grape tomatoes 3 olives, 2 slices of cucumber and 1 banana pepper. Even the salmon was bland and had no flavor. Some  mixed greens may have made it a little better because the cold fries that came with the salad didn't do the trick. By far one of the worst salads I've ever had.

EUmhGT7VA_iHx_7ruCLbZA.text: Have eaten here twice now.  Once before a Steelers home game when it was super busy and earlier on a slow monday.  Great quality food and service with plenty of options.  Fun atmosphere.

EISMuo-isyko1rWt6SUDVA.text: I had the crab cake sandwich and it was delicious. The fries are crispy and I couldn't stop eating them. I went during the week for an early lunch. The place was fairly empty but the waitress was both friendly and attentive. The fried fish sandwich looked good but it's definitely big enough to share.

UOsLQaZTRDvtAL9J3KmpMQ.text: Great atmosphere! Nice selection of beers on tap. Food is good. I recommend the lobster quesadilla! Parking isn't the best. Good place to watch sports or play pool.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5v1b-BIQ9_MkgbUj_vHIGw.text: Rolands is a place that I usually go to for a drink before or after dinner or after work since I work close by.  We last stopped here on New Years Eve before dinner at a nearby restaurant.  They have a full food menu at Rolands but looking at other reviews and taking to other people that have eaten here I prefer to just order drinks here.     I think this is a good place to watch a sporting event at.  It's usually always busy and a good atmosphere for a big game.  The both upstairs and downstairs bars are laid out nice and open.  The televisions are big and you can easily see them.  I like that a lot.     Good for Rolands that they are busy and the bar is always crowded.  It's just hard to get a beer most of the time.  I don't know if the bartender's are just overwhelmed or not paying attention but it has been difficult to get a drink at first every time I come in here.     They usually have a good amount of drinks on tap which is nice.  If you have a large group the can accommodate you too.  We have had some unofficial events after work here that have been nice.  I just wouldn't order any food here unless I was really hungry and needed an appetizer or something small to get by.         So if you're looking for a good place to hang out and watch some sports with some friends I recommend coming here to have some drinks but there are better places to eat close by in the Strip.

e8JJbUJVLlNIiV3qbiExww.text: Came in for a Sunday lunch on a beautiful day. We were told 15-20 minute wait for a table outside and upstairs. We were sat in less than ten min. Server had a lot of tables but we are patient people. We ordered the sweet chili shrimp, pretty basic app but tasty. Then we split the Sicilian pizza and we were full by the time we finished. Overall atmosphere was great.

Qm_AJSa6PFFC1o71P0oI9g.text: Really bad food. Lobster roll was literally boiled lobster placed on garlic bread, no sauce, no nothing. Rubber texture and tasteless flavor, the rest of the food was bad too. When the waitress asked how are food was, we we're polite, but honest, she asked if we would like to exchange for something, we denied to do so, simply didn't think anything else would be better.

bcK6OviRYG4bsZIsYAPyfw.text: Got lobster roll and lobster nachos for take out. Everything taste great and we were surprised that how much lobster they put in there and it was a very satisfying meal. Not sure on all the negative reviews, but I think this place worth a try. The lobster roll taste garlicie, butterie! Everything I was expecting.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Ur6eQHviCQuLyQtK28RUiw.text: Fun atmosphere, great food and great service!!  Loved the beer battered shrimp,  lobster bisque was amazing!    Stuffed banana peppers were also awesome!  Highly recommend!

9a8iNVjlndgwE1zkFgjtEA.text: This place used to have appeal for me. Though the food is pricey, the portions are large. My in-laws live out of town and don't get to visit often. However, when they do, they enjoy going to the strip. We decided to go to Roland's and my father in-law paid. After paying he left whatever cash was left as tip. While waiting for my mother in-law, our waiter, Kevin, pulled my father in-law aside and said the standard tip is 15% and he was short of that.  I was so embarrassed I was the one who recommended this place. It wasn't as if he was given pocket change. He was given what he had. We will never return to this place again.

bxvSCStiT-dISXsf5HyFYw.text: Succulent lobster on Mancini bread and fries. You can go low carb and have the lobster over a salad. The key is the lobster. Perfectly done and flavorful. Fun atmosphere in the heart of the strip district. When you come to Pittsburgh, Pa this place is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll sandwich or lobster on salad

5ZEsu37sf25OPMThLPmXRw.text: Great place to eat after the Steelers vs Patriots game.  fish & chips, shrimp po boy, oysters on a 1/2 shell and huge calamari appetizer. Waiter was nice and hospitable. Will come back when in town..  from California..

j-WJ04wGAAJVQDzH9l_szg.text: Never coming back. Received dinner first, then appetizer, then salad. Then waited another ten minutes for silverware. Lobster came raw. Sent back and waited 15 minutes for that to come back. Horrible service and horrible food and not even a simple discount offered by the waitress for all the trouble...

Xb5DgwsMYP_Agqc0Ii5x6Q.text: Good selection of craft beer. We went in there totally unplanned, but found out we weren't in the mood for seafood( PS: it's our first time in Pittsburgh) .., the server was really nice, we got 2 to go beers... which was cool!

LU15KDqYQU1mJpZGHMhj2A.text: Went to the strip district location last night, and the mussels were a major disappointment. This was my third time here, but if it was the first time, I would not go back.  Mussels were dried out!  The service was good, as always.

PE8LfIg3XG3lNA-_4ibezQ.text: Went there recently and received terrible service.  The restaurant was hosting a paint night at the time and it was clear that those not involved in the event were being ignored.  Waited 30 minutes for our drink order to be delivered and an hour for our food to arrive.  I ordered items from the raw seafood bar so no cooking was required.  If an establishment is hosting an event that will consume its staff then they shouldn't seat folks not involved with the event or at least provide warning so we could have made a smarter choice.

P9VawaRunaHAUPpUhSS_LQ.text: We visited Roland's on Sunday for an early dinner and drinks. The hostess at the front felt her conversation about another customer was more important than greeting and seating us. It took about 5 minutes for her to even acknowledge out presence. After we were finally seated, it then took another 10 minutes for a server to take our drink order, in fact, we were just about to leave when he made his way over. I didn't think it could get any worse....but it did. He brought us waters first then our beers, little did we know these were the only drinks we would get. The restaurant's doors were open and the day was hot and humid, perfect for enjoying a lobster roll and cold beer. Our waiter brought our food, we ordered a second round and he was never seen again. I witnessed more apologies to customers that day than I ever have. It wasn't even crowded. Having my own experience in the food service industry, I realize how hard this job can be but this was unacceptable. The type of service you receive will make or break a restaurant and I highly doubt we will be back. This was our second terrible visit and I am not willing to give a third strike chance.

IYwXJgaJUKb7ZK8IxVnRvw.text: dirty bathrooms, weak drinks, waiter didn't remove one plate from our table the whole visit, disgusting boiled seafood platter ($28) consisting of dry tuna, soggy scallops, crab cakes that tasted like mouthfuls of old bay seasoning, and insanely overdone red potatoes.  the shrimp were shrimp.

LyPTpp0ByVpkuY14qMMEJQ.text: The beer selection is great, the atmosphere is awesome and the food is to die for. Get the lobster roll or the steak tip roll. The only thing that baffles me is every time I come here, they always have signs out front giving you specials of the day and every time you come in and ask them about it no one knows what's going on. So please change the signs every once in awhile if you are in fact not giving out those specials anymore.

JVn0kxfO6wn_F41EPn6O7Q.text: I've been here twice. The first time was at least two years ago and I can't remember anything in particular about it.  The second time, though, was tonight, Valentine's Day. A group  of friends and I chose this restaurant after the place we wanted to go was closed--for good. Roland's was it, then. It wasn't very crowded, so we were seated right away. The first thing that caught my attention was how the waitresses/waiters were dressed. They weren't dressed how I would have expected them to be. They were in jeans and baggy tshirts. But, our waitress was helpful, and our food came out pretty quickly. it wasn't a memorable meal or experience. I wanted a caesar salad with my dinner, but they were out of romaine lettuce (and it wasn't late in the evening--maybe 6:30pm at the latest). The bleu cheese dressing, though, tasted pretty good. I ordered a ravioli dish for my entree, but when I asked if I could get a different sauce, the waitress said it's already mixed together, meh. I'm not a fan of that. When my friends went to order their pasta dishes, they had a choice between penne and linguini, but the restaurant was out of penne, too.  Oh well, the prices aren't terrible, and the good came out pretty quickly, and hot. It's not the best restaurant, but it's not a stink hole, either.

_wJzmiT49BBCAI0PhEyvSw.text: I used to be a frequent visitor of Roland's...the food was always good and the beer was always cold.....well not this particular Friday afternoon. I went there with a friend just after the lunch rush....we sat at the bar, because we a little short on time. There was only 1 bartender working so the service was a little slow. We ordered 2 beers and 2 fish sandwiches.......the beer was luke-warm....it came out of the tap with so much foam I could tell before he sat it down in front of me.....then he tried to argue the fact that the beer was warm.....NOT A GOOD START! He finally conceded to replace the beer with some that were a little colder (but not much) and gave a lame explanation to why the temp was not right, took our order and then we waited, and waited, and waited for about 45mins for our sandwiches to come out...... I want to say the fish was very hot, but it was also very greasy as if they fried it and then refried it then let it sit in the dirty brown grease...not to mention the fries were very cold. So after waiting another 15-20mins the bartender asked how is the food....of course we complained know we waited 15 more mins to talk the manager TIM.....he was snarky and sarcastic....when we told him the fish was greasy he returned with "well it is fried in grease".....DUH! TIM! we kinda knew that!......needless to say we did not finish our beer or our food....we went down the street to Wholey's and got a hot fish sandwich minus the grease.

SYdhFdVXF-pn_lNOUifihA.text: My girlfriend and I went here on a Tuesday night for dinner somewhere around 7 o'clock. Our waiter, I wish I could remember his name, was awesome. They were understaffed and busy and he really did a great job.   The stuffed mushrooms were big enough to be an entree and were delicious. The sicilian pizza definitely has a spicier flavor than what I had expected but it was great too.  We checked in here on facebook and it gave us a deal for half off an appetizer with the purchase of an entree. The drinks were great too and the draft/beer selection is awesome.

ZA05_T97CIu_5afx3jo-VQ.text: Rolands' LOBSTER ROLL is amazing!  I've travelled extensively and eaten at a lot of nice restaurants (recently completed Pgh's 25 best), and this continues to be the best lobster roll I've ever eaten and my favorite meal in Pittsburgh.  Be warned - the service usually mediocre, but the food will more than compensate!

GH_zgjF-yevcaeNnIgaJyg.text: I went there on a Saturday afternoon by myself and wanted to sit out front.  The host made fun of me!  Said "aw, that's too bad" when I said it was just me.  No, it is perfectly fine in my book!  I got the lobster roll, plenty of lobster on a garlic bread roll.  It was just ok.    The most annoying part was the host kept coming out to talk to me.  I really just wanted to chill out by myself, not get hit on by the creepy host!

ziIIw47UmZG-nq_t5hI5ZQ.text: We arrived around 4:30 on a Wednesday before the Jason Isbell show at the Benedum, and it seemed like they were just opening. Only a couple of other couples there and a guy at the bar. No host and the bartender asked if we were going to eat. Sure man, it's a restaurant, right? Go figure... We were told to just sit anywhere and someone would be right with us. After  about 15 minutes no one came to our table so I started to get up and go to the bar for a menu, but a server saw me getting up and came over. Asked our server for a beer menu and was told they didn't have any. Really? My girlfriend looked around and found one lying on another table. Strike two. Ordered the lobster Mac n cheese as an appetizer.
