DEFINITELY not enough for two people to split, even as an appetizer, which was ok with us because we both thought it was pretty bland and should have just been called "Mac n cheese" because Sherlock Holmes would have had a tough time finding lobster in there. For dinner I ordered the pan seared scallops with red mashed potatoes. I think it was $23 or something like that which was INSANE for what I got, which was 8 single-bite sized, overcooked and completely flavorless pieces and a small mound of cold potatoes. Extremely disappointed in this dish. The other half got the prosciutto and arugula pizza. When it came to the table, completely topped with raw arugula about an inch deep, I was skeptical and didn't even try it until we got home later that night. I was wrong about this one and the pizza was delicious and on point. After my first round I did sit beerless  for about 15 minutes before one of our two servers came by to see if I wanted another (I did), but other than that they were fairly attentive, even though they both gave us a vibe that they were somehow annoyed that we were there. Our total bill for dinner, appetizer and 4 draft beers came to just over $80, which was way too steep considering the quality of food and service. Maybe we'd go back to grab a drink at the bar, but for food there are much better choices in the strip district.

hJS5krr3-tXQyLAUeS7WWg.text: I was looking for a place to rest, have a drink and a little food when shopping in the Strip District.  I was so happy I stopped here.  Great atmosphere.  Italian wedding soup was amazing.  Stuffed peppers excellent.    Pizza was ok.  Service was very good.    I will return.

cwOe9rPgqbsA6NUJFErVWg.text: This review is about an experience my husband and I had perhaps more than a year ago, so I'll do the best I can. The service was slow all night (forget drink refills). The dinner salad consisted of brown and white lettuce and cafeteria-esque Italian dressing. Our two meals of pasta were so bland that we, almost simultaneously, asked each other to try a bite just to make sure we weren't missing something. And I have been known to enjoy a dinner of buttered noodles, but our pastas weren't even as flavorful as that! Once we finished, our waitress said, "I hope you didn't want dessert because we're out."  So classy. The last straw was being reminded of what we would have to pay for such a crappy meal. Never again.

z0YIDhidzMHx2LeM4GvIMA.text: If I could give it a lesser star I would.  This place was terrible.  The seafood tasted old.  It was super chewy and tasteless.  The service was very slow and the waitress spilled fish broth all over one of the members of our party.  The bathrooms were gross and probably never clean.  I am just hoping that I don't get food poisoning later tonight.

j379hLsNbx0wZABK2ALHSQ.text: Rough experience today - had one drink and left. Waited 15-20 minutes for service and it is not busy. When I said something - everyone wanted to blame someone else - waitress couldn't describe beer and didnt iffer to find out or sample it - brought 12 year old son a pop in a little kids cup. Waitress did apologize for cup but it was too late - chose to leave.

04vTZSpcuEup4_uWOLq9EA.text: Giving 2 stars is strictly because I didn't get sick from the food....this night was a trainwreck start to finish.  My Mother and brother were coming to visit me from Ohio and I had scouted out a place for a long time to take them for my Mothers birthday dinner and since they both loved seafood I thought this would be a fun place for my "tourist" family.   When I walked in I took my Mom right over to the raw bar so she could see some flair....the bar looked aweful and empty but hey we don't judge so long as we have a good night. So scooted my Mom away from there and tried to shake off the embarrassment.  When we were sat my brother asked for the beer list...the server scrambled and said everything on their huge chalkboard was wrong and gave him a dirty crusty drink menu. He orded his beer and I a glass of wine and my Mother a water.  10 minutes later I was told they were out of my wine so I decided to stick with water.  We put in our order a starter plate to share, 2 salads, a pizza, scampi, and pasta. As a server I would be on cloud nine from this perfect check and work extra hard for that tip.   Then the waiting started 20 minutes for the starter which was great then 20 more for 2 salads.  Then things start going way down hill.  My Mom asked for some more water then we watched our waitress fill 2 other drinks at tables and bring out shots for another....still no water...since its my Mother I gave her mine and started trying to wave down our server. Finally my brother got her attention she said she forgot and went and got another one ignoring the fact mine was now empty. Whatever I'm a sever I understand things happen. Then we start to realize its been about 25 minutes since the salads came out. We ask what is going on and they said it would be there soon...they weren't lying my Brothers dinner came out a few minutes later....ONLY his dinner.  So we watch him eat, try his food, and wait.  He finishes his dinner which was pretty damn good and we ask what's going on the server says she is sorry they are backed up and she will take off our drinks (so basically one beer). Finally about 10 minutes later the pizza comes out....no pasta. We ask where it is and no one has an answer. I have to excuse myself and use the restroom and apparently when I was gone the manager explain that it hasn't even been started yet!!!!!!!! Then he said he will pay for it (pay for the food I'm never going to get how thoughtful). We ask for a box for the pizza because at this time we have been here for almost an hour and a half and I had some tourist to show around. It takes another 20 minutes to get the check and boxes...we pay and the server says she will run and see if the pasta is up (eventhough we just really wanted to leave) 15 minutes later she comes back with some pasta and a proud smile. Well thanks dear...wish we had that much effort all night.   The most annoying part of this ENTIRE dinner is that for 2 hours not the server or manager or anyone really stepped up to the plate here.  Yes they took off a meal we no longer wanted and one beer but I feel that since not one thing was right about the entire night something should have been done...maybe at least an apology. My brother and I work as servers and nothing like this has ever happened to one of our customers or if it has even come close within the first 30 minutes we would have fixed it.   I'm sorry Rolands but we will never be back and I REALLY wanted to love you. :(

JNYyXh-jy2UcANpQqxJKHA.text: The Lobster Roll Caesar Salad was very good, and the service at the bar was great!

eVCYREjnRu1x9YW8CRCPsw.text: Extremely Slow Service!   We have eaten here many times and, while the fish sandwich is great, the staff and management have yet to figure out how to manage the tables. This establishment can become quite busy and, if you don't aggressively pursue service, you are likely to wait 20 minute or more just to get a menu.  This is particularly True if you are sitting in one of the outside areas.

WavSxWE38zv2lMbLJM-Pxw.text: Lobster roll was awesome.  There was a Moosehead beer cap in our fries and the waitress' response was, "That must be from the beer batter.  I will give them hell."   I wasn't looking for a free meal but an apology from someone would have been appropriate.

hs-BmXYvVAtnhoWNygWvLg.text: I needed to organize a party for about 20 people. Roland's made it very easy to put the whole thing together via email. I rented a room in the back with a large couch, some tables, and its own bar. There were multiple flatscreen tvs and was nicely decorated. They did not charge for the room, only food and drink which were very reasonably priced. Surprisingly, as part of the event took place during happy hour, drinks during that time were much cheaper. They were well organized and the staff (Mike) was great: professional and made things easy.

shBzOdQOvKO6kwPDsvEt6w.text: My husband and I went tonight for dinner.  Bad mistake.  Worst meal we've ever had.  The salad actually tasted like it had a moth ball in it.  The sword fish we ordered seemed more like a piece of fatty beef that could not be cut with a knife!  The fried calamary was absolutely terrible, it was as if someone took a handfull of dough and fried it in clumbs and hid some meat in it!  The best part of it was that I got a refund on a soup that I didn't even recieve!  I don't recommend unless your drinking and don't care how your food taste.  Busy, slow and awful.

ncELoB68EG4F47-piCcZZA.text: The restaurant had many seafood options which I super duper love! It was my first time at the Strip District and I was craving seafood so was a great place to try. We got the calamari and the spinach, artichoke, & crab dip to start off, the calamari was good but the peppers and onions were kinda soggy and the dip was good but beware it's really cheesy, like cream cheese cheesy, and you could barely taste the crab, but the bread it came with was good! I got a lobster roll as an entree, my boyfriend got the shrimp po boy, his sister got the chicken nachos, and her boyfriend got mild wings. Everyone enjoyed their food, was good portions and super yummy. I really loved the fries my entree came with, the only thing about the sandwiches are that the bread is super thick and can be super hard to eat, other than that the fillings are yummmmmy. The nachos were HUGE and the wings were crispy and tasty. Our server was super nice and attentive. And best of all, we got to sit at the patio upstairs on a very nice day :) Would totally come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Calamari and spinach, artichoke, &amp; crab dip appetizers.

lAMn-yuFUNWcAnRmfhhHlw.text: A fun seafood Grill in the heart of Pittsburgh's strip district. Seafood is fresh and well prepared. One of the best fish sandwiches in Pittsburgh and the lobster roll is to die for. Fun busy atmosphere with friendly staff. They must stop if you're in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-pi2S3E4FRKeN9ZbYCmqQg.text: Great waiter.  Disgusting HAZMAT level bathrooms.  Sickly hunk of fishy tuna thrown on my mom's salad.  My chicken caesar was decent.  My dad loved his French onion soup.  Good beer selection  Even though this place calls itself a seafood restaurant, I wouldn't hazard any unfried ocean fare. Not so fresh!

PjazaeZjINTwrtRiYKOvrA.text: Stopped in to get a bite to eat and some drinks before seeing a show earlier in the week on a Thursday. It wasn't very crowded and we were immediately greeted and seated. Service was okay not the greatest but not the worst either. Waitress came off as kind of nonchalant, but she checked on us throughout our meal and according to other reviews doesn't look like they even got that. Kitchen staff was slow in execution especially for not having a big crowd.   I wasn't in the mood for seafood so I opted to try other things on their menu   LOBSTER BISQUE --  Huge portion. I didn't expect to get as much in the bowl as I actually got. Although shallow, the bowl is large and you get a pretty decent serving in it. Despite the size, the flavor was lacking as well as texture. I've had some pretty delicious basques before and think it could be improved with a pinch of salt and corn for texture. It's missing something.   GARLIC PARM WINGS --  Got an order of wings and they were good. Not an over powering flavor of garlic and not super duper oily. They used real garlic and it was served with it - minced. The wings were deep fried to a nice crispness so it added a little crunch which I liked. Served with common celery and your choice of rand and blue cheese. Not bad.   MARGHERITA PIZZA -- Looks better than it tastes. This can be easily split between two people - not a single server. The pizza is cooked in a wood fired oven and made very thin so it gets a nice crispy crunch. The crust was actually very good. It has a good texture to it and the lightly char taste you get from wood burning ovens was nice. I typically don't like that taste. Though I enjoyed the crust and what not - there was like no cheese on the pizza so it was way too saucy and lack-lustrous. Not what I would have expected so I was quite disappointed

Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garlic parm wings

vQBUd_pqrmbylg2B_PX_VA.text: Went here for happy hour for the seafood. Nothing spectacular; service was good, food was alright. Had the steamed oysters, clam, and shrimp which were just ok. The clam chowder was the only thing that was really good.

ymJlwzXOAxUxOR5YvOUoZw.text: Turn around, exit the building, and don't look back. I asked our waiter "What is your most famous local brew that you serve here? Coors light , miller light." hmm...okay..maybe he needed a more precise question. "What does the white lightening brew tasted like?"    The server responded, "I don't know. My table yesterday ordered it and they liked it."  Are you kidding me?  If the world has fallen apart, and this is the last place available, sit outside.  The indoors smells like urine.  Bathrooms are not clean at all.

nvZ-1Uu2OGaNg6rQCh5DFQ.text: Crab cakes were okay. Ask for the fries extra crispy, and they were a little oily and not so crispy. Salad with blue cheese salad dressing was average. Blue cheese dressing was Marie's from a jar. All in all, I left reasonably satisfied but far from overwhelmed.

bAULhEu7quJW60grWcAsEg.text: The prices are a little steep, but the food is good.  This combined with our wobbly table and overly peppered Bloody Mary is the reason for the 3 star review although I would have given a half extra star if I could.  We had a lobster roll and a shrimp po boy for lunch on a Saturday afternoon at the strip.  The service was very quick and our server was friendly and attentive.  Just know you'll easily drop 40-50 bucks for lunch for fairly standard fare and atmosphere.

5ZjKh6RlL5kELQtzphISzQ.text: My family came in to town for the Steelers Christmas Day game. We chose Rowlands because we came in to town the previous June and had an incredible dining experience. This time I ordered the crab dip because it was so delicious the last time. The dip came and I ate a couple of bites and realized there was no crab in it. I asked for it to be removed from my bill as we were on a time constraint. Waiter said he couldn't do that as it was already rung up.  He instead came back to our table with cash reimbursement and that I was still being charged for the dip on my bill and told me I could not take the remaining dip home.........Now, im back in the burgh. Should I dare try again?

Z0IaM7toGLtGuZenoGxVJQ.text: Love this place! Nothing better than sitting on the balcony with a cold beer and some appetizers ( or the lobster roll) and enjoy a sunny day.   Highly recommended!

rm3naBaopbJN2wJMspkS3w.text: In a city with so many great choices I am not sure how this place stays in business. The service is ok, but the food is just so bad and it isn't cheap.  I've eaten here twice in the last six months and both experiences were bad. Most recently I ordered the fish sandwich or should I call it the mushy sponge.  It took me 15 minutes to flag down a different waiter as our waitress was MIA to get something different. By then everyone at my party was done eating so I skipped dinner. Good thing we got the nachos (which the chicken looked like frozen bits). I will never will eat here again.

E4Kwql8GdIh8UWPQnunJNA.text: I've taken my daughter and gf here a couple times.  The food isn't bad, but it is rather overpriced.  Good selection of beers, though.  On the last visit, our waitress spilled food on my gf while bussing the table.  She was irritatingly unconcerned.  Service here is generally rather half-assed.  If you are going to charge nice place prices for Tipsy McStagger's Family Restaurant quality food, your staff really ought to do a better job of kissing up to the customers.

2jDScgNT4racjoNyiZKO-g.text: The good. Lobster roll was very good.  Now for the rest.  Shrimp po boy. Just ok. A little cold. So were the fries. Service was very slow.  Needed to return a dirty fork. Kids said ice water tasted like seafood.   With so many other options I wouldn't stop here unless you just want a drink at the bar and a lobster po boy.

Fj0NPNcbkKhkNDxGWrLzKw.text: Yummyyyy! Lobster nachos were great, Matt the bartender/server Was great and silly! Hubby's famous fish sandwich was fish  gigantic and delish!!  I highly recommend the rooftop deck or street side deck. Lots of great performer are on the street around you.  The bar inside is great too. Love it here!!

u8obJvmFO6ecLs5e8svg9w.text: This isn't my first time here but this is the first time we had a great waitress. She was quick, friendly and attentive. The food was great. I had the crab cake sandwich and added a side salad. My partner had a huge plate of mussels which were excellent. Only thing that would make it five stars for me is that when I order a mixed green salad I don't want iceberg lettuce in it. Other than that I'd recommend Roland's.

mjlIU0JQ5I21jMItCn764Q.text: Wouldn't give this place one star. Mike and Nick were the absolute worst. Supposedly one was the owners son and can't be confronted for his behavior. Will never go back.

0XnoM2ZybZorVpZ_rHYuQg.text: Been coming here for years especially to get the lobster roll. Had out of town guests so I wanted to take them somewhere Pittsburgh! Lobster roll was good but not awesome like I remember. It was dry but I just asked for extra butter and lemon. The waitress however was rude and I'm hoping just having a bad day. She brought out wrong appetizer when I brought it to her attention she snapped "that's what I wrote down" I know I would never have ordered it. So I said it's ok just bring the correct one and she never did. I  always tip well cause I'm in the restaurant business myself and this is one of the few times I thought about not tipping at all. ( I gave her 15% not 20%) good polite service staff makes a big difference even when the food is off. But when you have bad service it's inexcusable.

ZDbWWay7oyMi7ssD3PeHPg.text: Terribly salty "lobster roll" on greasy bread. Undercooked fries. Beer is good though! I wouldn't come back for the food! 16.00$ for the lobster roll will inedible lobster

2sx0FuEB3GK59BkLs4e9Eg.text: Hit Roland's on a Saturday around lunch. The place was packed but we got a seat in a back bar area which was nice, quiet, and air conditioned. Our server was friendly and working hard.  I ordered the lobster roll. The lobster was drenched in garlic butter and served on a very fresh, thick slice of Mancini's bread. The only complaint was that the lobster itself was a bit dry. If it had been more melt-in-your-mouth, fresh-textured, I'd be singing its praises to anyone who'd listen. Too bad, the other elements were great.   My mother said she'd had the lobster roll at Roland's a few years ago and she had the exact same experience.   So c'mon Roland's...you're in the Strip...figure out a way to make that lobster roll PERFECTION.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

EacUnn-Wm9vi54OoHa9vVQ.text: Once again, Yelp knows what it's talking about. I've lived in Pittsburgh for 8 years and I've always steered clear of Roland's. Something about it just screams "mediocre, tourist, trap", and this past week pretty much confirmed my assumption.   First impression was the service. My party of 3 sat at the bar, and it was immediately clear that the bartender was swamped. He was doing his best to keep up, but the only way to get any kind of attention was to flag him down as he sped past our section. We kept waiting for somebody to come help him, but that assistance never came. It was hard to watch, especially as a group sitting next to us became more and more infuriated with the unintentional neglect from the bartender.  Finally we got our food order in, and not too long after were presented with our first course. The calamari. It was below average. The pieces were way too big and over cooked. Next were spicy mussels with sausage. They were an improvement on the calamari although they were also a little over cooked. Most notable was the sheer quantity, you literally receive 2-3lbs of mussels, it was almost an obnoxiously huge amount of crustaceans. We went to town on them and still only put down half of the bucket. Lastly my Girlfriend and I split a Lobster roll with fries, which was very tasty. Once again, the lobster was a little over cooked, but overall it was a very basic, yet tasty sandwich. The fries on the other hand were unimpressive, hand cut, but soggy and lacking flavor.  Overall, it wasn't terribly disappointing, but Roland's could definitely use some work. How can you specialize in seafood and literally over cook all the seafood? And the fact that none of their management helped the bartender when he was getting his butt kicked was very disappointing to see.

w6pptcnZxyzkKTb1mVbTKA.text: I had a terrific experience here along with the rest of my family. I had the Filet Mignon Beef Tips sandwich. The quality of the meat was superb and cooked perfectly along with delicious French Fries. My party of seven was served with speed and there wasn't a single bad comment to be heard about our visit. I would love to come back again in the future.

8Y_1TAobhBkrE3A6cCnasA.text: The service was great but the food was a little expensive for the price. The "world famous" bloody Mary's we're not as impressive as they made them seem.

QFZGbIe_-gQyZPUyu2ZInw.text: Pretty good food if you're in the Strip and want some seafood. Service was very timely and friendly, and she was patient with my kids as they tried to decide what they wanted (and the kids menu has a good amount of options). My wife got the lobstah roll, which she enjoyed a lot. I got the "friggin' huge" fish sandwich, which was pretty good, although the fish was a little softer/mushier than I would have expected.  The breading was good, though. I probably should have sent it back, but luckily I didn't get sick afterwards. The fries were really good (because yeah, it's the PGH and you're going to get fries). All in all, a very nice lunch on our way through town.

2lHTeEmFDp9QoiS-IbGJLw.text: Roland's is a great place for seafood, especially if you love oysters! It can get pricey but the seafood taste fresh. The only reason I am giving it three stars is because the Bloody Mary had A TON of pepper in it and was watered down from the ice, so then we ordered a spiked Arnold Palmer and the waiter ended up coming back out and saying they were out and handed us an iced tea with Jose cuervo in it...

6XpVtjeieju3kgAkOwz0-g.text: Pro: very friendly service from all. Good lobster bisque.  Con: quality and value of food poor. $26 for a dry over cooked small piece of salmon and cold fries.

oLJwhZ4O6O14MeQhq9yLcQ.text: I really had hopes here. My husband and I stopped here during our jaunt to the wine and music fest in the strip this weekend. 1st the positive... The hostess was fantastic... She was a joy and greeted tea right away said it would be 15 min while she cheated a table and came back in 5 to seat us. Unfortunately it was downhill from there. I do understand that it was a Saturday night place was study but not super busy for 6pm. After all that the crab cakes were nothing to write home about. I will not be back. However I will say a goodbye and thank guy to the hostess in the way out.

XzWB72BAHS2zAkaw3B9bRg.text: Amazing food!! My Mom and I stopped by while shopping in the Strip. Our server Brett was super helpful and gave great recommendations. I had the giant fish sandwich and it was delicious ( and giant) Roland's also gets an extra point for very cold draft beer!! If you visit the Strip, check it out and try the fish!

dl3uJrn28wmIrO3wyLFMew.text: Went on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. We sat upstairs outside and you can't beat the location. Great views of the strip district and people watching. The food is good I would recommend the fish sandwich. I didn't get it but had food envy when the table next to me got it. I had the lobster salad and my friend had the steak tip salad. Both were good. We had the bloody Mary and I just thought it was OK. Our server was Tanya and she was awesome! Very attentive. I gave it 4 stars for the atmosphere. This place is a staple.

tEBary77Zk9TKsf1nDAIUw.text: Summertime on the balcony, the best!  Food is good.  Stick with the basics.  I would go for the Mussels.  It's a dependable choice.

OQby3vE217e8G7CnAne-VA.text: I was NOT impressed with Roland's and after eating there, I now understand the 2.5 star review. It took about 10 minutes for the hostess to come to the "please wait to be seated" sign to add our name to the list, with a line out the door also waiting to put their names in. The wait was an hour to get a table for 4 around 2-3:00 on a Saturday. It's so crowded there isn't even anywhere to stand. I was hoping it would be worth the wait, but it wasn't.  Once finally seated, it took forever to be greeted by our server, but he was very nice. Seemed like he was running around like a maniac and they were short staffed. It then took forever to get our drinks. When we finally got our food, we had no silverware or napkins. We asked our server for them, but after about 5 minutes of him not returning to the table, our food was getting cold. We flagged down another server and asked her, and she was SO rude. I understand she was not our server and was busy, but as a server of a restaurant, you shouldn't treat customers that way. When we finally got silverware, we were only given little drink napkins from the bar and our food was no longer hot.  Moving on to the food, terrible. I got the crab cake sandwich and it was very dry and tasteless. The crab cake itself was really small but on a huge roll. The sauce it was served with had a bad taste. My husband got the fish tacos and didn't like them. Our friend had the lobster roll, which was recommended by the server and it was so greasy and rubbery. The lobster was way overlooked. Our last friend got the Maryland crab soup and it tasted like a shaker of salt. Nobody liked or ate their meal.  I wanted to complain, but still felt bad for our server bc he seemed so busy, so we didnt want to bother him. I do not think I'll return to Roland's. So many better places in the strip district to eat with better, faster service and food. Roland's was really disappointing. The only thing I liked about Roland's was they serve full pint white lightening, which is sometimes hard to find at other restaurants in the area.

n3DrgCrhrSb5q48s9fiCDQ.text: Been to the strip many times but this is the first time we stepped into this restaurant. They have awesome steamed oysters and shrimp specials that was delish!!  So we went back twice while visiting for 10 days.

6yAbEB36ZKnO6hHhAzkyLA.text: Pittsburgh's go-to for seafood! Always fresh. Always delicious. We've been here at least a dozen times and any time someone asks where to go for seafood I say Rolands. The staff is always going above and beyond to satisfy any requests we had. I recommend the Hot Lobster Roll. It's not your traditional chilled lobster roll but it's even better than words can describe. Roland's is always a place we go to if we want seafood and there isn't a better place in the Burgh!

90Bma0yxopsSeNDCSTdb4A.text: In the heart of Strip district, it can be a pretty fun place on a game watch day. The place is setup nicely and overall clean. I ordered the grilled chicken nachos while watching the game as the place was bustling with fun yinzers. I just wanted an App, not a whole meal. How could you screw up nachos after all?. For $11 they were pretty underwhelming. Very little dry queso cheese. Dry chicken pieces cubically cut. Not enough for the size of nachos plate. Nachos themselves were dry, salty and cold. Totally unmemorable. If an appetizer was below average not sure how entrees would be. I'll probably be back for drinks and overall atmosphere but would not go out of my way for the food. The patio seating looked nice.

Got a table immediately and the atmosphere was awesome.  The lobster roll is what dreams are made of.  I could eat that every single day for the rest of my life and die a happy man.  We will definitely stop here again!

dHE647kJPIdXazqv8snM5w.text: Hey. This place is deeeeeeeeCENT.  (look, check it out for happy hour. 60 cent oysters? uhmfuckyea)  I dislike strip dizzle bars but you could pick worse. Actually, ok. This review is based on going to happy hour. I am down with 60 cent oysters, clams, shrimp, and wings. Average beer selection, but you can find a few gems.

36h2mu7zI4slPxVZzROyrg.text: My husband has enjoyed lunch at Roland's several times, so when he had a hankering for seafood, we headed down to dinner on a Saturday night. We were seated and given menus right away, which was a nice surprise since it was busy. But that's where the "nice " ended. It was ten minutes before a harried waiter came over, gave a us two napkin rolls and said "I'll be right with you." Ten minutes more and he returned to take our drink orders. We could tell service was going to be slow, so we were prepared with our full order. We ordered water, two bottles of Newcastle Brown Ale, a half dozen raw oysters, salads and entrees. Ten more minutes go by and he brings the waters and tells us he'll be right back with the beer. So at this point we have been there 30 minutes and have water and silverware (I guess we should have counted ourselves lucky because we watched two tables receive food and NO silverware, and after asking for some and waiting, ended up going into the bar to get napkin rollups themselves from the bartender). At the 35 minute mark, our beers arrive -- two draft beers, not the bottles we ordered  When he delivers the beer, he says that our oysters are ready and he'll be right back. We take a sip of the draft beers, only to discover they were completely flat. We waited another 10 minutes with no sign of the waiter or the oysters, so I looked at my husband and said "Let's vamoose!' and we got up and walked out.  It may be a great place for lunch (and I understand the food is good!) but we won't be going back for dinner.

NiS9w4nEFfkmW9FF8WNCPQ.text: Wow!  While on business in Pittsburg, went wandering for food.  Among all the closed places (short business days in the Strip District), we decided to try Rolands.  Nice atmosphere, ESPN on TVs, large selection of beer.  We immediately, almost before sitting down, were greeted by a waitress who made some recommendations.  As we had no idea whereto start we needed some time to evaluate, and she kept checking back, but without being pushy. The food was excellent!  Bruschetta and Seafood Pizza for me, Calamari and Seafood Stew for my colleague.  HUGE portions!  Great flavors, cooked right.  (I don't like calamari, but would have eaten more after trying this one.)

uCmudmq47f1A_miiKBCb3g.text: I have never been to Roland's before but today was my first and last time!  My boyfriend's family and I (a party of 6 and a baby) asked to be seated.  There was a wait but they told us we could go upstairs to the patio which was first come first serve and the manager was setting us up a table and highchair.  No he didn't!  We pulled together our own tables and an hour into us arriving at the restaurant we had to go get our own highchair.    We ordered food and drinks right away.  While I was ordering I asked the waitress if I could have white sauce instead of a red sauce on the specialty pizza.  The waitresses response was "No, I don't think that would be good."  Oh, I am so sorry that the paying customer asking for the meal thought it would be a good.    Out of the 6 of us, 5 people got pizzas and 1 person got a fish sandwich. The fish sandwich arrived nearly 20 minutes before the rest of our meals.  We never were offered refills on our drinks and silverware had to be requested multiple times.  The service was horrible, the atmosphere was chaotic and uncomfortable, and the food was just horrible.

9v6EuwTlVDIp0xefILC16w.text: Great drinks + sports!!!!!!! The seafood is super fresh!!! Perfect for a late dinner!

vnGsBxMjCGkM5n7z1YQ3gQ.text: Can't rate their food because I never got a chance to eat. Their bartender was the absolute biggest jerk I've ever met in my entire life in any establishment I have ever been in any State I've ever traveled to.  The attitude of the entire staff is mildly one of, "Please don't talk to me, you're just an inconvenience and I'm just trying to get thru my shift." However, this one bartender went out of his way to make me feel like my business was not only not appreciated, but that he wanted me to leave. What did I do? Nothing, I guess because I happen to have been by myself, I wasn't worth his time or bother to serve me a beer, so he simply ignored me, and then went out of his way to make me feel uncomfortable by switching channels of a football game I had come in to watch and giving me lame excuses as to why he couldn't put the game on even ONE tv set. He proved he not only was a jerk, but a liar on top of it. If you love being treated like garbage when spending your hard earned money, then this is the place for you, if on the other hand, you want to have a little service, and made to feel like your business is appreciated, then avoid this place like the plaque.

QFLeiwo0uFOpWFZHCBlscA.text: I've been here several times and have never had a bad meal. The prices were a little expensive for what we got. They took one of my favorite dishes, raspberry maple scallops, off the menu so I took a star off.  Tonight we had the calamari which was fresh, lightly breaded and fried and huge pieces. After that we had the Cajun shrimp. It was decent but nothing special and only had 6 small shrimp. The mango salsa was nice but didn't add much to the dish.  I ordered the land and sea and got the beer battered shrimp. The shrimp for the entree was bigger than the appetizer and done well. My steak was cooked right and tasty. Overall it is a good restaurant with good service. Not the best but far from the worst. I will be back.

m0WX6qgrHZVx2byHhks2aA.text: Another great lobster roll dinner last night!  This is a must have if you are in the strip district.  Service was just okay, but that delicious sandwich makes up for it.  Didn't know they offer happy hour every night till 6:00 - will definitely check it out next time...looked like they had some Great Raw Bar specials during happy hour too.  Easy to park down there at night....if the big weekend crowds keep you away.

GaRj08ETn9rC_BHJMYwRfA.text: Came here tonight for my first time. Not only was the food amazing, but John was, by far, the most incredible bartender I have ever had. Very attentive and personable. Gave great food and beer recommendations, and let us sample everything before we purchased. The bar was full and he was the only one serving, and he still managed to stop multiple times to check up on us. He made our experience so much better. I would come back for his service alone!

jp_xnQbx_o9Gmv_1mhI24A.text: Decided to try it for dinner as we were walking around the strip.  Good selection of beers too.  Started with mussels and they were very good.  Sherry butter sauce w lots of garlic.  We each had the seafood stew for dinner...tried to get beyond the lobster roll which is their signature dish  Stew was full of seafood.  Lobster,  clams, mussels, scallops, shrimp.  Good size portion at reasonable price.  Sauce was excellent and had just enough of a spice to have a nice tasting after bite but did not drown out the cream, old bay and sherry.  We will definitely be back.

The four of us were afraid to order anything else. This place was recommended to us by my sister in law. I've always though she was a little nuts and this proved it.

pf1Rbh67MhJ0XSM5ZklGpQ.text: Great beer selection,  bartenders are awesome and very friendly and lobster Mac and cheese and chicken nachos are amazing.  Definitely recommend to everyone

5iFHXVukNnl8IA5We2FRtQ.text: We had raw bar oysters which were very good and lobster rolls.  The lobster rolls were served warm which was interesting but the seasoned butter sauce took away all the taste of lobster.  Would be willing to go back to try something else but wasn't overwhelmed.

VaHRt7qMOoj1y2qe-BDY5A.text: Hot, dirty, poor service. We only had one drink at the bar, the facility is disgusting.

DmgskLD_-grp_pamYIZRgQ.text: I ate dinner here with a group to celebrate a friend's birthday.  My overall opinion is that the service was terrible and the food was overpriced.    Our drinks took 15-20 minutes to arrive.  We were drinking beers, so I'm not sure why it took so long.  We had to wait an extremely long time for our food, I would estimate at least 45 minutes.  We had ordered calamari and bruschetta for appetizers, but they were served with the entrees.  When we started to eat it became very obvious that our food had been sitting for a while.  Anyone who had french fries said they were cold.  I ordered the rosemary shrimp scampi, which came with mashed potatoes and a broccoli/carrot mix.  The mashed potatoes were lukewarm at best, and the vegetables were cold.  I ate the broccoli, but I don't like raw carrots so I didn't eat those.  It honestly looked like they just threw a handful of baby carrots onto the plate.  As for the shrimp itself, it tasted good but wasn't what I expected.  I was expecting a pasta-type dish, but it was just 5 or 6 pieces of shrimp in a garlic butter bath.  And I don't think a few pieces of shrimp and cold vegetables should cost $23, especially when I was still hungry after the meal.  To top it all off, we realized halfway into our meals that we were never given napkins.  We had to ask twice for them to be brought out.  The only good thing about the experience was the beer selection.  If I ever come back here I will just stick to the bar and not waste my time or money on the food.

nLq3ATTw9WyFI2PExwp6Xw.text: So after reading some of the other reviews,  I had some doubts about coming here,  however my wife insisted for her birthday,  so i agreed.    There were 10 of us and we went on Saturday at 5:30. We were greeted as soon as we walked in and were seated almost immediately!  Great start!   Our server was Matt K.,  and he was awesome!  Constantly checking on us and refilling drinks without us needing to ask.  Really impressed with the service!   We got the Oysters Rockafeller as an appetizer and they cane out sizzling and were very good!   Almost all of us got the Lobster Rolls.  Holy cow were they good!! Came out piping hot and the huge chunks of lobster was a delight to see and taste! The bread was also amazing,  nicely toasted and soft and oh so buttery and garlicy! Complimented the lobster very well!    We never felt rushed and it was very relaxing!    We called ahead of time and asked if we could bring a cake in (it was my wife's birthday)  and they said no problem!  When we were done with our meals,  Matt brought us out new plates, forks and spachela without us even needing to ask!  Again,  super impressed!   If I had any small complaint,  it was that the fries were only warm... But they were still good!    We will definitely go back!

4068Kmm9TZLld-RBFDDOYg.text: We headed to the strip district to soak in the atmosphere like any good tourist should do.  Unfortunately we love to sleep and showed up a little late and by the time we were ready to eat (around 4pm) our list of recommended places to try were already closed for the day.   Roland's was open though. As an added bonus they were showing the Steeler's game and there is nothing that Pittsburgh loves more than supporting the Steeler's and Penguin's. The atmosphere was great with everyone dressed in black and yellow and really into the game.  We ordered wedding soup (pretty delicious) and Portobello Mushroom Pizza. Maybe our mistake was not ordering seafood, anyway the caramelized onions on it were actually cooked in sugar (eww) and the sauce itself was just as sweet. It felt like we were eating candy.  As for the staff, Pittsburgh in general has some of the friendliest people I've come across in a long time. The staff here may not have been quite as friendly as we had come to expect from the rest of this lovely city but they were just fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Portobello Pizza

6yPEiGiA4EhxswgC0IzguA.text: Last weekend my mother and I headed down to the strip to get some weekly goods - lunch meat and cheese from Penn Mac - veggies at Stans - needed some new spices from Penzeys for a chili I was going to make that day....we were both a little hungry and knew we wanted to have a snack before shopping.  We parked in front of Roland's and see the sign: Famous for Lobster Rolls and Bloody Mary's!  Perfect.   My mother got the Lobster Roll, which she said was 'good'. The bread, from Mancini's, was of course tasty - toasted and buttery - delicious mostly because it was Mancini's bread. I had the Lobster Roll minus the carbs on a salad - and the lobster was tasty, no doubt , I mean, lobster is just - good. For the price though, not sure that I got enough bang for my buck. The salad was something I could have picked up at Get-Go in the pre-made section. I just didn't feel satisfied at the end of my meal. I couldn't even drink my Bloody Mary (this is a rare affair), way too much horseradish, and I often like horseradish in my Bloodies!  And it was cold - didn't even take my winter coat off. So, needless to say, not the best experience.  Talk about False advertisement...

-bJOmAcRIc1yZUaLjIuL5A.text: Stopped here for a bloody Mary with lunch.  We were a little early for lunch, 1030am, we got a bloody Mary at the bar. Big mistake!!! It was a premix tomato base that had so much pepper in it, it gave me a stomach ache.  Couldn't finish it because the bottom of the glass was nothing but pepper. When Matt the bartender, finally tore himself away from the 20 something girls at the other end of the bar, we asked if he could make another with less pepper. We were told  that he sells a buck fifty of these on a Saturday so, no he wasn't making it differently for us.  Wrong move and poor salesmanship.  Won't ever go back while he works there. I would have spent a boatload there between lunch n drinks, but another business in the strip got my business instead. ( to the tune of about $50.00)

4Ex8BJF8tuVXOq0eg6q4EA.text: Food was great. Service was fast. Our server was pleasant and very friendly.  Will come back for sure

71aSC4hceXPnMPR3btaUrA.text: If 0 stars were possible I'd give em. Got back from here yesterday evening and I am physically ill.   I didn't even touch the anemic, yellow and fishy smelling muscles - not that the waiter asked why we hadn't eaten them, more on this character in a moment. My ahi tuna steak was decent, but I think the scallops are what got me and my friend is sick as well. Just saying - check your food before the waiter walks off.  Speaking of the waiter - one of the worst I've ever had the displeasure of umm being served by? That sounds awkward and vaguely jack-assy ... Hmm the mild poisoning I have is affecting my wit, but you follow me.  This guy spilled half the water out of the oysters while trying to put a plate down, and didn't notice or say anything about it when he did; he asked me how I wanted my tuna steak prepared??!   Worst of all he spoke in this low monotone while other customers and cars going by drown him out so all you can tell is he asked you something because he's standing there with this kind of 'come on!' look on his face - totally rude and completely inept. I was hard put to give 10% tip to be honest.   I'd suggest the similar bar down the road for better quality food and service. Good luck out there!

XOA5mEgsmWqQA8Z-iTQ_kg.text: So, four of us came in for the first time.  Diner 1 - ordered the lobster roll sandwich.  Lobster on a roll, nothing more...that's it.  Nothing special - have no idea why people would rave about this.  A bland, poor excuse of a sandwich that does a disservice to all northeasterners who know what a lobster roll is, and this ain't it.  Is this lobster?  Read on.  Diner 2 - ordered a large raw bar sampler, which was six Quahog clams, six oysters and six rubbery shrimp.  Who serves tough, chewy Quahogs on a raw bar?  This dive.  Also ordered the mussels, which were not seasoned and swimming in water.  No wine/garlic sauce as advertised on the menu - water.    Bland and awful.  Finished with the Mediterranean pizza which is spinach, feta and olives - the better part of the dinner.  Diner 3 - steamed clams.  Again who serves Quahogs for steamed clams?  These amateurs.  Also had the clam chowder - which appropriately had minced Quahogs in it.   Diner 4 - ordered the salad with the lobster roll, hold the bread.  Also asked for the lobster to be served chilled with it.  Lobster came hot and was dyed a deep red color.  Why the need to put lobster in a dye?   Because...it's not Maine lobster!  Imposter fish is dyed and artificially flavored, then frozen, then thawed, then microwaved at Roland's and called lobster.  That's my guess.  Sent the mussels back.  No offer to reduce the check or offer a comped dessert.     Rest rooms are dirty, and smell of urine.  Men's was an awful smelling pit and I was told that the ladies had one toilet drenched with urine on the seat, another blocked up and overflowing and a third that could be used.  This place is a smelly, dingy, dive bar with horrible food and poor service.  It is a trap for the unsuspecting tourist.   You have been warned...STAY AWAY!

UBapyu_E1FowhDVR254H-w.text: Ok so I'm giving a 4 stars cause I'm in love with their margarita pizza. Its definitely not fine dining but for a local bar with food, I think they do it right. Their service has always been on point and their food is consistent. They have a great patio and on a nice sunny day its a great place for a cocktail and a quick bite to eat.

m2ZHKlhM9IJVuELLghPM4g.text: Prime time location, and they know it.  Yet another older guard restaurant that realizes it has people roped in before they know it.  The place looks nice and is possibly the best location during the summer especially in the city.  I have always steered clear of Roland's because of an assumption.  But....the wife and her friend wanted a "lobster roll" so I was roped into going.  I opted to just drink a draught.  They got one of their famous lobster rolls and immediately were underwhelmed.  The sandwich was dwarfed by a mountain of handcut fries (the best part).  It also came with a limp pickle speer and a small condiment cup of coleslaw?!  The roll itself was lobster, but was fishy tasting and had no sauce?!  There was maybe 3ozs of fishy lobster on the roll.....Pathetic. Service was decent and my draught and few fries got this place the extra star it deserves.  Go to Wholey!!!!

ChmjgmMG26EGS1zfr7KMRA.text: This place just sucks plain and simple... went to dinner tonight. We ordered drinks that took 20 min. Then my wife ordered a lobster roll, my daughter got the kids past with shrimp added, and I got the shrimp po-boy, we also started with a half dozen oysters. Well our oysters came out with our daughters pasta, which u would think how hard is it to make butter noodles with shrimp, we'll it must be hard bc her plate looked like cooked noodles with just shrimp on top, no butter. Then our sandwiches came out... they just sucked plain and simple.. not good at all, and don't get me started on the service, bc there wasn't any.. they had only 2 waiters for all the tables, and they had to bus their own tables, was a complete joke.. no organization at all. You could call me and say we can eat for free again, and I would definitely decline. We will not be back no way in hell. Ohh and 2 sandwiches with fries, kids pasta, and half dozen oysters came to 78 bucks complete rip off.

U60Z8uBhAsMT08DRqKh-OQ.text: Here on vacation and the waitress seemed annoyed we wanted food. Who know we wanted food at a restaurant.

IMcGaHCFngroEvTWXIj3cQ.text: Waited to be seated for 15 minutes, no one greeted us. Asked a passing waitress if we seat ourselves. Waitress walked up the stairs and shouted out NO!  10 minutes later, same waitress passed by and again we asked if we could be seated. She walked up the stairs and ignored us. We asked totalk to the manager and she threw her arms up and said, if you can find him! Needless to say, we will not be returning to this place.

8RK3CEpfTrSgvkMA3FaoEA.text: Nothing like sitting outside on the second floor on a beautiful weekend afternoon enjoying a drink and sandwich.  My experiences here have always been great with service and food except when they're super super busy.  Love the Irish bartender too.

_wWFRONK8k8tTW2wdWiBeA.text: Not bad but not great either.  I tried the lobster roll and the bloody mary which we were informed as we walked in the Roland's was "famous" for.  Both were good but nothing spectacular.  I was also here quite some time ago and remember them having good pizza though.  One thing to note is that they have a really large selection of beer both on draft and in bottles.

-d6ZTkZ_36O6ytJyj2oK9g.text: After reading reviews I was afraid of what kind of service we would encounter.   The bartender was lovely and attentive. He offered drinks promptly and kept an eye on our needs. The Bloody Mary was fun and showy with 3 Green Olives, a lemon, a lime and a huge celery stalk and had a light Old Bay flavor, which was a nice touch.  We ordered the Lobster Nachos ($15), which were delivered to us piping hot and in less than 10 minutes. While it was a large serving of nachos for 2 people, the portion of lobster was paltry. They tasted fine but I would have expected more lobster for the price.   I wouldn't order food here, again.  Still, nice, fast service with a smile and a fun open space. Very conducive to lively conversation and easy people watching.

szLOE2BFXuUTZJu5kozr9g.text: Literally disgusting. Their food is gross and I've seen nice running around in there.

UHsINMaJe9T_mKonlvXO9A.text: Great place for lunch. Buffalo shrimp dip was excellent. The fish sandwich was also fantastic and too large to finish. Would definitely recommend.

58HNeizvaDv8DO0qz3h3pQ.text: The bar has a nice selection of beers. The Irish bartender who works Monday nights is extremely welcoming and friendly.    For food I tried the raw bar happy hour. The oysters were alright but nothing special. The shrimp were quite small, probably U-20 count which for Shrimp Cocktail is tiny. The wings were very disappointing. Extremely small and flavorless. And finally the steamed clams were CHEWY.   In recap, come here for the beers and the nice bartenders. The food you can do without.

hR1bfw5Ta7b6j5By5sqMzA.text: It's a True "Pittsburgh" spot...a little rough on the ambiance and decor, but as long as you order the lobster roll you won't be disappointed.  The upstairs patio is great on a sunny Saturday or an evening happy hour, but the bar inside leaves a little to be desired.

eos24Y4x6CWsUa2g09vEvQ.text: Rolands never disappoints. Can't go wrong with a Lobster roll on toasted garlic mancini's bread-it never disappoints! Highly recommend the lobster Mac n Cheese, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roland&#39;s Lobster Roll sandwich with fries and Lobster mac n cheese

18ejKFomfzkTOQzE3WyHFQ.text: The food here was good! Our waitress recommended the lobster roll as a fan favorite, and it was definitely tasty. It didn't completely blow me away and there was a huge amount of bread, but I can see why people like it! The fries were nice, fresh, and potatoey as well! Service was good, and the atmosphere was refreshing with no loud music and a good conversational setting. Be warned, a majority of the menu is pretty high in price. I had a nice time, though, and would definitely recommend it to a friend who's looking for some good seafood!

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

W6Z3LzPkSJ1SJPQ-CNaJqQ.text: Very disappointed, especially with our waitress! She was rude, barely tended to us, and when she did tend to us  she acted as though it was a big bother We barely took our last bites when she showed up and unite abruptly asked if we want our check. Then she took away our son's plate without asking if he was finished!  He was not finished.   The food ? Our pizza was soggy in the center. Doubt if we'll ever go back! Very disappointed!   Laura and Bob F

7MtO5PCzzBOumzK2cpxcgg.text: Was their for my first time last night and really enjoyed it. Got the lobster rolls as an appetizer and they were fantastic. Very buttery, but fantastic. Went with the lobster ravioli which was great as well. Service was great and food came out quick. 4.5 stars in my opinion!

itKoKzOj8F62Bkfla8Jt_Q.text: If you're shopping in the Strip and need to grab a bite you can't beat Rolands. The atmosphere is comfortable and casual, and acoustics are good enough to actually have a conversation. You can enjoy a full dinner, or there are salads, chowders, and appetizers. The seafood is fresh with offerings from the raw bar, mussel pots or traditional choices. If that's not enough, there are wood fired pizzas pasta, and sandwiches. My favorite is their famous lobster roll.  If you'd like a dessert, you can try the brownie and peanut butter explosion - just one delicious choice.  I highly recommend Rolands to complete your visit to the Strip District.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7KMvfJnI4tqCOgHqouTWfw.text: Omg I felt like I was in Boston. Love this place! Best staff and killer food! Plating and presentation was great as well. Our attentive friendly cute inked up waiter was even sweet enough to give my gf that was losing her voice 2 cough drops which helped her voice so much. How sweet. I'm picky and WOW! Order accuracy was great too! Bald muscular inked up Bartender guy made a killer drink and was cute too. I swear a modeling agency has got to do their hiring. Every girl and guy there was so attractive, clean, friendly, sharply dressed, attentive, beautiful ink, all smiles, looked happy, knowledgeable...  You can tell they all really enjoy working there and have great chemistry with each other.  It's a well oiled machine.  I'll be back! Love this place!

EdNyIC1hyDAqJzTQsn3qAA.text: Really nice place! Went there for a little wedding reception. We had the upper bar area mostly to our selfs.. bartenders were friendly and they have amazing crab cakes! I would definitely like to go back!!

-EMg8INO8ew8bESdvvy3eg.text: Delicious lobster roll split between two people - with extra fries. Steamed shrimp was so good as well. Upstairs is the spot to be, downstairs smelled a little ripe.

P6gC1O7XfWo_WiWb6NMkMQ.text: I was there last night for garlic mussels, it had zero flavor. The mussels were sour, assuming they're old. Wasn't expecting fresh ones, but definitely shouldn't have been serve old sour ones. wish I brought up to our server, but I didn't. She also could've asked why only 4 were eaten out of the whole bucket.

JXdv3760vIcsE9HGVwg8KA.text: We visited Roland's on a fairly busy Sunday afternoon. We were told that we would have to wait about 10 minutes for an outside table, and it was somewhere between 10-15 minutes. One of the reasons we visited Roland's was because it is dog friendly. My dog was welcome on the patio, where he sat and people-watched.   Our server was excellent; he was able to make recommendations and answer our questions. Plus, he kept my iced tea glass full. My sister and I shared the lobster nachos and even then we couldn't finish them. They were really good, with tons of lobster meat and delicious, gooey cheese. My s-i-l ordered the lobster roll, which was so very buttery and yummy, and the fries, which were fresh-cut but soggy. They were really the only negative, other than the smokers who congregated near the patio. There were so many items on the menu that I wanted to try, I can't wait to come back!

fcnFIWKKEbBNnMVkXXoNeA.text: If you are looking for a great lobster roll this is not the place. I don't know why everyone raves about them, because I was not impressed. Would try the restaurant again, but would not get the lobster roll

HFCXTSEUowGL6q_UigrxXA.text: Great micro brew shrimp. They were big and sweet and a decent price too. The lobster tacos were also very good. Overall good place if your looking for some good seafood in the PGH area.

31-33jcgsMFgYSm8BIp4QQ.text: I have been going to Roland's regularly for years and it is one of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh. Excellent food and drink, good prices, and a fantastic staff. I bring friends from out of town whenever possible and plan on continuing to do so.

12SN1F_YGbvzmDVCAF-GjQ.text: Standard bar atmosphere and food. Service was good and the food was good. The calamari appetizer was fried lightly and large pieces. Definitely an upgrade from the standard rings and octopus. I had the lobster rolls which was definitely tasty. There was a good bit of meat on the roll and plenty of butter. The only comment I have not great are just suggestions. I'd like some mayo on the roll and there was mainly claw meat and not much else. Very small pieces of meat but a lot of them. Overall, it was good.

gaYGDm3vVveolOrhrGYkHw.text: I got a lobster roll. Wow!! A lot of lobster meat compared to the price, unlike some other places I have had. I was so happy because it was delicious too haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll

4I3zw6pdT4E5tN1IH7jcNA.text: Stopped for pizza. First pizza came out wet and raw dough. We asked to cook it more. Waitress said they are making a new one. We waited a very long time. Second pizza cold and more raw. Spoke to very rude manager, he offered something else off menu but we had somewhere else to go. We asked to just eat the toppings and he said we have to pay for it. Needless to say we refused to pay for a raw, cold pizza. The bill was still costly for the drinks we bought while we waited. Left hungry. Very disappointed locals.

pO_DVAOmpDUGF9jq7N6ikA.text: I was really surprised, I always thought this place was more of a bar than a restaurant. Went around 530 on a Sunday after the Steelers game and was really hungry. We split the Lobster Nachos and the Bacon Wrapped Shrimp. Portions were really good sized, the queso on the nachos was spicy, tasted great. The lobster was a bit tough, but OK.  I actually would go here again, because our food was decent, and some of the food delivered to other tables looked really good. Service was fine and it was not overpriced

Qruwagj-BXfdH79eUK80AQ.text: Food was amazing we got only but appetizers and let's just say four people were full after that!!! Service was good, Kevin was very attentive and was ready to service us. Food was cooked and seasoned perfectly not greasy either +!!!!

x4flNUgh-dGgBgOx50VgPg.text: Brought my niece and nephew to Rolands.. because they love seafood.  The upstairs patio was packed but there were a few tables..  I was hesitant in staying because we were pressed for time and I didnt see many waitresses.  We were greeted by Tonya our waitress not long after we sat down - and she didnt miss a beat.  Hot and humid... tables were soon full - and she was amazing. I was glad we came. .. cuz he kids loved it.  We didnt have to wait for anything. My nephew got the prosciutto wrapped shrimp and loved them. He is 11 and I have taught him about yelp and he said I should give the review 5 stars!!  Samantha my niece is who is a little older - loved her classic mussels.    I wasn't too hungry (humidity kills my appetite) and just ordered the the sweet chilli wings and they were ok - "meh".  They were not spicy at all and very mild- not as much flavor as I expected.  I am tough critic when it comes to wings.  Walking through the bar area to get to the ladies room after dining.. I was reminded about how much fun the upstairs area is at Rolands..   The restrooms on the second floor - have been totally revamped.. love the new look.   I am still and always will be a fan. Thanks Rolands. .. see you again real soon. mawh

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Joey and his prosetto wrapped shrimp ( anything for my nephew) he said I should give his meal 5 stars!

7Gppw5G9B3W40bkj7Pr-_w.text: Ugh Roland's, I wanted to like you but unfortunately you stayed True to your two star rating.   I'm not a Pittsburg native but came to visit for a weekend. We decided to visit the Strip district and wander around to find food. The first restaurant we tried to go to (Gaucho) had too long of a wait so we ended up at Roland's.   Things started off strong... but boy, did it go downhill pretty quickly. The place looked pretty packed, which I figured was a good sign. There is outside seating both upstairs and downstairs which seemed nice. We were helped right away. In fact, while the hostess cleaned off our table, 3 other employees approached us to ask if we were being seated. Those aspects made Roland's seem promising.  After we were seated, nobody came to greet us or take our order for about ten minutes. Ummmm what? Seemed strange after the staff was so attentive just moments before. We were finally able to flag down a waitress. Strike 1.   My group ordered a couple apps including the sweet chili shrimp and Cajun shrimp. The food came out in a timely manner. We still didn't have silverware or plates by the time the food came out. Strike 2.  The food itself was just meh. The sweet chili shrimp was good, better than the Cajun shrimp in my opinion. The Cajun strip was really basic. It didn't have much flavor to it. The mango salsa it came with was just ok (and trust me, that's tough for me to say since I'm such a lover of all things mango). I ordered the lobster mac and cheese from the appetizer section as my entree. Our entrees came our super quick... like before we could even finish our appys. This is a pet peeve of mine so I'll consider this strike 2.5.  The lobster mac and cheese was edible but not that impressive. There were large chunks of lobster in it which was good. But it was just so watery.... it almost tasted soupy?! It needed to be a lot thicker in consistency. Also, the presentation really had me baffled. It was served in a bowl which was on a plate. There were pieces of arugula shoved under the bowl. The pieces were haphazardly sticking out which made the meal look quite strange tbh. My group spent a couple minutes hypothesizing why this may be... the best reason we could come up with was to keep the bowl from sliding around the plate. Very weird. Strike 3.  You know what they say... three strikes and you're out. And Roland's is definitely out after my experience here. I'm sure there are much better options in the area, so I'd recommend eating elsewhere.

Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster mac and cheese

J_WlKuUq14wq5MiAwfQdlw.text: Seem to return here every few months due to location and their balcony is fun when the weather is nice. The food and service is generally ok. We were there on 1/6/17 for happy hour which is decent.  As we were enjoying our drinks, I spotted a mouse hanging out behind the bar.  A bit unnerved,  I pointed it out to the waiter.  "OK thanks" he said and that was it. No one else came to investigate and no one seemed to think it was a big deal.  Needless to say  my appetite was gone.  Where is the health dept when you need them?

5fatMueFfYCgkcYzRPA89A.text: There aren't too many things better in life than a Roland's hot lobster roll on Mancini's grilled bread. My husband loves their giant fish sandwich. This place is a sure thing.

msAGAkRf_J8fuIHjqZCPLQ.text: Ugh if I could give this place -10 stars I would. What a nightmare. To start, the first time I ate here, I almost swallowed a giant shard of plastic that was in my salad. Then to my horror, the bar tending goes "whoops." and tosses it on the floor!!   Fast forward a couple months, I decide to give this place a second chance. (I must have been delirious from hunger.) First off the bar tender was rude, slow as hell and terrible at making drinks. My friend and myself order our food and 20 min later out comes my friends food. After almost an hour of waiting, I still had NO pizza. When I asked the cranky pants bar tender in the NICEST possible way, where it was, he just shrugged and walked away. I asked to speak to a manager and was told he was "busy." Finally someone came to talk to me and after an hour and a half I got my shitty pizza.  Thank you to the kitchen manager for doing his job and coming to talk to the customer. But, to the bar tender working earlier New Year's Eve. You DO NOT DESERVE THIS JOB AND SHOULD BE FIRED.

2_Svo_-BzAQIiMW8FiDk5w.text: About the only reason I'm giving them 3 stars is because I really enjoyed there Hot Lobster Roll.  When I first got there about 8p I saw maybe 6-8 people.  Sign when coming in said "please wait to be seated". Waited about 5-10 minutes and the staff saw me and didn't even respond.  I had to initiate the communication as to if this was open seating.  After I seated myself at the bar, the bartender was tentative to me.   The fries are what has been shared through other reviews, not the best, light and airy.   Had a Tuxedo for Dessert and was rather tasty, asked they make it there and they don't. Those are outsourced.

nUhI9gxV1fCi9cP-gK-CKQ.text: Hot Lobster Roll was absolutely delicious! Went during the week around lunchtime and had no wait time to be seated.   Food was prompt and service was excellent. Will definitely be back!

vkHthpUXydh_LFM95aL28g.text: We ate there a few days ago after the lunch rush. The service was good but the food left much to be desired. My husband had the fish sandwich which was all breading. My lump crab cake didnt have lumps of crab and all you could taste was the sauce they mixed the crab. It was not worth the total at the end. That was with no alcohol. We won't  be back.

lF4nWwjXwInWHvXfyc_kug.text: I haven't been here in a couple years. I have to say, it was AWESOME! They really spruced up the place. Nice new Roland's glasses, food was very good. I usually get the bucket of mussels but i saw someone else get them and now they are on a plate/tray when served. No biggie, i'm certain they're still delicious. I opted for the Maryland Crab Chowder, which was incredible and the Lobster Roll. The Lobster Roll was just as i remembered, awesome. I don't think they raised their prices since the last time i was there, 2 or 3 years ago. The only reason i'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because their bathroom is filthy. Also their iron landing was closed. Food and service were supreme! Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Roll
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Maryland Crab Chowder

lIOFQ2r4B583-yxH8ZiyJg.text: Stopped in on a Saturday for lunch with my wife.  The clam chowder was awesome and so were the lump crab cakes.   The place was hopping too!  Waiter was good too.

aiiaAlGRXUsKxaT3Wj4ocw.text: Yuck!  It's almost embarrassing having this place exist in the Strip with so many tourists coming here.  That has to be how they're making their money because it's certainly not on their food or service.  Well, maybe it's the booze too...  I don't even know where to begin.  Service was horrible.  The lunch took 2 hours.  On a leisurely Sunday that may be fine, but there was no leisure.  At least not with drinks not in hand until a 1/2 an hour after we sat down.  I'd say lunch was served another 1/2 to 45 minutes later.    It didn't matter though, I knew it wasn't going to be anything spectacular.  I'd heard rumors about the food.  I won't go into any details but I wouldn't trust some items on the menu.  I just played it safe and ordered a veggie salad.    The salad was in the entree section, so I assumed it would be a full size salad.  It was not.  It was a side salad with a handful of grilled veggies on top.  Nothing spectacular.  And a side salad at almost $11.  Not worth it.    If you are forced to stop in because you're dying of hunger, stick to a liquid diet:)

TISsHcMguDZeEvHjoucMoQ.text: Nope...came here with my son. He ordered swordfish, I ordered the seafood stew...25 minutes between the 2 dishes.

LQt5h7WnkR51QEgjh6HzLw.text: I really wanted to like this place. The beer choices and the casual menu was right up my alley. Unfortunately the food was not. The "famous" lobster roll had so much butter on it I think I am going to have a heart attack in my sleep tonight. Can't recommend the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Butter filled lobster roll

N2FXkQpoI_FrEyTjgXwecA.text: Terrible service, along with terrible food. Got the land and sea 6oz filet and stuffed lobster tail. Worst steak and lobster I've ever had! Very dry, no seasoning on anything! Plain steamed vegetables are served with plain, tough filet, and tiny lobster tail with dry crab "stuffing" thrown on top of the tail. I can't believe I wasted my money on this place.

E45kYli2mP-lXa2eeDT_cA.text: We went there for our anniversary dinner and we didn't get our appetizer and no one brought me my food, or cared that I didn't get served. No one checked on us either, and when we complained, they honestly couldn't care less. I told our waiter to forget my order and that we were leaving because our meal was ruined, and he still made us pay. Needless to say, we won't be returning.

8uoUJc2BvUd1au_SJBs_ug.text: Was looking for an early lunch with my son. Stumbled on to Roland's and decided to give it a try. I had a bowl of clam chowder and a chipped salad, both were huge and only $5 each. The chowder was great and the chopped salad was a little over done with cucumbers, but overall pretty nice salad. My son had the beef tips sandwich which was excellent. I tried one of the tips and it was absolutely tender and tasty. Highly recommended sandwich! Overall decent service and a decent lunch.

g17exIdoUhJciySMX3LgtA.text: It was fine. The Maryland chowdah was a little spicy as stated. The New England chowdah lacked clams and clam flavor. It was almost like a cream of potato soup. The lobster rolls were in a huge, thick toasted bread. Can't even fit in your mouth to take a bite. I just ate it open faced with a fork. The lobster quesadilla was greasy and heavy from so much butter, cheese and oil. The mashed potatoes were the best though.  Service was good with our party of ten.

Y3EdLxCfhbLmci0oC-fVug.text: I had high hopes. Hotel staff said it was a good place to eat. We arrived about 30 minutes before the dinner menu was offered, and were seated immediately. Music was a bit too loud. I was excited by the prospect of a hot lobster roll and lobster bisque. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. Our server was polite and our food was ready quickly, but in the words of Randy Jackson: "...it was just alright for me, dawg."

lvfb7lC2OTAdZ2v5s5Vx9A.text: Like a glutton for punishment, I hit up Roland's again last night while in town for business. I tired Kaya, but the wait was 30 + minutes.  Here's the big clue I keep ignoring....the restaurant is EMPTY when everywhere else is crowded. Another issue is there's poor A/C in the dining room, which kind of sucks when it's 85 degrees and humid outside.   I had a grilled vegetable sandwich and clam chowder. Same as before, it was just OK.  Service was better this time though.   All in all, I preferred my to go taco salad from doba the night before to this meal.   Save your money and try somewhere else.   PS. Beer selection is impressive if you want to drink beers from all around the world.

_nVoYxULba_UA2myouNjYw.text: Nice location and sitting on the patio when it is nice out can be great, BUT (and this is a big butt) the food is just terrible, and the service is not so good either.  If you are going in for a few drinks, this may be a fine spot to stop into while you are in the Strip but for anything more, my advice would be to head elsewhere as there are plenty of better options.   I have been in here on a few occasions for dining while we were meandering around the Strip (as I was giving it more than 1-2 chances) and each time my disappointment with the place grew.  I did not think it would get worse after my first trip there in years.    Some items on the menu that were terrible were the calamari, the zucchini and the artichoke and spin dip... how do you mess these up?  The Lobster ravioli was not so good either.  If you want a better experience in the Strip, go to Kaya, Little Bangkok or Eleven... do not waste your money here as you are not going to be getting what you paid for and will leave very unsatisfied.

t4Z-6XIfoielODly0hXWzA.text: The ahi tuna contained sheets of sinewy, tough tissue that made it inedible. My uneaten tuna sat on my plate in front of me (during a group event) for more than an hour before the server removed it. There weren't enough staff so she simply was not able to ask anyone how the food was. The restaurant was too busy.   The mashed potatoes were good.

F_3n5y35zexX7CeyFTc8fw.text: They have got to be known for their Lobster rolls.  Its a generous portion of lobster meat and their fresh cut fries with malt vinegar is a homerun.  This sandwich should be the Pittsburgh sandwich at least in my opinion.

RhrX4426DXmvwMteB33g7g.text: There is just something about Roland's that makes it one of my favorite spots in the city (of all time)  The location is awesome, right in the strip district. Which as many of you know is completely the place to be on Saturday and Sunday mornings/afternoons. The street is packed with vendors and there are no shortage of restaurants. This restaurant though, is THE spot to watch any and all PGH sporting events. I love coming here on Steeler Sunday's to watch the games. ESPECIALLY for home games, talk about a fun place to be!  The food is awesome, hands down some of the best around. I really love the calamari, and always recommend it. The beer is cold, and there is a huge menu selection.  During warmer months there is upstairs patio seating (view of the city) and also outdoor patio seating that is street level.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Famous lobster roll
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beer Steamed Shrimp
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cold beer

KNGoNifb4ooa8SrvRsFaDw.text: My first time being here! Lets start with the fact that I'm a seafood lover so my standards are pretty high. This is a pretty standard/basic seafood establishment in my opinion. It didn't "wow" me but it wasnt awful. The salad was very basic. The Italian dressing was delicious however. My crab cakes weren't the best crab cakes that I'd ever had. I liked the option of the outdoor seating! I honestly cant see myself going back. The food scene in Pittsburgh is quite impressive and this restaurant just doesnt stand up to the competition. The service was quick but inattentive. Drinks-no straw. Food- no napkins. To go containers for sauce- no lids.   I did however manage to snap some awesome pictures.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garden salad.
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jumbo lump crab cakes.

c8Nzm8FoNp9VhyIzr4FaCA.text: The seafood they give is a lot! The place has outdoor seating and a nice bar area. I would recommend the roland's seafood stew, the calamari and the pasta di mare. The lobster ravioli is really good but has a mild taste so not for everyone. The service is really great and they are very helpful.   I could imagine this place getting busy. This is definitely a local go-to for seafood lovers. I was not impressed with the lobster roll, I typically don't like the lobster fried. I would say it doesn't have the same style of cooking as a maine lobster roll if that is what you are looking for. The angry mussels are a must try and a great appetizer to share with a group of people. Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. calamari
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. angry Mussels
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. lobster roll

O_R9nyPagcI-rFBe8EYWkg.text: Honestly not a great experience. I've only been to Roland's one other time before (heard about the "world famous" lobster roll) and I remember being dissapointed then. It's been a few years and I work in the area so I figured it couldn't hurt to give it another try since I was craving seafood. Definitely hasn't physically hurt me...yet, however I will not be back. After this visit I'm convinced I definitely do not like Roland's Seafood Grill. The service was ok except for  when I arrived it was still lunch and I was given a dinner menu which has different options then what's offered at lunch. Seemed more limited and my choice of Pizza Di Mare was wildly dissapointing and a little burnt. Also I wouldn't have chosen it had the lunch menu been made available to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

R7VJfLOw-DHEr1mvugIVUg.text: Roland's was recommended to us by a family friend so we stopped in for our last meal in Pittsburgh. After four days in this town of eating and drinking I wasn't looking for a LOT of food, just something to hold me over until we got back to Jersey.   We waited for about 60 seconds for a table to be cleaned up and were seated in a booth. No more drinking for us we we just got iced teas and water, but this place does have a pretty extensive list of beers on tap and by the bottle/can.   Wifey decided on the Fish tacos, my son had the Margherita wood fired pizza (personal size) and I had the Beer battered fish sandwich. I wanted the lobster roll but thought it would be too rich after the past four days.  My son hammered the pizza...absolutely loved it (he's not as much of a pizza snob as I am, but I can't comment since he wouldn't give me a taste). Wifey really liked her tacos...two giant fried fish tacos that she just ate the insides out of the second one. My fish sandwich was probably the best fish sandwich I ever had and it was huge. Easily enough for two sandwiches. My brief conversation with the waitress:  Me: "That was the best fish sandwich I've ever eaten in my life. "  Waitress Christy: "Awww, well I'm happy for you hon" (translated-that's nice sweetie...now get out so I can make more tips.  But seriously in a nice way. )  The one very disappointing item was the fries. They LOOKED well done, but they weren't. They were kind of a soggy mess. Anyway, very good entrees, huge portions, fun service...I would eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margherita pizza
