ZUTDrftV5Aj9kjPCdoOjbg.text: I was craving a lobster roll so Yelp directed us to Roland's. They have both a lobster roll entree and the lobster sliders appetizer which is what I went with. The waitress told me it was the same amount of lobster as is in the single roll, and it was less money so that is what I went with.  I started off with a bowl of the clam chowder, recommended by our waitress. It arrived in a huge bowl! I would have been totally satisfied with just that for my lunch. Very good, and for $5 a great price too. My husband went with the Proscuitto and Arugula pizza. Loved it, finished off the whole pie! My sliders were less exciting. The rolls were just too much. Since they were mini rolls they were kind of dry and I should have just gone with the regular sized roll. The lobster filling was great, so I finished all of that and left most of the bread. Overall the meal was pretty good. Probably not great enough to warrant a second visit, but definitely try the chowder.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Roll Sliders
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Prosciutto Arugula Pizza
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Clam Chowder

h0b2R2SaCGQ4YP1vOtTAGg.text: This past Friday was my first visit to Roland's. Roland's wasn't the original plan, but when things fell through, we were quick to decide on Roland's as there is a nice outdoor seating area. Sitting outside, we figured we could enjoy some of the last of our summer evenings before fall comes. I don't even want to think about that yet!  My friend and her fiance came to meet my boyfriend and I in the strip for a little double date and to grab a bite to eat. We were seated immediately outside and our waiter brought us some lemon water. My boyfriend ordered a beer, and we took a moment to glance over the menu as we were both newcomers here. My friend and her boyfriend actually went on one of their very first dates here years ago. They were quick to decide on the lobster bisque to share, and the seafood pizza with shrimp, scallops, lobster, and whatever else the ocean has to offer. My boyfriend opted for the fried fish sandwich and I got the sweet chili shrimp from the appetizer menu. It was a hard choice, though, because I love some good seafood!  First, the waiter brought their soup. We waited for our food while they ate, and they brought out both of our orders and the pizza right around the same time so we could all eat together. My favorite thing about the sweet chili shrimp (aside from the sauce, one of my favorites) was that it was battered with cornmeal rather than a traditional batter. My boyfriend's fish sandwich was seriously massive and he ate every bite of it. He's allergic to shrimp, so although the seafood pizza looked incredible, we'd have to make another choice from the menu if we were to go for a pizza. The menu had a lobster artichoke pizza that sounded amazing, and that's what I'll have my sights set on for next time.   During our visit there was nothing wrong at all with our service or our food. Everything was delicious and our waiter was quick to accommodate us and he was friendly. There was a small mistake with our checks because he put my boyfriend's beer on the wrong check, but he was fast when fixing it. All in all for around $30, Roland's was a great choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet chili shrimp

GniBs3gWu7gk0-A5Hs7Ckg.text: nice location, good service, great food and ok price, only thing is when you walk in, the sign at reception said"wplease wait to be seated" and we waited for 5', nobody came to say hi or anything, then we went straight upstair and got seated by the bartender, little bit off for me that part. The rest is awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. bill
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. garlic and parmasan wings
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. fried chicken sand

KfR_uIAqlJ8ZSFHtPG6kgQ.text: Very disappointing. Waited at hostess station for several minutes before the appearance of a host or hostess or anyone greeted us. A waitress walked by and there was bartender insight but no one greeted or spoke to us or the other customers waiting to be seated. After we were seated the server was very nice and service was fast. The shrimp and cocktail sauce were great. The disappointment was the clams which were sandy and tasted like the clams were not cleaned properly. We ordered the oysters cooked and they were fine. The lobster rolls were fine but on the dry side. Crab stuffed mushrooms had a strange taste. The calamari was over cooked and pieces were stuck together in a lump. Since the server never asked how the food was... I can only assume that they get a lot of complaints.

Qa5zeH8uM1m8t4jHNa-0DA.text: Roland's seafood grill here in Pittsburgh marked today's lunch stop. Had their famous hot Lobster roll. Now as it was good it was more roll than meat and too much of the garlic butter. Made it a tad greasy. I saw 4 other lobster rolls come and all had more meat than what came on mine. Oh well. The meat was very good though.  The coleslaw was nothing to write home about. Fries were pretty good. Service was amazing! Waitress was prompt and friendly and kept the ice teas a coming.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot lobster roll. Needs a little more meat and less butter

hcAHnjRMoIXAjOPLQOL_AA.text: Great food, had clam chowder, lobster bisque, shrimp po'boy & lobster roll sandwich! Service was great and our waitress Kim was fantastic! Definitely coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Roll
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp Po&#39;Boy

RB7HMU6GxTW_8KIx84SNJg.text: The food here always seem to be constant and very healthy portion. I got the shrimp po boy this time , and our group of friends shared the mussels and chicken nachos as the appetizer, so good ! This place was PACKED on a Sunday lunch , but the bartender got to us quickly and we didn't have to wait long for a table. Our server wasn't the best, good enough, but seemed frustrated with the busy afternoon. That all being said , I would certainly go back ! I ordered a Bloody Mary which was good, and my friend ordered a Manhattan which was huge but quite delicious (photos attached).

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MvjOZM4KKP7Jppm8HJ4c_g.text: Do yourself the largest favor and go here for your next family meal! We chose this place for a birthday dinner with friends because the restaurant we originally chose in the strip was a 2 hour wait. We had a party of about 12 so we figured it would be even longer than that. We chose Roland's strictly because it didn't have a wait and they could get a table together for us in 5 minutes. We had a GREAT MEAL. Almost everyone got salads to start and my Caesar salad was HUGE. I had to stop eating it because I knew a meal was coming. I got the lobster bisque which was pretty good. I also shared the lobster nachos with my boyfriend. THIS was the kicker. I could eat these things every single day. They were loaded with huge lumps of lobster, a lot of it from the claw, and the best white queso. I would come back specially for this. It was so good that I would've never ordered the salad or soup and just ordered 2 plates of nachos if I had known. We are DEFINITELY coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster nachos OMG YES YES YES
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Friend ordered the fish sandwich and it&#39;s as if he ordered 3 of them!

GeQeaOhL74Fi2-eQPHyvWQ.text: This place is all hype. When we got there, it took a while for us to be helped. A girl got our drinks and just ended taking our order cause it took so long. Came mainly for the lobster rolls, and they were good but nothing to go crazy over. The bread was a little stale on the outside, but the inside was good. The lobster tasted good. The lobster bisque was my creamy and delightful. The spicy tomato soup, pass. The portion of the soup were huge! They were shareable and were a good price.  The oysters did not smell or taste fresh. Would I come back? Meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster slider rolls.
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy tomato soup.
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters: wasn&#39;t that fresh.

3a4qNKwVyKcGu4vL-8zJwA.text: Walking the Strip on a monday evening we came across this place. My wife got the pasta de mare Seafood was fresh Sauce was yummy And a huge portion I dont like seafood so I got the Mediterranean chicken pasta and had my doubts  Well it was awesome And loads of kalamata olives and feta cheese 2 ingredients usually skimped upon I recommend this place whether you like seafood or not

DtURbwQZ3S-PC9QEYcS5AA.text: Great food, quick service and a very chill environment! On the cutest street with tons of vendors! We came at prime time Saturday night (7:00) got sat right away and despite the packed restaurant and busyness our food was ordered and to us very fast! Solely seafood and very good platters! Everyone at my table was pleased!

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet tip sandwich and fries
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is what I had! Bruschetta chicken!
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster ravioli, huge platter

PH0LSParZFU9VtuCvW0scA.text: Roland's patios (upstairs and downstairs) can't be beat on a nice day in the Strip as far as location. However, the food and service we experienced recently were mediocre.   I ordered the fish tacos, which came as a pair and I was surprised by the hefty amount of broiled white fish on each one. Sadly, that's all the tacos really were...two big tortillas + fish. They lacked flavor, spice, salsa or something (anything) more inviting than a few green lettuce leaves shoved underneath the big hunk of fish. I also opted to go with a side salad instead of the standard fries. This was a $3 upcharge - a substitution cost is pretty normal - but all I got was a wilty pile of mostly iceberg lettuce, some shredded carrots, two cherry tomatoes, and a couple of olives. When I was done, I had a little napkin full of slimy lettuce I had to set aside and not eat.  My husband ordered a grilled chicken sandwich. He said he liked it and...he also likes just about anything. :) The fries that came with his sandwich seemed like they had the potential to be good, if they were actually served hot.   As far as service goes, it was sufficient. Nothing to write home about. I noticed that tables surrounding us were left filled with plates, dirty napkins, etc. for far too long after other diners had left. Particularly for a table right next to ours, the food did not get cleaned off during the entire time we were there, which was about an hour!

61BNn1ZiodwdW_MNbJtifA.text: I had never been to Roland's. However, being a relatively new translating to the Pittsburgh area, I figured I'd spend sometime at this eatery on the Strip. I can say that i was disappointed with my meal. I had the lobster ravioli. The short review is this: bland, chewy, and clearly dated presentation. It seems that this is a place where one should go watch a Penguins or Steelers game, have a few drinks, and maybe enjoy some appetizers. However, when it comes to "real" food, I suggest to stay away. I was especially disappointed with the bar staff. When I mentioned the bartender that my food was bland, instead of taking my comments seriously, he passed the condiment caddy to "help me out."   In short, come for the drinks, not for the food.

5hNxTtwSjJB0HnVHkUCFww.text: Enjoyed the visit. The bread is excellent and I had the chicken blt sandwich.   Piled high with fries, nice thick sliced Mancini bread and buttered and grilled to perfection. The pickles were thick sliced and were great kosher flavor. The bacon was thin but was crispy. Chicken was blackened and great grill flavor.   Fresh cut skin on fries were piled high and could have been crispier like 5 guys fries are but they were good.   Overall great value and decent food

a-Oh6XQ-s7-I0oAxMC2mZQ.text: Nice find on our walk through the Strip District.  Our server Alli O was pleasant and helpful.  Our lunch was delicious and drinks very refreshing. Will definitely be back.

KF2FZGi4aBD6KOaAzCo-CQ.text: I was visiting Pittsburgh on a work related trip and the group I was with took us to Roland's for dinner. I was apprehensive bc of it's 2.5 star Yelp rating, but didn't get a chance to read the reviews beforehand (I've since read a few of the bad ones). That said, I was very pleasantly surprised with my meal because I wasn't expecting much. I ordered the Cajun shrimp appetizer and this is the only reason I'm giving 4 stars. The shrimp were very spicy but not flavorful. I like spicy food but not when it's just hot for no reason without flavor. The mango salsa it came with made it bearable. Now let's get down the business, my main meal was the Roland's Seafood stew which was DELICIOUS! The stew is a light cream based broth with lobster, shrimp, scallops, mussels, clams and potatoes. If licking the bowl in public were appropriate, I would've. More fun facts, the food came out relatively fast and our waiter was super friendly and quick - she was literally hustling back and forth. I'll bookmark this spot for the next time I visit.

mBEQa0fIL_81ae1owIrF3Q.text: Ordered the clam chowder. It came out barely warm. The calamari was terrible unless you like calamari the size of Texas onion rings. There were a lot of people there, so maybe it's just a good place for drinks, but if you're looking for good food, go elsewhere.

fSNjF9MI_inFi2zXFtnY9w.text: Worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant. The waiter was incredibly slow. We were one of the first people to arrive at the restaurant at 11am and the Food took 1 hour to arrive after ordering. Many other tables received their food before us even though they ordered after us. They brought one of my daughters meals after about 20 minutes while my other daughter had to sit there and watch her eat while she was hungry. We ended up having to take the food to go after an hour given how long it took. Spoke with the manager who had minimal compassion for the experience and worst of all this occurred on Mothers Day. By far the worst experience at a restaurant that I ever have. Do yourself a favor and go ANYWHERE else.

T2MM-X4ByZH4bMUI4W_Hog.text: We loved the seafood. The waiter suggested The appetizers and they were great. The lobster sliders were amazing and also the lobster nachos were very good. Will go back again  The service was great.

DT1IBQOIMI4QHtpq4bf-4A.text: Iconic Strip District Establishment known for their Fresh Oysters, Shrimp, Fish Sandwiches and the Best Lobster Roll in town on grilled Mancini's bread. Don't forget to try a Bloody Mary or a beer. The variety is huge and sure to please everyone. When the weather is nice nothing is better than sitting on the rooftop patio having a weekend lunch while watching the hustle and bustle of people out n about shopping in the area. Service is usually good unless it's very busy but for the most part I've never had any complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6sh58v8UK_Uoe9y5cGWzqA.text: I want to start by saying that I currently work in the food service industry & understand/sympathize with how challenging this kind of job can be. However, each time I have gone to Roland's I have been extremely disappointed in the service; Hosts were focused more on talking to each other, rather than helping customers. The servers seem lost, perhaps I've just gotten new staff members each time, but I personally think they need more training. The bartenders, however, were a lot better, they knew the menu, valued cleanliness, and maintained a positive relationship with patrons. With all that said, the real shoutout needs to go to kitchen staff, despite underwhelming customer service, the food is what always brings me back!  I recommend the lobster nachos, stuffed mushrooms, or mussels! So yummy!

hQDwxiO649ZocM6Q8o5h-g.text: Brought my family here and everyone loved it. Anything lobster is amazing and their portions are huge. I had the fish sandwich and it could feed two it's so big. Perfectly crispy and juicy in the center. Love this place.

7jpcg2DbRxULHmoSAGxFYQ.text: Raw bar was great  , fish tacos worth sitting down for . great atmosphere ,                         fun place to hang out .

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rkO3_w9uZEEIPa9QhMbLEg.text: I LOVE Roland's !!! Always amazing seafood and kickass servers - not sure why the hate on yelp ???,

puK_ym5rqovWE7cwZTHHBg.text: Terrible experience here. The food was way overpriced and tasted like overcooked slabs of meat. We ordered the mussels as an appetizer, a swordfish entree, and an ahi tuna entree. We got our appetizer, salads, and entrees at the same time and everything was cold. I don't know how you can manage to overcook food and then it's still cold, but that's what happened. The mussels were barely seasoned and were hardly edible.   I never complain at restaurants, but our meals were so bad that we had to complain to the manager. Luckily, he appologized and took one of the entrees off. I can't believe how bad the food was and that they're charging so much for it. It was awful.

UimAAkBsIb1AbKvZNA7RAA.text: Dateline: Late yesterday afternoon.  Kay's friend Nadine said she wanted pho. Then she said she didn't and didn't really care where we went.   I wanted to try the new Argentinian restaurant across from Altar Bar, but we found out the hard way that they're closed on Mondays. Neither Kay nor Nadine felt like walking up Smallman Street for anything. Kay despises Primanti Brothers.   Nadine spots Roland's Seafood Grill. My heart falls into my intestines.   "Oh, I like Roland's," she utters innocently. "Let's go there."   "Maybe we could go to Harp and Fiddle," I suggest.   Kay whispers to me through her clenched teeth, "No. Yelp...ing to...night. And no...more...walking. You...don't need to only go to places you haven't reviewed yet."  So, yeah. We went back to Roland's.   And like my last experience, it wasn't half-atrocious.   The fried calamari is actually well-battered and quite plump and tasty aside from the inexplicable inclusion of lifeless sauteed onions.   And that lobster roll of theirs, the one Roland's is supposedly famed for, contains within a tough, toasted Fenway Park-styled bun some fat chunks of choice, succulent crustacean meat. The sandwich came with a small cup of middling cole slaw and a pile of limp, dark, blanched steak fries as if to remind me of where I was really having dinner, and it wasn't some oceanside shack in Maine.   Nadine's Basil and Pesto Pizza was also an unlikely winner with its luscious artichoke pieces almost thieving thunder from the blackened, wood-fired crust, dreamy cheese, and caramelized red peppers. The sauce was but an afterthought.   Our server, Ahsan (?), was competent and friendly.   If you stick with pizza or sandwiches, you should have a tolerable time at Roland's. Therefore, consider this 3 a higher 3 than before. I'd give them a 4, but to be truthful, I'm not dying to return due to the paucity of their card. There's just too much good, good food goin' on in this neighborhood.   Try not to use the bathrooms, either. The men's restroom reeked of urine and was very unkempt overall.

IWfBH8U_-pisHgoQBKD9pQ.text: I ended up eating here out of hunger and exhaustion during my weekend in pittsburgh last week. We mentioned to the server we were not from here and unsure what we wanted and he offered no help, just walked away but kept coming back to the table every few minutes saying, "so, what can i get you?". We decided on things and order. Worst service i've had in a long time, rude and he didn't really care to help us at all. We ended up getting the lobster ravioli and a wood fired pizza and both were average at best. For a $30 meal each, not great. Really the service is what did it for me. I will remember to never return while i'm in pittsburgh.   Another thing was that we were sitting in basically a sports bar spending$30 on ravioli. Horrible atmosphere for the food on the menu in parts.

e3E19PvU8bpZwtsneRsO5A.text: Happy hour food specials are worth a trip to Roland's. The drink specials aren't really worth writing about but the clams and oysters are great for the price! The shrimp happy hour special was good but the shrimp are small so that was kind of disappointing. Ask for bread with whatever you order. The bread is so good.

__HNNlJ_UtzJu3fm3EUkig.text: Stopped here for lunch after shopping at the strip on a Sunday afternoon. The Steelers were playing, so the place was packed. We were able to sit outside on the patio, which was nice. Our waiter was friendly, very busy. He said they were under staffed due to sending staff hime early. Rookie mistake for an older place like Rolands. He kept us happy the best he could. Ordered the stuffed mushrooms which were not bad. Split the beer battered fish sandwich. It was huge! Glad we split it. Pretty crispy and very hot! The drink specials were good during the game 3$  for 16 Oz Coors light. The womens restrooms were dirty. Overall not a great experience, but not a terrible one either.

g716DqxfLJP7Pmp4ijR5pQ.text: Ok. Spoke to soon. Bar server took the bad raw bar off my bill.  Still worried about what bad clam is going to fo to me!!!

g_Ff6qwFKmjMByHzNo6rIA.text: I've been here before but last night will probably be the last time I ever have any type of desire to eat their food. My boyfriend and I were meeting my parents for dinner and everywhere we tried was booked for reservation only on Pitts graduation weekend. We ended up and Roland's and were seated within 5 minutes.  Our waitress was a combination of ditzy, snobby and bored. She was awkward and uncomfortable every time she came to the table. She is not a good candidate to be in the service industry, in my opinion.   We ordered the lobster roll sliders to start. There were 4 of us and they brought out three. No big deal- mom and I will split one....but the waitress only brought three plates. I ordered the Maryland crab soup (specified first) and hot lobster Caesar salad. My salad came out shortly after the appetizer sliders. I sat for 15 minutes without touching the salad as to wait for the rest of everyone to get their food. Finally it was delivered. My dad and boyfriend had the seafood stew which they said was good and my mom had the pasta di mare (she said it was just ok. Lacking flavor) and a salad (which she was never given and didn't realize until after we left).  No soup for me apparently. I requested the waitress please bring it out. She was unapologetic.   When I finally got to dive into my hot lobster (now cold lobster) caesar, I realized it was just lettuce, a little cheese and the lobster. At this point I was so irritated with everything I didn't even care - nor was I surprised at the quality of my dish given everything leading up to it.  The lobster was good and there was a good bit of it plus the Caesar dressing which I always like. The Maryland crab soup tasted like chunky tomato marinara sauce and I gave it to my boyfriend to go home and use on his own homemade seafood pasta dish. My mom was disgusted by the clams in her dish and it was suggested that they were probably frozen.   Do yourself a favor and go down the street to luke wholeys Alaskan grill where you get much better quality seafood for the same price. After I had been there; I feel totally ripped off by Roland's. No bueno.

DR1Bm2pMSMUJEMNQrR2x6Q.text: Here's a little story...  The first time I ate here was with 3 friends right after the Pens won the Stanley cup this last time. All of us got violently ill despite eating different things.  The bathrooms were atrocious. There was toilet paper everywhere. There were some bugs in the ladies room.  This was mid-day and NOT the southside so I found it a bit surprising.  The last few times I've eaten here have been in the last 2 years and everytime I find the food and environment to be mediocre.  It's never horrible. Hasn't made me sick, again.  It's just sub par.  My s.o. likes the lobster roll here and says it's great.  I don't eat seafood often so I wouldn't know. I've had the white pizza with basil and it was pretty good.  Good cheese to crust ratio for sure. I wouldn't say not to go here, but if you're looking to get something delicious and exciting I'd suggest finding something else in the strip.

5K8SVcP4M7-s3edQhsjIZA.text: If I had to chose between dining at Roland's again, or having to catch running chainsaws that were tossed at me I'd pick dining at Rolands but only by the slimmest of margins.  Why on earth did I go back to this restaurant?  Clearly, I must not love myself or something.  Want to pay too much money for fish that smells like a sewer?  Dine at Roland's.  The only reason to be at Rolands is to drink there.  they have a pretty decent beer selection.

O-_eyiLNPtmzZjgqJueipA.text: Clean atmosphere, food was ok. We ordered and split the famous lobster sandwich. Beer was kind of flat. My wife and I prefer Bella Notte next door.

k8abnHdL1M7KilJR9AzmWw.text: I experienced first hand why this place got only 2.5 stars Everything was awful, from the no crabmeat soup to the over cooked lobster(roll). Down right awful

aXjzqPbxORNtZlSyA7hQzQ.text: Great place!  Expect to wait a bit, but be patient, it's worth it!  The staple there is the famous hot lobster roll on Mancini bread. Amazing!

L4VYr4GU9iwUjrGxhGSLGg.text: Oh shoot me! I thought the seafood pizza was really good as were the mussels. The service was decent to boot. The only thing I hated was dessert.

tFUoZ1dtAIZdSh7C5b8hYA.text: The service was great. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. The food, however, was disappointing. The calamari was actually really nice, light and not super greasy, but the Cajun shrimp were tiny and underwhelming. With six very small pieces bathing in oil and a side of flavorless mango salsa, I would not recommend this appetizer at all. I got the shrimp scampi entree, which comes with the vegetable of the day, salad and potatoes. The potatoes and salad were good, but the corn was very small and brown. It looked like it went bad and they cooked it anyway. Then I tasted it and knew it went bad and they cooked it anyway. That, for me, ruined my whole meal. No amount of butter and salt could save that corn. My bf got the steak with battered shrimp. He enjoyed his meal but didn't want the potatoes and corn. They wouldn't substitute with anything except salad so basically it was $30 for a piece of steak and a few pieces of shrimp. For seafood, in general, the prices were not bad, but I rather pay more and have a better quality meal.

qiNEHHMt9iNs0fvrD8KY5Q.text: WARNING ,,,,, this place is for SUCKERS ONLY ..... funky smelling ,worse tasting seafood ... overpriced ..... raunchy,un-clean restrooms .... only reason anyone goes here is because this is a ''tourist trap '' type neighborhood with some fun shopping spots nearby and this restaurant is positioned in the center of everything. As P.T. Barnum once said  '' There's a sucker born every minute '' ...... stay away ... any other restaurant will be better .

nqFULikCx8HPUZjmuTvNeg.text: Went to this place for lunch last Saturday, party of five. The service was extremely slow and every beer we tried to order, got the response "We are out of that one".   Finally when we got our sandwiches (after a long wait) but no coleslaw and fries were soggy and stale. When asked the waitress for coleslaw (which is supposed to be the side with every sandwich), the response was "I think we are out, but let me check". And the waitress didn't return until after we were done eating.  Forget about getting a refill for your drink or water..

uOCq4uBNz6tM1qwedoG-JA.text: I hesitate to even write this review because technically we didn't eat here.  But after reading the other reviews, I thought "Eh, what the hell."  We came in and were seated at 5:45pm for desserts/drinks.   By 6:05, we still hadn't seen our waitress.  We decided it wasn't worth it and just left.  I did eat here a month ago, and yes -- the fried fish was fried to the point where it was beyond greasy.  And then to pay around $20 for that?  LOL.  Right.  I won't be back.

ifXvdA6rpyPEvtZTfXkUIw.text: Why cant they do a fresh fish sandwich.? Looks great, but when you try to cut it all the breading slides off like a sleeve, and the fish is slimy and flavorless. Absolutely no taste and slightly underdone.  Clams and oysters not bad, but Luke Wholeys 'much better. 2 stars for cleanliness, everything else a solid 3. Could be good, but crowded enough they dont need to try harder

N-j4rnE5C6-92Vq42zodoA.text: I liked the bar.   The food not at all. First time here, wife and I sat at the bar and people watched over some WELL POURED drinks.   Strong point.  Then we screwed up and ordered food.   I got their infamous lobster roll.  Glad I had a drink.  Overcooked and dry, dry, dry. I thought lobster roll was generally made with a lobster salad-like mix.  This lobster was dry and chewy.  Lots of it, though  I guess that accounts for the high price.   I went down to Wholeys and got a much tastier one for 5 bucks.  And wife's nachos were just a big pile of chips with some toppings thrown on the top.  Then the other day,  we went back and I tried pizza.  Yuck.  The toppings were terrible (pepperoni, sausage.  how can youscrew that up, but they did.)  Two slices and boxed it up so as not to hurt the waitress' feelings.  But it went into the trashcan down the street.  Go for the hootch and not the food!!

l2k5GNOyw3k7rCJ8P8Wd4w.text: I use to love Rolands. However, the last few times we have been there it has been terrible.  While the food remains okay, the service leaves something to be desired.  Our waitress took longer than 15 minutes to come over and get our drink order; we had to get the hostess to find her.  She did not come back to the table for more than 20 minutes at a time.  The waitress was rude and less than helpful.  Our 1 drink and lunch took over two hours to complete.  Good thing they still have a good bloody mary.

JS2DeukIFq9-7GzDQP7S_w.text: Just awful.   My companions each ordered an Alfredo pasta and they both honestly thought (through the entire meal) that Roland's had served mashed potatoes on the pasta.  We thought "maybe it's a 'burgh thing."  Nope, we were informed at the end of the meal by the waiter that it was indeed Alfredo sauce and that the chef "just liked to use a lot of parmesan cheese in his Alfredo." This stuff was about the consistently of cold oatmeal with oil poured over it (no exaggeration) and there was a bucket full of it on each plate.  Anybody who would serve what was on those plates has no business whatsoever in any kitchen.   By the way, my lobster roll was a buttery, greasy fail as well.  What a complete disaster.

8gMT0Eq_jJhrL1WAMkBWww.text: My scallops were luke-warm yet overcooked.  The carrots on my salad looked like they had been sitting in the bottom of a fridge for weeks.   The first time I dined here, I was unimpressed with their lobster roll (which is simply a hollowed-out white roll filled with lobster.  bread and seafood, that's IT).  Today, I was unimpressed with everything.  Except the woman two tables over who laughed like cigar-smoking circus clown and looked like Patrick Swayze in drag.  That was pretty awesome.

zYlgr41rWNKWP5u-9fgSTg.text: we went there for st, patrick day. Two harps bottle beers and 12 oyster costs $40.

mUwt_yOkCqRG-E18RJGkjQ.text: BEWARE Duquesne/Pitt families visiting or anyone else!   Awful food and service! Super slow, cold fries, freezer burned carrots, rubbery lobster claws. Wait, Ceasar salad was ok!  Who hunts down the server for 10 minutes to get the check! We could've just left without paying, but I believe in Karma. NO Stars!

rvtKNNT7Scj0fwoaC7c2iw.text: I gave this place a 3 star because the service and drinks are great. It's a great place to have a beer with friends  but the food is gross....

V4bhFElgTswz0qfxrZsA5w.text: Great place in the strip district. Went there after long day at the office for happy hour. 60cent clams / oysters/ shrimp. They were fresh and service was good. I'll be back on my next trip.

wJHCCSThMGXXevv7PrKwQw.text: Stopped in on the Fourth of July for evening cocktail and small meal. From horrible service to terrible seafood...would never return. We waited a very long time for cocktails and order to be taken, when there was little crowd around in the restaurant. Then, our oyster order came out on a plate of water, not ice. They were small and shriveled up and warm. Next, the mussels in white wine sauce....hahahah. Um, no...it was more like garbage sewer sauce. Mussels were freezing COLD. Had to search for a server to get the check, took a long time again. Normally, I would complain right then and there for such terrible food and service but it was one of those days that was going so nicely that complaining about food would just ruin mine and my husband's infrequent night out without kids. I did feel strongly enough to write this review. How can a seafood place serve terrible seafood? I have never given a 0 star review and have worked in the food service industry. This place is terrible. Spend your money somewhere else.

USJp29JLNaXOfQsf6ksSoQ.text: Came here with a bunch of friends on a Friday night to watch the pens game. They have a nice atmosphere and relatively good service considering it was dinner time. A few more tvs and a few more tables would give it at least one more star. One strange thing I have to mention is that they did not have any beer specials during happy hour? Not sure if this is normal, but I thought it was weird for a sports bar type restaurant . Although $.60 oysters was nice during happy hour.

ZdiF2bjdAdfbbqCYzlRpUA.text: Went there Saturday November29, 2014. Entered establishment at 5:30 pm. PROS.....Very good clam chowder...biggest bowl of it I've ever been served. Sandwiches... 2 lobster rolls and 1 fish sandwich.....Both very good, although the fish was slightly overcooked. Again...huge portions.   CONS...After being at table since 5:30, nothing but our empty pop glasses were in front if us. After being told said clam chowder was being freshly cooked, 15 minutes later it was served. As good as it was, it certainly wasn't hot enough to claim it just came out if the pot. Our sandwiches finally came out after other tables around who had ordered well after us received our orders. They may also want to schedule a couple more servers on a Saturday night. The best though was the incompetent hostess. The hostess with the leastest. Talk about someone who didn't have a clue. From screwing up where we were supposed to sit, to watching her continue to do the same thing with others, at least it gave us something to talk about while we waited. What a twit.

P0qV3ul9Ib8cGp0IQqv61g.text: Not sure if it was the food but 2 of us in our party were sick after eating last night.  The only thing we ate that was different from the rest of our party was clam chowder.

ex70S2qbB7FifsVnI8j4RQ.text: Roland's wasnt a bad place to grab a few drinks, a sandwich, and a lobster roll.  The food was pretty good and they have a huge bottled beer selection.  The upstairs patio is by far the most popular place to sit - being above the strip and people watching is nice.   This isn't a place for people who like good draft beer or premium food, it's still a dive bar.  It probably would have received four stars, but our bartender seemed pretty lazy.

su7QAekWQCTOTsmp4Ayh8g.text: Great steamed shrimp, wings, and beer selection. Unfortunately, the service has been very bad. 15 minutes sitting at the bar without a hello was the most recent experience. Also, the upstairs feels a bit grimy.

UiefvhoW2ctHsBs_vi8zBg.text: Stopped by here for a drink and a quick bite.  Our staple is a rum and coke - both of ours were very watered down. Neither of us could really tell their was rum in the drink. We finished and switch to beer after.   Tried the Cajun shrimp and were impressed at the flavor and the mango salsa they paired it with was on point! Very spicy with the fresh jalapeno in it! Watched a few plates come out and the service seemed pretty quick and the food always looked good.

LRCscsbnLIDQH2jdoalntg.text: I was visiting Pittsburgh and searched for the best lobster roll. Roland's seemed to be the most popular. I got the lobster roll and the clam's casino. Both seemed very cheaply made and lacked any taste in my opinion. The service was ok and the bathroom was clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster meat?
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll

vahsxq8eR82VH63xMt6uWA.text: Absolutely love the steamers and buffalo chicken pizza. Great place for family and friends. We love going here for dinner after boating all day. Everything they make is huge from the appetizers to the sandwiches.   Rolands also has a large variety of specialty beers on tap. The bar is a great place to watch a game, have a beer and enjoy the time with friends.

MYZUU2pPLa4ylLOgM3zQpg.text: Great seafood options down in the Strip. Large menu so everyone can find something they like! I got the lobster ravioli and it was very good! The sauce was amazing and I was tying to find ways to eat it all and there were nice chunks of lobster in it. The ravioli itself seemed to have lobster inside but the filling was a little dry, still very good overall. We also got the Cajun shrimp appetizer and it was good but very heavily seasoned in seafood so we had to scrape some off. Still a very good experience overall

KwEL_xQvjy5BPlsVBUKMGw.text: Went here for my birthday dinner and it was all about the lobster roll. Hands down the best place for it, in the city. One of my favorite places in the strip, quality service and the roll is tight!

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Roll!!!

h8qaipT93uU19Okc6ulXQQ.text: Twice I have been here with two separate, self-identified Yinsers who said that I need to experience the "not trashy" Yinser style restaurants in the area. Apparently for the two of them, Rolands is a good example of this. I have yet to experience "trash" Yinser locales, so my frame of reference is still incomplete.  Roland's is low-key and not pretentious. You can show up in cargo shorts and a sports team tshirt at any point in the day and fit in well. The food is average at best, but when you're hungry and don't want to wait in line at Gaucho for 2 hours, this place is a great option. The service staff are nice and attentive, the drinks are strong and cheap, and if you are with good company, Roland's is a lot of fun. Good ambience, nice background music, multiple TVs set to different sports channels. The interior decor is fun in a cheesy way.  It's worth checking out periodically. It's a nice reminder that not every place has to be hip, fresh, contemporary, and overpriced to be worth a visit.

hTciUrH07ZUAgCJx7U7kGg.text: This place is less than mediocre. Visited on a Friday night and it was pretty crowded. We requested a high top near the bar and the hostess was very accommodating.   The food was "meh". The clam chowder was just ok. I was excited for the lobster/artichoke pizza, but it was absolutely tasteless! Like, I was shocked by how much it tasted like nothing. I ended up slathering my clam chowder all over the pizza in an attempt to kick up the flavor. The pizza crust was good -thin and chewy just like I prefer. We also ordered the lobster roll sliders and the best thing about that dish was the Mancini bread.  Not worth the bucks.   The service was slow-mo, but as I mentioned it was a crowded Friday night so it didn't bother me much.   There were a few good beer selections on draft...so that's a plus. But I definitely won't return. Life is too short for less than mediocre food.

BM7J1uvy-uz8K7NLpE1jag.text: I love this place.  Every time i'm in Pittsburgh which is a lest once a year for a Steelers game I come.  I love their Happy Hour yummy and affordable.  I will take a $3.50 beer any day of the week.  Raw bar selection is nice and their mussels so yummy.  I can'rt remember his name but the older gentleman behind the bar is awesome so friendly.

3kKMNM2GjN958KqgTRsVJg.text: THERE ARE RATS HERE. Eat here if you're into dining with rats.   My business partner and I went to Pittsburgh for business and weren't picky about our food but rats is on a whole new level. We didn't see this rat until the end of the meal. Before I saw the rat, I told my business partner that my pasta was the worst plate of pasta I've ever had in my life but ate it anyway because I was so hungry. I regret eating it...  Towards the end of the meal, the rat ran past our table and lingered around the booth areas for awhile and didn't even look scared. It was DISGUSTING.   We told the server who went to get the manager. 5 minutes later, he came out and said "oh well you know we leave the door open sometimes and they just come in." What does that even mean?? He was rude, unapologetic, and nonchalant which made us think this is a common thing for them at the restaurant!  He didn't offer to waive the bill or do anything about it and we stood there in shock and paid $55 for the two of us for a disgusting meal, bad service from the manager, and a RAT running around our table.  Health inspectors, please come look at this restaurant so RATS will stop roaming around.

DAgmJurAcrfljgGqtfGgVg.text: Large beer selection. Large bar and nice upstairs bar. The patio is a great spot to have a drink in the warmer months.   I get the same thing every time I go - lobster roll and fries. It's really good...you get a lot of lobster and nothing else added.  The lobster is the star of the dish. I've had various appetizers and they were all good.

4wLT1x7OiEITh5TdX9aULw.text: Here on business. This was a recommendation from the city bus driver as we wanted to hang out on the strip. I had the seafood stew. It was awesome. Flowing with seafood. I asked for it spicy and it was. Hubby got the stuffed shrimp. It came with a remoulade sauce that I could drink. Prices were affordable. He waitress did warn us that the food came from two different kitchens so they might not come out together. I thought that was strange and they did not come out together but not real far apart. Lots of leftovers. Would definitely return.

auz4Zl-qpr97jWN2LTwpjw.text: Stopped in for lunch, had some good beer. Ordered oysters, they came out fairly well chopped up, they were fresh and tasty, but the person who opened them needs more practice.  I ordered the beer battered fish sandwich. It was large enough, a touch greasy but tasty anyway.  The fries were not crisp, seems like they waited under a heat lamp. Portion was large, but I didn't finish them. An ok place along a touristy location.

oqkluKzWdyVu1Lkvf0zfZw.text: Stopped in last night because we wanted to 'step out' of our usual places on Carson St.  The place was rather busy and was pleasantly warm on a cold Saturday night.  We found seats at the bar and a friendly bartender greeted us and took our drink order.  The drafts arrived right away and we requested menu's...    We ordered 2 shrimp cocktails and a calamari.  The shrimp arrived within 5 minutes and came with a small bowl of cocktail sauce with a dollop of horseradish on top.  I mixed mine as I love horseradish but my friend would have preferred it on the side or in another bowl as he isn't a fan.  The shrimp were big and fresh and delicious.  I mean- can you really mess up cold shrimp...?  The calamari took over a half hour to arrive.  It was pleasing to the eye and smelled delicious.  It had grilled onions & peppers on it with a slight spice dusted on top.  I thought it was delicious but my wife wasn't digging it.  She thought it was overcooked & rubbery.  Our friend isn't a fan of calamari so we didn't have a 3rd opinion to be the deciding factor...  Then things went south... My wife went into the ladies room and came out with a straight up disgusted look on her face.  I saw her stop a waitress and after the 'chat' the waitress turned away and rolled her eyes.  Well, my wife said the bathroom was disgusting- Toilet paper & paper towels all over the floor, 5 stalls with only a half roll of toilet paper to be shared between all 5, no paper towels to dry your hands off after you washed them.  Does the employees have a separate washroom to use or do they use this one also and just don't notice???  The health dept signs say "Employees must wash & dry hands with soap & hot water".  Then I visited the Men's room and found almost the same thing- paper all over the floor in the stalls, I didn't notice if they had tp in there, and no paper towels to dry your hands with.    To us- the bathrooms must be clean & well stocked or we wonder what the kitchen & other 'back of house' areas look like.  If the bathrooms are in this much need of attention- the kitchen must be worse...    We paid our tab and left...

fAqBj1q1htNWtDtGqvpbCQ.text: Consistently good food and decent service. Not great and a bit pricey for what you get, but not too high and good food.

o7HJTkvKy5MxcP-5lykdRQ.text: Don't, just don't...the food leaves a lot to be desired. The steamed mussels arrived in a grey broth that looked like sewage water. The crab cakes were cold and overly salty. It was so loud in there, you had to scream across the table to talk. The saving grace was the friendly, professional waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The crab cakes came out cold and were so salty. Don&#39;t, just don&#39;t.

5Gc-v03v-rB4HqxGRECVQg.text: We took my dad to dinner here for his birthday. There were only 6 of us, and it was a Sunday evening - not too busy, but they seemed to be understaffed. We were able to be seated immediately, which was nice. All of the staff was very friendly. Those are about the only positive things I can say about our experience.   We all ordered appetizers. When the waitress brought them out she admitted that she had forgotten to put my dads order of stuffed mushrooms in. Actually, she didn't even remember what he had ordered so we had to tell her again.   My appetizer was Cajun shrimp, which was WAY over seasoned. I couldn't even see the shrimp underneath the thick crust of Cajun seasoning. It was at least 1/4" thick, and had to be scraped off. But there was so much that I couldn't even taste the shrimp at that point, only crusty dry chunks of seasoning.   My sister ordered oysters. She said they were not shucked/cleaned correctly, so there was grit in her oysters.   My dads stuffed mushrooms finally arrived well after salads. They didn't discount them or take them off the bill or anything, which I find annoying since the waitress admitted she completely forgot them and they arrived about 30 minutes after they were ordered.   As for our meals, it was a series of mediocrity and mistakes. My steak, which was ordered medium, was served well, as was my fathers. I chose to send mine back, which meant I got my steak after everyone had already finished their meals. My lobster tail was chewy and the "stuffing" in it was not very good. My father said his scampi was "okay".  My sister ordered the Pasta Di Mare - which she said was basically pasta covered in olive oil, which was largely bland and unseasoned, instead of a wine sauce.   My other sister had the crab cakes, which she said were bland and dry.  My brother in law had the lobster roll, which seemed to be the winner of the night. He said it was decent. Not great, but decent.   My sisters fiance ordered the seafood stew and he described the sauce as "milk, with old bay seasoning in it." He said it was "gross".   The mashed potatoes were great, everyone agreed on that.   I did see my sister pull a hair out of her salad dressing.   I also had a big ol fly land, twitching, right by my plate as I was moving my steak. I could have sworn it popped out from under the wilted piece of lettuce that my steak was served on...but my sister said she didn't think so. She killed it with a napkin since it seemed it was in the throes of death already.   The bathrooms were disgusting.   This is probably the worst review of a restaurant I've ever written. I feel bad because our waitress was really nice... But this place was just awful. I probably should give it one star, but I felt like the waitress was really trying her hardest to give us a good experience. I feel worse because now we need to take my dad out to another dinner to make up for this - he is not a complainer but I could tell he was disappointed.   We will not go back and will not recommend Roland's.

E_L474bpX9NkYzGHQ4YgJw.text: We experienced a mixed bag here!  The environment is pub-like and casual, which suited our mood.  Some of the food was wonderful and some was serviceable.  The Maryland crab soup was truly delicious!  The Garlic Parmesan wings were good but dry and needed more of both seasonings.  A friend got the Ahi Tuna which was overlooked and dry. I got the salmon which was good. Both came with delicious mashed potatoes.  The Caesar Salad was quite delicious. And the Sicilian Pizza was good but the chorizo chunks overpowered the pizza.  Another friend got the seafood stew which he loved.  The decaf coffee was excellent, a happy surprise!  All in all the meal hit some high notes and some middle notes.

PDnLimLIWTQTKgKRBJ4zew.text: Great Lobster And Cheese As Well As Filet Mignon Tips. Excellent Service. Excellent atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-Jg5MqVQBGJgWOqprT0FlQ.text: Food was good, but as the waitress cleared our table, she spilled a cup of Italian dressing all over me and was getting ready to run off not even aware (at least I don't think) of what she'd done, even though it splattered all over the table as it got on me.  When I made her aware of it, she didn't apologize, but got me a dry rag and when I asked where the restroom was, she said, "You'll have to go upstairs, the one down here is out of order".  While I was cleaning myself in the restroom, she asked my boyfriend if she'd done that and when he said "yes", she gave him dirty looks the remainder of the time, but said she'd deduct 2 lemonades off the bill (big whoop).  It wasn't until it was tip-leaving time that she finally apologized.  If it weren't for the fact that the food was good, I'd give it one-star.

RTXg9WGhGGQtfnpsaJ5qtg.text: Oyster and Clams were excellent. Main course was delicious and the beverages very cold! The bar tender was very nice and friendly. A very welcome site. Had a great experience. I would return.

UZFnpV2Tf37eAWuxR39EPQ.text: I should have trusted the Yelp review rating. Place was busy, so I thought I would give it a try. Ordered lobster bisque and lobster roll. Bisque was more like tomato soup with some fishy flavor, disappointing. Lobster roll was on a very thick toasted oversized hotdog bun, way too much bread. Lobster was like rubber (possibly pre-frozen?) and tasteless. Fries we're luke warm at best and tough. Trust the YELP!

Hwf8JQClzz7yIlSJv41C9Q.text: Steeler game this evening upstairs.  Crowded and noisy.  Bar service excellent and friendly, and accurate.  Layout is great.  Lots of brew on tap and many more in bottles.   Ate downstairs early then wandered in the strip district before returning.  Food service was also excellent.  This is an easy place to like.

pt8miJmr-FM-PAR-L0wAWg.text: My first time eating dinner here, will prb only go back for an app and drinks, Roland's is a seafood grill however the seafood we ordered lacked flavor. I ordered the stuffed crabmeat shrimp with broccoli and carrots... the veggies were over cooked and limp, the shrimp was ok but there was barely and crabmeat on my plate. My friend ordered the pasta di mare with white sauce. It was very bland, lacked flavor and sauce. Overall, we were very disappointed with our meal and wasted $60 on subpar food. Roland's need to step it up!! I would never recommend this place for dinner to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pasta Di Mare with white sauce... where is the sauce?? Very bland

YQJ1_45PcwoHnvBrkamFGg.text: Meh. Roland's seems like it would be a signature restaurant of the strip but it didn't quite live up to the reputation it has for good seafood. More like a grease fest. I ordered the lobster roll and the hubby ordered fish tacos. I can't say any of it blew me away, but it was okay. However, for the quality of seafood you're getting, I think the pricing is just too high. Especially when you're paying for mostly grease. The portions look huge but you're paying for mostly fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster roll

R26IUycU6oYJ7PRm91Euag.text: This is a perfect place to hang out, grab a beer and eat some seafood. They have great happy hour specials and a huge selection of beers on tap. The staff are usually pretty attentive but they do get busy in the evening, so don't take it personal. They have a great outdoor deck up top and high top seating right at the door. Their fried food is just your normal find but they do sushi, great steamed mussels and my favorite, their Caesar salad.  They add lemons with it, which I had never seen. Make sure you try it out and be sure to squeeze that lemon on your Caesar salad...it really makes the salad pop.   This place is good for all ages, food, decor and clientele. It is definitely on my To Visit list when people ask me about places in the Strip District. You cant go wrong by stopping in and enjoying all they have to offer.

SQ6d3ZrNy4tUDHPPAdBcJg.text: A group of three of us went to Roland's on a busy Sunday afternoon.   Being pretty new to the Pittsburgh area and having never been to the Strip District we walked along the packed street until we happened along Roland's. It had a good amount of people dining and people were in and out constantly as we discussed if we should venture the unknown. With what we saw in mind, we figured it must be ok.  We waited 30 minutes at the packed bar for our table. Once seated we were greeted by our very nice server Brittney who advised us of the specials and their specialities. One person in our party inquired about the "famous" lobster roll. We were advised they use real lobster and that it's loaded with big pieces of lobster meat. Considering two of the people in our party we're visiting from south Florida (a seafood rich environment), the seafood knowledge is vast. We ordered a bowl of clam chowder to share, a lobster roll, margarita pizza and some other entree that escapes me. Our drinks and the bowl of soup arrived within a reasonable amount of time but the entrees didn't arrive for 30 minutes from the time our soup came. To make matters worse the lobster roll and forgotten entree came out at that 30 minute mark but the margarita pizza didn't arrive to our table for another 20 minutes. Now, the food. Not being a huge clam chowder fan, I was very pleasantly surprised and we all thoroughly enjoy the chowder. The lobster roll is not "loaded with big pieces of lobster meat", it is a sandwich made with langostinos (not a lobster, not a prawn more like a crayfish or per Wikipedia - a relative to the hermit crab?!?!). The margarita pizza was ordinary, average and utterly forgettable. I ate a piece and a half and took home the rest. Unfortunately no one was interested in partaking in it after the fact so it was pitched. The unknown entree must have been ok because I do recall the plate being empty but again, I don't recall what is was. Following our food, we had a difficult time getting our check and had to hunt down a server on our way to the restroom. Which speaking of, there were three stalls if I recall and two of them were stopped up with, well, you know and the third had no toilet paper. My waiting friend kept telling everyone who lined up behind us to grab paper towels so they weren't paperless once they finally got in there. Advising the hostess staff feel on deaf ears because they both seemed to care less and gave my friend and unspoken "whatever" face and response. I do not believe I will be giving Roland's a second chance nor recommending it to visitors.

cMBdsUHnrihfmcFJXTPctw.text: I love Roland's! The lobster roll is SOOOOOOOO good! I've yet to be disappointed and it just hasn't happened. The fries are tasty and the service is always friendly and efficient. Thank you Roland's for not letting me down!

FwVFKaYSAL-eG7ocazvchw.text: Spending a beautiful day in the strip a few weeks ago culminated in a (what I'd hoped) was a quick stop at Roland's. Grab a beer, lobster roll and salad, and I'd be home before traffic. I was not so lucky.  I arrived and was immediately sat by a waitress that appeared to be extremely overwhelmed by the five tables in the patio. There were a few guests at the bar, being entertained by the bartender. I should have gone and sat there, but it was so nice out, I decided to eat on the patio.  My beer order was taken quickly, but then took twelve minutes to arrive. By that time, the head was gone, and it was losing it's cool. The waitress abruptly dropped off the beer and disappeared. I already knew what I was ordering, but she flitted around from table to table awkwardly for a good ten minutes until I made creepy eye contact with her and she shuffled my way. She took my order, and pretended to care about what I was ordering, but then disappeared again.  Forty minutes later my poor lobster roll arrived. The fries were mushy, and the lobster roll took six (SIX!) napkins to sop up all the grease. I ate it, but I wasn't happy. About three bites in (and with the fastest response time of my dining experience) here comes awkward waitress again, asking if I needed anything else. I decided on another beer. She then proceeded to ask me if I minded if she smoked a cigarette before she grabbed my beer. (WHAT?!) No. Forget the beer. Bring me my check.   With no tip for awkward waitress, I left. Probably never to return.  Happy Eating, just not here.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The greasiest lobster roll I&#39;ve ever eaten.
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sam Adams Summer Ale

D23vjRg94Dv0-XKAeRahEQ.text: We ordered the lobster rolls and some pizza and I was so disappointed. The lobster is not fresh at all it felt like rubber. The fries were stale and I'm fairly sure the pizza was frozen. The only good thing was that the waitress was so nice and kept checking on us.

3r-Nfy4ZGlv0mf5b5P_Ufw.text: I've eaten here a couple of times.  The best thing about it is the outdoor seating and the fact that it's usually open when other places around it are closed.   The food isn't great.  I've had the pizzas before they are not spectacular.  On the most recent trip, I went with my seafood loving friend.  He got the clam chowder and the Roland's Seafood Stew.  He said it was just ok.  Nothing special tasting about either of them.  I got the wings and a side of fries.  Wings were good, but the fries were nothing special.   It was just nice to sit outside on the sidewalk and find a place open on a Tuesday after a holiday.   We would come back if there was nothing else open and wanted to sit outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bowl of clam chowder
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Medium wings with a side of fries.
Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roland&#39;s Seafood Stew

WorgTK6XczaYETJwrnedqg.text: I had an ok experience at Roland's on a Sunday afternoon a few weeks ago...honestly nothing to write home about.    Lobster roll: the servings were really big and very different from the lobster rolls I've had in the past...the bread was really thick and kind of greasy (which wasn't bad, but it was almost too much with the lobster sandwiched between it)    Drinks: mid-day mimosas with one of my best friends were a positive touch Service: decent  Atmosphere: meh, nothing special

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Roll

Ykqi6vHENbtfnQs_GTWxlg.text: The lobster roll is the staple. Closet thing to a Boston style roll you'll find in the city! Food comes out quickly and staff is always friendly. Beer selection is good - whether you drink Miller lite, a double IPA or a bourbon barrel aged stout, it's probably on tap. Prices are totally fair for the neighborhood, plus 75 cent wings during happy hour! Outdoor seating is perfect for people watching! (Also if you're in the service industry, well... just go there after work. Trust me)

8ZW4JfTW03Ug0qhNUURtcg.text: Just OK and that's all I can really say because you will not be mad or super upset if you come here most likely but you will also not be blown away based off food and prices... just OK and definitely better options in the strip District for sure

aHnVeOXCFeBYfsr-T8Gnpg.text: Visited Roland's today for the first time in probably about 8 years. It is clear why I have stayed away. I ordered the "Poy Boy shrimp sandwhich" which was pathetic. It had about 4 tiny pieces of shrimp on it, with a ton of  breading to make them appear larger. It was served on a huge roll, which was about 6 times the size of the sad little shrimp. Also, the shrimp had no seasoning or taste. This entire sandwhich was basically BREAD, for $15!! The service was not good either. I told my waitress I was not happy with the sandwhich and she asked "would you like me to go tell a manager?" as far as I am concerned, a good waitress would just go tell her manager, not ask me if she should. It was obvious that she didn't care, and did nothing to fix the situation. I guess she is used to complaints. I will not eat here again.

nVqSa8BJaRLBfifykEYVCA.text: The food was fresh and fabulous. The service was great and friendly. It is not a stuffy upscale seafood place, but you would never know it by tasting the food. The lobster rolls were great with plenty of meat. The crab cakes were full of crab and not filler. The clam chowder was exactly the way it should be with a real clam in just about every bite. We ate upstairs, which seemed to be a little more casual than the downstairs area. There is a large bar too if you prefer to eat at the bar rather than a table. We unfortunately did not have room to fit a pizza, but they looked really good as well. It will definitely be on the list for a return visit.

gfqcAxvad8Rw9xYX_Td9Dw.text: Stopped by for a quick bite for the first time. Had Lobster roll and thought it was really good. Waiter was friendly and helpful and we didn't wait long, but they weren't really busy. I think I'll go back again.

6fP6S5hhbAmvX-iQX0iAMQ.text: I see the mixed reviews and honestly don't get it. It's casual but good food, large portions and a friendly staff. After 3 visits I feel like a regular with the bar staff. The pool table is free and usually available if you are looking to hang out a bit. The bathrooms are pretty bad and could use a facelift. Only reason for not getting 5 stars. The lobster roll sliders are awesome. Claw meat and big chunks of it. 3 sliders are enough to share one and still have enough as a main course. My companion raves about them to her friends. My favorite item is the Mussels. Priced a few dollars more than most places but you get twice as much as any place. A heaping pot full. There a 4 or 5 variations to choose from. Bring an appetite or order them for the table.  I haven't had the oysters yet but am anxious to try them soon.

EpN5a7LjQFFMRuBtUfK2xg.text: Friends warned me not to eat here. Turns out they were GOOD friends. This was just awful, start to finish. Slow (pitiful) service, nasty food ( and we each sprung for the lobster roll -- if you can call it that!) and a generally miserable experience. And this was an early lunch with very few customers around. The only thing remotely redeemable was that we sat on the balcony overlooking Penn avenue and were entertained by the people below. People watching can be a blast.   I wanted a draft beer and was told that "we don't serve draft beer upstairs". What??? There's a bar there!! Are you kidding me?? So water it was and that took a long time to arrive. And without straws - another wait after I had the audacity to ask for them.  The "lobster rolls" arrived and looked mighty meager. That's not a lobster roll!! But I pressed on. As I got it closer to my mouth there was a slight aroma. But press on. The "lobster" was sparse, tough, and flavorless. How often could you say that about lobster??? Exactly!! It must have been harvested years ago and waited for me to show up so it could make its way out of the freezer. At $15 each this falls clearly into the ripoff category.  And trying to get our check? Ridiculous.   I won't be back. Ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Roland's Seafood Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ETgvarXsvE1nOLSEAoVnmw.text: Visiting sister in hospital decided to have dinner here.  Salmon overcooked, pats de mare with white sauce very bland.  Otherwise nice atmosphere being in strip district.

GD92rAPzaDT9J5FK_6_Swg.text: There is not a more hard working and pleasant bartender then John H. And I've met too many to admit to. The 4-6pm happy hour oysters, clams and shrimp are so ridiculously underpriced - 60 cents!!! I only order the oysters as they've been top notch, shucked well. For all the peeps complaining about lobster roll - smart people order lobster roll in Maine. The seafood stew overflows with sea scallops, shrimp, clams, mussels and lobster. At 21.99, it's best value. Also filled with roasted potatoes and a roux that's the right level of spice. It's a feast!  I'm a business traveler and John is now a friend. 'Nuff said!  Update: the stuffed shrimp are also very good.

GBjxbN-yaF5V6eL9TsnPpA.text: Well I have had several meals over the years at Rolands, many of which were good.  Yesterday was not one of those days.  After being seated, it took nearly 10 minutes for a server to greet us and take a drink order.  I was of course rewarded with the wrong beer.  Then we order and when the food arrived, the fries were cold and the fish sandwich was rather greasy.  I wake up today only to be 'sick' from the whole ordeal.  My mother, who had the same food as I did, is feeling the same as me.  Get your act together Rolands, you are better than this.

IoBp5ymzP7M3loCuKEGWJA.text: I love Roland's happy hour! It's for a raw bar rather than the actual bar. 60 cent oysters, clams, cocktail shrimp, and wings. It's good and you can't beat the price. The downfall? The clams i got steamed and they were a little over done, and the oysters were left attached to the shell. But for 60 cents, I can deal with taking them Off myself. As far as service? We sat at the bar, he wasn't very friendly or rude, just meh. But the food came out in a timely manner.

cCnpTtKvRw7vEo0hmPRrcQ.text: We (3 in our party) stopped in to Roland's while in the lively and interesting Strip District. We placed our drink and food selections with the waitress. She brought our soups, which luckily had spoons in the huge bowls. All were absolutely delicious. The lobster bisque actually had lots of pieces of lobster and the onion soup rich, beefy taste with lots of onions. The clam chowder had tons of clams and the portion was large enough for a meal!!! Our shrimp appetizers ...fried shrimp and shrimp cooked in a beer broth were excellent. Unfortunately our server had no clue how to actually serve people in a restaurant...we had to ask 3 times for napkins and when they were finally brought to the table, she acted as if she was doing us a Big Favor. Then after our food was brought to the table and we asked multiple times for eating utensils. The first time we asked her we were polite, then asked another server, then when we asked at the hostess stand we were told "oh we told your waitress to bring them". When she finally brought them to our table she said "if you had asked nicely I would have brought them sooner". Can you believe that!!! The floor manager came over and while he apologized, also made excuses for her confrontational behavior.  5 stars for food and food prep, 0 stars for rude service or lack of service.

V5KcD72-qTCbXy-LdH9Prw.text: Consistently some of the best service, food and atmosphere in Pittsburgh.  A real Pittsburgh gem.

7hzNyX9d5g6KrGBMExXZIA.text: Fabulous beer selection, enjoyed eating outside, and great famous lobster roll sandwich. Thoroughly enjoy eating here and people watching in the Strip! And I've never had to wait long for a table even though they are always packed! And the waitstaff is very attentive but not annoyingly so.

Wpt3cdx0YkbaXGBVBqhPtw.text: Always my favorite spot to eat on Sunday's. The Mussels are what I crave when I dine here

rc4kmA_hpE53VZ_-a61qtA.text: Roland's has a nice, outdoor, terrace-style seating area on the second floor.  (This faces north, so it would be shaded during the day.)  Roland's also has a generous beer selection of very good stuff (relatively mainstream:  think Smithwick's, Hoeegarden, etc).  What Roland's does not have is a friendly bartender.  Nor table service.  Nor any substantial patrons at 11pm on a Saturday.  Which can be a blessing and a curse, really (the last one, not the first two; the first two are definitely just a curse).

M4rUXA5VzR5dfAJvAlDYSw.text: In the Strip District, there's not many options when you're hungry. Walking up and down, the Strip district is filled with booths of steelers and penguins gear. There was a breakfast place and Primanti brothers that was packed. So we were dying for some food and ran across Roland's. We got mussels and banana peppers stuffed with sausage for our appetizers. I also got a lobster roll. They gave us a lot of mussels slathered with garlic and butter. Surprisingly good. And the banana peppers were not bad too. I also enjoyed my lobster roll. Buttered toast and big chunks of lobster meat. I had no room left to finish off my fries.   Now, I can't decide if the food was average or below average as we were pretty hungry. I'll give Roland's the benefit of the doubt. Don't expect anything spectacular, just food that fills your belly.

OSxlQqAxUPaKu2kGN6ahrw.text: I went here with my boyfriend and another couple for my birthday dinner. I looked at reviews on this site and I was surprised to see all the bad ones. I had been to Roland's once about two years ago and remembered loving their food. I now know why there were so many bad reviews. I was really disappointed and had a really terrible birthday dinner. The only reason I gave this restaurant two stars is because our waiter was fantastic and was so attentive. I am a waitress myself so I appreciate good service so much. Anyway, I got crab stuffed shrimp with broccoli. The shrimp were so small that they should never be stuffed with anything. And the amount of stuffing was a joke because of it. My broccoli was basically raw. My boyfriend got Ahi Tuna which he normally loves. His tuna was so rubbery. It was horrible. His broccoli was also raw. I never complain at restaurants but I told him he could send his tuna back if he wanted to, but he didn't "want to be a jerk". The other couples food wasn't as bad as ours but it wasn't anything great either. I get some restaurants don't have great food, but the worst part is Roland's menu is fairly pricey. I believe my dinner and my boyfriend's dinner were around $25 each. They need to lower their prices significantly to reflect their food or do some work to improve their food. I will never go back to Roland's.

lo9K1nDbbHMK36XBcyGBfg.text: Poor excuse for seafood!   The place is overrated.  Good place to have drinks on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon-but that's about it.  The employees are anything but friendly. Unless you sit at the bar, the service is poor. Isn't even that great at the bar.  If you want good seafood, go a couple blocks up the street to Luke Wholeys.  So much better quality!  This place is definitely not for those with sophisticated palates!

_UB9DO_VdF1A0PUqpM7YHg.text: Poor service. Monday evening. restaurant not busy. Took 15 minutes before someone came to take our drink order. Ordered a draft and a glass of wine and proceeded to order a lobster roll and steamed mussels. Took another 10 minutes to get the drinks. The lobster roll then showed up and we had finished and the plate was then cleared for the table. We had then been in the restaurant for an hour and we asked for the bill. The waitress then proceeded to say the mussels were ready. We canceled the order and the bill came with a quick huff and sign the top copy please request as she quickly turned away. Not worth wasting your time.

OvSN2hPavN5hGN5i4NvgrA.text: Fish was not cooked thoroughly. The middle folded over still had wet batter. ALSO their beer glasses have a heavy glass bottom and about 2 ounces less product when they serve in their glasses.

Oz0Z1B-b8Dc9hpxVymc44Q.text: Awful service and food. We got there around 830. Supposedly the restaurant closed at 9, even though we called and said they were open until 11. At 830 the kitchen was already cleaned up. I heard them making rude remarks to each other, about us, because they were angry we came in and they had to mess up the kitchen again. The waiter was rushing us as well.. We ordered our food very fast. He didn't ask how we wanted our meat cooked or anything . I got Ahi Tuna. On the menu it says it comes with a salad, a vegetable, and choice of mashed potatoes or French fries. 20 minutes later our food came out, and it was a huge disappointment. The food was awful, overcooked, and lacked any sort of good flavor. My father's lobster role was shredded pieces of lobster , overdressed, and stuffed into a bun. My sisters filet mignon was cooked to death, and the worst part was mine. The tuna steak tasted like canned tuna. It was strong, and severely overcooked. There was no sign of pink anywhere through the tuna. We will not come back, and anyone thinking about going here, don't! There are much better places to eat in the city of Pittsburgh.

u22q9hJ1Kf2MEtc0djFRTA.text: Great lunch!!  Lobster roll was fantastic, service was just right, beer cold on a hot day.  Sit outside if you can!

_5XcHiHDTfAbq5_5CzKhDQ.text: Here for pre-booked party, not near enough wait staff or bartenders. Very disappointing for business that had been around a while.

s7ccMBwtydYTm_Lkb8_n1w.text: Lunch on a Wednesday with 4 people. Lobster rolls= excellent!  Crab cake sandwich= excellent!  Yummy, warm fries! Very good service and warm food!  Was worried when we saw poor rating on Yelp. Very happy and will come back!

6UKWJ814S-A-VbFO4_GHjg.text: Not as good as Wholeys but awesome patio and the best service. Go here for the atmosphere, the staff is the best.

z8Ulp0nx9gCoVAtQllRRGw.text: There were 3 of us on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Surprisingly Roland's was 3/4 full. With 3 waitresses. They were RUNNING to fill orders.  The fish was hot and crispy. It was fried but it was good. The French fries with it tasted as if they were fried in the same grease or an oil that should've been changed several days ago.  The Mussels were OK.  But the Clams Casino were inedible. The clams were served raw with a burnt bread crumb topping. The crab cakes were also bad. Both went back.  The waitress never asked if we wanted something else or if the rest of the meals were fine.  The New England Clam Chowder was good but overpowered by the smoky bacon that was added to the soup.  No, we won't go back..the food was lackluster(better fix at Wholleys) and the service was terrible. It took 20 minutes to get someone to take the bill.

8yy09lxSZvR8fKxlTmYatw.text: First off... I didn't even get bread as a starter while i saw everyone else around me have it at their table. !!! Second off the waiter got confused when I was in a party of 15 like can't you make separate checks dumb bits. Speaking of bits, the meat served on the "Filet Mignon Bits  Sandwich" was as dry as my DMS. I asked the waiter for "French Onion Soup" and she kept coming out with a damn "Clap Chowder" ??? My girls pasta was as hard as my poop ? It wasn't even creamy! I asked for butter.  Comin on UP with that "cheese pizza".... too MUCH DAMN SAUCE! LIKE I know Rihanna say "you know I got the sauce, you know I'm saucy"... but the sauce just took over the thin ass bread... couldn't enjoy it. Did I mention?  Extremely horrible service.
