Never would I come here again. The food was awful. The end. Bone African feet.

SByJ_WFTZIY0Tzh5Rbnzfw.text: I went here on a Friday afternoon for lunch with some coworkers. We were a party of 12. Even though the restaurant was busy, they were able to get us a table. Apparently there is a second floor room that can be rented out for parties, but they don't take reservations.   The interior of the building is nicer than I thought, judging from the outside and other Yelp reviews. They have a lot of large televisions, which would make this an ideal spot for watching a game.   Our server was very pleasant and friendly, but some of the staff has that native Pittsburgher gruffness, which some people might translate as rude. There do seem to be some staffing problems, though. A latecomer to our group asked another waitress clearing a nearby table if she was our waitress. The woman said "no" and walked away without offering to get our server. It was a little weird. Our waitress also had people at the other end of the table yell their lunch orders, even though it was very loud. She could have easily walked over, so that was odd, too.   Not being in the mood for fish, I ordered the white pizza. It was very large, much bigger than I expected. I ended up taking the leftovers with me, and it fed me for two more meals. So, while the prices are a little more than you'd expect to pay at a similar restaurant, many of the portions are huge. Two people could easily split the fish sandwich.   The pizza was pretty good, with a paper-thin crust and plenty of tomatoes and pungent garlic. I think the garlic was from a jar. The cheese was a tangy blend.   All of Roland's pizzas are oven-fired, and some of my pieces of crust were burned black. This may be a plus to some people, but I don't much care for it.   In all, it was a decent meal, and the rest of my party seemed to be happy with their food. I'd like to come back here and try some other menu items.

sYBf0enPLhLvdzOEB9NImA.text: Love the lobster roll.  I like to stop in here on Mondays for 0.60C raw oysters and a bloody hoe.  Makes a great after work/pre work-out snack.

sLAVs2qz8xcc48jjuEMBkg.text: If you're into mediocre over-priced sports bars with average food, slow service and cackling hyenas, this place is for you, hands-down.

ihbnxnCC_8bicEkkIP7xJg.text: I ate here one night after going to Pittsburgh Winery and Maggie's Farm Rum because I, you know, needed some food. I'd never been in Roland's before, but a friend insisted that we go there because it is less expensive than Luke Wholey's. We sat at the bar. The service was fine although we had to ask for food menus. Maybe the bartender figured that if we wanted food we would have gotten a table.  I got the lobster roll and was really disappointed. It looked good and was on a huge hunk of Mancini's bread cut about ninety percent of the way through to make a roll, but the lobster itself was tough, rubbery, and overcooked. All I could taste was the garlic butter. Granted I'm a little spoiled because I once lived in New England, but a seafood restaurant should know how to cook lobster so that it isn't flavorless and chewy. You do get a good amount of food for your sixteen dollars as it comes with hand cut fries and cole slaw, but I'd rather spend the extra money elsewhere if the food quality is better.

uI_3JUOhd-FPfE7yfBMYSg.text: OMG what a nightmare. I was there last saturday at 9pm with a group of 10 people in the second floor bar area. The bartenders acted like it was a big inconvience that we were there. ordered drinks and didnt even get a thank you. the bar was dirty and littered with dirty glasses. The restrooms were filthy and didnt even have toliet paper . We left the bar and spent a HUGE anoun of money up the street.. I will never go back.

e8fagzaVxc5xt-KOqtelRQ.text: While in town for WWE Raw we spent many hours looking for somewhere to eat in Pittsburgh.  We stumbled into this bar/ restaurant that stuck out like a sore thumb! I told the manager, please seat me on your patio. We started with beer battered and fried calamari, which was really good, tentacles and all, (some pieces could have been cooked a little more). We were sold on some Brick oven pizza which really hit the spot, the creamy Alfredo pie w/ roasted garlic and the BBQ chicken pie. The beer and pizza combination was worth searching restaurants on Yelp for 2 days to find it and leave a review! Keep up the good work guys!

6FLOoavos4Df0qbWhzWNQg.text: So last evening a group of 8 of us waited for a table, not very long. However once we got to the table was when things got worse. We were seated in back room with one other larger group...which is probably the reason we were forgotten about all night long. We probably waited about 25 minutes for anyone to even come take a drink order, then waited about another 30-35minutes just to receive our drinks. Several of us also asked for waters multiple times in addition to other drinks...never got them the entire night. The waitress waiting on us was rude, like it was a chore to order ANYTHING. I'm sorry, but that's your job. Appetizers took roughly an hour and a half to get. When she finally asked if anyone needed refills or anything else, she asked half the table and ignored the other half. As she brought the drinks for the rest of the table I asked for a drink and SHE LAUGHED IN MY FACE. Are you kidding me? I can understand being busy, but I walked out to the restroom, and the restaurant was not even full! But to disrespect a customer to their face for no reason....I will be hard pressed to ever step foot in there again let alone recommend this place. I don't know if the staff changed, the management or what but I do remember this place being enjoyable several years ago. Obviously things have changed for the worse. My wife's food came out cold, yum, but our friend, whom ordered the exact same thing was brought his piping hot as if my wife's had been sitting there for who knows how long. Toward the end of our meal the waitress came back and attempted humor stating, "What can I get you now that I have time for you"...?! Foot in mouth, perhaps that isn't something you should say to the people leaving tips. Overall terrible experience, service left to be desired and just down right rudeness is unacceptable to me. I am very disappointed in how things have changed with this place. Perhaps some constructive criticism to the staff would be helpful as to how to treat their customers. Be very hard pressed to step foot in this place again...

YrTkOOyrSP3sl-L74rDS9A.text: I went here for the first time on Saturday night. I had to go & try the famous Giant Fish Sandwich! When it arrived, I was impressed. The fish was even bigger than I expected & the batter was perfect. Also, the beer menu is lengthy! They serve beers from almost every corner of the world! I thought about trying something new, but turns out I was homesick for a good old Pennsylvania beer... :) Roland's is definitely a cool place in my book. I'll be back! :P

GciNJMic9qmqBXrS44UtcQ.text: My favorite bar in the Strip District.  Timeless classic that never goes out of style.  They had a remodeled a few years ago, which opened the front of the restaraunt and they they've created a patio of sorts that is perfect for outside dining when the sun decides to shine.  Excellent seafood options, and you'll never go wrong with the lobster rolls.  The hot lobster roll is served on buttery Mancini roll and melts in your mouth.

8iydqh1zCj-djOv2yJHXdw.text: NEVER AGAIN!!!! Horrible service and horrible food! It took 20 minutes for our waitress to even come to our table! Looking back on it, I don't know why we didn't leave... maybe because we had to wait 20 minutes to even get a table (this was during the summer). We ordered the muscles to start off which were okay but definitely not something I would recommend. My husband ordered the fish and chips and I ordered the crab cakes.... EPIC FAIL!!! The crab cakes were so disgusting my husband and I had to switch meals. The crab cakes taste like fried mayo... I couldn't even taste the crab! The fish and chips looked great but it didn't taste like anything! No seasoning at all! The waitress was so bad that when it came time to give us our check, she was no where to be found. It took 15 minutes to actually get the check (keep in mind we already finished eating)... thank God we had cash! A complete waste of $40. Yes, I remember exactly how much I spent even though it was months ago because I kept thinking how I could have spent that money in a better place! I could have got a mani & pedi... had some great sushi... the list goes on. lol

Ihjp7dPf5EJGQs5Y2jX3fg.text: went back here last night and the service was extremely slow.  in fact our waitress may have been tipsy.    we waited for a solid 20 minutes before receiving menus.  we asked for drinks at least 3 times.  thankfully, our food was good and made it out after we ordered at a somewhat normal pace.    the calamari was good and enormous in portion.  it comes with a side of marinara with red pepper flakes.  i liked the kick.  it's garnished with sweet peppers and pamesean cheese.  yeah for the calamari!  hence the 3 stars.

7uF6uMOQDvNU8OTQfu8tvQ.text: Another place that I visit once every few years thinking it couldn't be as bad as I remember it.  And the place NEVER lets me down; it's just as bad as I remember.  The seafood is breaded and fried to the point of inedible.  The staff is rude.  The prices are too high for the quality.  Just all around disappointing.

8Mm-p375ecciHs0PPBqecA.text: Okay, so it's not been my favorite week.  And after contemplating a dive off the Ft. Duquesne bridge, I followed some ex friend hag's advice and decided to get out of the house to go do something!  Now, being a typical woman, she suggested retail shopping therapy.  But I'm not one to blow my budget out of the water over a broken heart/bad-man-done-me wrong deal.  No way.  So, I go to Roland's.  Now, I'm not saying that they are better then a 1-800 help-me hot line.  But, they come darn close.  I had one of their famous hot lobster rolls.  Sure, David (hot & sweet little server) suggested that I consider having the cold roll, but no, I'm a woman.  I do not listen.  Hot, hot, hot.  Amy is right.  The buttery rolls do melt in your mouth.  The strawberry margarita wasn't half bad, either.   Actually, it was totally awesome.  While it didn't entirely make all my problems go away, it made me forget about them for an hour or so.  And so, life goes on.....

o1kWyrf8CwYMSd_IBHHW0w.text: This is a great summertime place.  I have been going to Rolands since I turned 21 a decade ago.   The beer selection is one of the best in Pittsburgh if not the best.  And, I agree with Jason P. in that the best sandwich in the burgh is the lobster roll.  I prefer the cold lobster roll as opposed to the hot, but they are both awesome.  It's a very generous portion of lobster on a garlic bread roll.  They have a very good raw bar with oysters, shrimp, crab and other goodies.  The outdoor seating is awesome.  Sit upstairs and look at the passerby's on the street at the strip.  Saturday's and Sunday's afternoon are the best time to visit.  The pizza is also pretty good, brick oven and thin crust.  The seafood stew is a great deal for about $15 you get a delicious broth and lots of fish and shellfish.  The bartenders are great.  It's pretty well known that John the Irish guy is the best bartender in the burgh', however I think he only works one day a week now.  Bo is very good and my buddy Jeff is also a good tender.   They have pool tables and darts, so plenty of bar games.  The only reason I don't give this place four stars is that they don't have all the top shelf liquor that my heart desires.  They have new management since my buddy Rick went to Bettis bar.  And, they are lacking in some liquor selections since.  They don't have patron or any top shelf rum.  I ordered a top shelf long island iced tea yesterday and was disappointed to taste cuervo instead of petrone.   However, overall the place is a good time and a must visit in Pittsburgh.  Get the lobster roll!

2Ez3VPd47JGv_hv975J-Uw.text: I was immediately displeased by the snaggle toothed hostess and her surly demeanor. The air conditioning was non existent, which is a hangover nightmare. While waiting for a table the bartender ignored us for ten minutes and couldn't even transfer our drinks to the table. He also casually instructed me that one must pay per beer - duh! I'm not a beer drinking novice. The acne-ridden server was friendly enough, but seemed forlorn and was overtly sweating. Bringing drinks to a table isn't neuroscience and I don't drink tap water. After sitting at our table for a few minutes it was very apparent that the entire serving staff is haggard. Appetizer - crab artichoke dip. Bland. Where's the crab? Also, did a toddler arrange the plate? Apparently. Meal - fish tacos. Came quickly and surprisingly flavorful. However, our server never once checked on our status and we had to beckon him to fulfill our needs. I shouldn't have to ask for napkins at the point of need. No tip, never coming back.
